about_host:
My 2 bdrm apartment is on the 2nd floor of a quiet, vintage co-op building, overlooking a pleasant courtyard.  I allow only one guest at a time, so you don't have to worry about other strangers in the apartment. (I occupy the 2nd bedroom).  A single, female traveler will feel safe and be comfortable here. If you are visiting the University of Chicago - or visiting your UChicago student who hasn't enough room to host you - my location will allow you to walk to your destination. My apartment is probably the Airbnb listing most convenient to the Chicago Theological Seminary. 

I realize that a lot of older people - like me - are hesitant about trying Airbnb, but you will be pleasantly surprised at how drama-free the experience can be. The key is to read the listings and reviews, then select only the ones that meets your safety, location, and comfort needs. Decide if you want an entire apartment or simply a private bedroom - like mine. Determine if you are comfortable with other travelers staying in the apartment or if you want to be the only guest during your visit - like my place. Airbnb hosts want you to enjoy your stay so read the entire listing (including the House Rules), look st the pictures and maps, and then ask any questions you may still have - before you book. 

Please let me know the purpose of your trip to Chicago so I can determine if my apartment or Hyde Park location is (or isn't) right for your visit.  I may even be able to suggest a more appropriate location. In any event, I will answer your inquiries quickly and honestly.

Incredibly creative(Kathleen) and stunningly amusing/disturbing(Craig) Chicago artists who have to work for a living. Dog and cat unemployed. As good Chicagoans, all four of us support Obama (Hillary), so if you're Republican, you might want to stay somewhere else, ...like, uh, maybe Kentucky. Just to clarify, we've been to Kentucky and it's a very nice place to visit.  Would never live there.

We have been running this vacation rental for many years now. It is a business we started not knowing what we was getting into. It has been a wonderful experience meeting guests from all over the world. We have a lot of repeat guests and groups for graduations, weddings, family reunions, business, etc. We also get a lot of International guests from Europe,Mexico & Canada

Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing at more than 40 units throughout the city in or near every neighborhood.  

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City. Wicker Park is a frequent hangout, where we tend to be pulled to the patio at Big Star, the bar at XOCO, and cocktails at Violet Hour. 

And free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

Outgoing people who love people and exploring new places.  
We run a pretty laid back house, with the expectation that guests are responsible adults. 

My Life's Mission: Love, Joy, Peace and Grace In A World That Works 4 Everyone!

Lois' favorite quote:

" A person who is a master in the art of living makes little distinction between their work and their play, their labor and their leisure, their mind and their body, their education and their recreation, their love and their religion. They hardly know which is which and simply pursue their vision of excellence and grace, whatever they do, leaving others to decide whether they are working or playing. To them, they are always doing both."
- James A. Michener

Ed is an ecologist studying the interaction between things and stuff.  He is on his fourth career, having previously been a hardware man, a bicycle mechanic, and a college student.

A favorite quote: " Everyone is entitled to his opinion, but not to his own facts" - Daniel Moynihan

host_location: New York, New York, United States
about_host: NYC

Best in the city with long-time urban-dwelling hosts available to give you the skinny on most things Chicago, while allowing you complete privacy in your own large, separate suite area, accessed via a private stairway.

Luxurious and pristine accommodations with a modern décor in the heart of Chicago’s Lincoln Park – perfect for business or leisure travelers. Located in the spot center of lively city life, it is minutes from the Loop, Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park.
Enrtrepreneur, Business Owner, Avid Traveler, Athlete, Snowboarder, Beach Lover, Adventurer, Wakeboarder, Chiller, Runner, Swimmer, Beer Lover, Life Liver!

We love helping people find new homes, whether it is for a few nights or 3 months.  Chicago is an incredible city and we appreciate your trust in us and our furnished apartment homes.  We look forward to making your  Chicago experience a memorable one.

Travel is fun and exciting but can be hard on the wallet.  It doesn't have to be that way.  Email if you have questions, especially if your requested dates are in the near term and I will do my best to work with you!

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

We love to travel on a budget, no big hotels for us. We do our best to experience our trips like locals. We love the outdoors, hiking, camping, and having visitors. You will find us most times digging in the yard or enjoying a cold beer(s) with friends. 

Mat is self employed and works from home.  Randy has been a Kindergarten teacher in public schools for 22 years.

Airbnb brings travel to us and we LOVE IT!

I live in the apartment and am easy-going and respectful.  I do my best to be helpful with advice on the city and to be around to answer local questions.  

I enjoy travel, movies, playing with my cat and exploring cities - including my own, Chicago.  I grew up on the West Coast in the wine country southwest of Portland, Oregon.  I went to university in a small school in Indiana, and ended up staying in the Great Lakes region, first a couple years in Minnesota and in Chicago for the past 20+ years.  I've lived in my present place, in the River North neighborhood, for 12+ years now and really enjoy it for its close proximity to so much in the central area and excellent access to transit, while my building still manages to be quiet and peaceful.

I've traveled a fair bit myself, having visited over half of the States here in the U.S., plus Canada (Toronto), Mexico (Yucatan, Cancun, Mexico City), Panama (Panama City), Spain (Madrid, Barcelona), Puerto Rico (San Juan, Vieques, Ponce), France (Paris, Lyon), China (Beijing, Shanghai, Nanjing, Hangzhou, Hefei), Sweden (Stockholm), Switzerland (Geneva), the Netherlands (Maastricht), England (London), Austria (Vienna), Norway (Oslo, Bergen, Haugesund, Feoy), Finland (Helsinki), Turkey (Istanbul) and Russia (Moscow, Tver, Novgorod, Leningrad, Khabarovsk, Novosibirsk, Irkutsk) (was still the U.S.S.R. at the time) and Andorra.

I do work full-time outside of the home, but my office is nearby in the event of emergencies and to aid in flexible check-in times.

Hi! We are both local business owners in the neighborhood. Mike is a Massage Therapist and Veronica is a restaurant owner.
We've been an Airbnb guest and host for a few years now and made some great friendships, as well as met some pretty wonderful people! 

Mike loves to create music and explore art/new music/explore/eat pizza, bacon, cheese, and anything with potatoes. I also love spending time with my dog Piper! She is a sweet 3 year old (Shepard mix) who loves to do tricks for treats and really likes people who like dogs :)
Veronica makes art, draws and works at her restaurant just down the street from the house..you should come by!!!

If you are bilingual in English/Spanish, "Yo hablar un poco de español" with you, since my girlfriend has inspired me to take lessons for our trips to Mexico City. She also owns the best Mexican restaurant , just down the street.  Hasta luego!
We are easy going, relaxed, have a sense of humor and are helpful in many ways to all our guests.

I grew up in Kentucky, lived in LA, and currently call Chicago home. I am obsessed with traveling, meeting new people, and going on adventures of all kinds with my friends.  

Some of my favorite cities include Paris, Berlin, Medellin, New Orleans, and Copenhagen.  Some places I am dying to visit are Morocco, Istanbul, Tokyo, and London.

I am a stylist and event producer.  I love hosting, entertaining, and providing a great experience for anyone visiting my city.  Other things I love: my funny dogs Bunny & Goose, flea markets & thrift shops, road trips, late nights and early mornings, photo booths, and champagne.  I always say yes to fun.

I am an easy going, flexible host.I want my guests to feel comfortable to ask for my help when needed and to feel at home. I let my guests do their own thing unless they need my assistance. I work at a non-profit as the Manager of Volunteer Relations. I've traveled all over the world and love the idea of hosting other travelers. My travel experiences range from staying in First Class hotels to BB's or homestays.   I've lived in the same apartment for over 20 years and feel comfortable in helping visitors with things to do in Chicago.

Hi, I look forward to meeting you! 
***Update: please note that after years of hosting amazing, incredible people, I had my first unfortunate group of guests who turned my home into a party house, disturbed the neighbors and damaged my possessions. Fortunately, airbnb mediated the claim. In retaliation, the guest posted my one and only negative review.  Please be assured there are no issues with the cable and internet! ***
I'm an entrepreneur, world traveler, foodie, yoga fan but don't do it as much as I should, collegiate fencer, Australian Shepherd Frisbee Champion Trainer, Italy Enthusiast, and love sailing on the waters of beautiful lake Michigan. I'm a low key, drama free individual, and will give you your private independent space, but am there to help you with any questions to make your stay more comfortable!
Married, 3 kids.

Entrepreneur, traveled the world, designed most of the  soon 6 properties we offer for rent always striving to offer the best service to our guests,
Please do not get offended when someone else handles your inquiry or request, we are all trying our best to accommodate you

Artist and Teacher, landlord, home owner, optimist, living the good life!
Born in Texas, lived in Toronto, Paris, and Austin, + have traveled extensively and have friends visiting from all over the world.  The best experiences of my life were the unexpected surprises of new people in new places, including trips to Zimbabwe and Macedonia for an artists' residency.

I believe in a life well lived, and am open to the adventure of new people passing through.
I am a licensed Real Estate Broker in the state of Illinois.

Hello! My name is Julie.   Welcome to my airbnb page for my home.  I built this home a couple of years ago and have loved every second of designing it.  This last year my work gave me the opportunity to work on a project in Amsterdam and I decided to rent my home on airbnb while I'm away enjoying my new European lifestyle! Since I used to normally live in the home full time, there is everything you can possibly need from pots/pans to spices, towels, linens, etc.   

I am looking for renters that can care about my home as much as I do, which means to treat it with respect.  If you are in Chicago, it's probably for a vacation and I expect you to have fun, just please do it responsibly.    

If you are interested in renting my home please remember it is a 3 night minimum.  I will not rent to those who have not filled out alll of their verifications so please remember to do so.   I'm sure you will love my home as much as I do.  Please feel free to reach out ot me with any questions you may have about the property.

Thanks!

I have a small family (partner, Dave and daughter, Frances, 14) and a passion for nature and travel. I prefer a small cafe to a trendy restaurant, and like to spend my free time hiking, biking and gardening (ok, Dave is the gardener). I spent big chunks of my '20s and '30s in Europe, Asia, Africa and the Middle East, but travel is harder these days with a school schedule so I have been exploring the States, Mexico and South America little by little.

Creative Chicago native with an amazing space to share. been hosting via Airbnb for well over 7 yrs now and absolutely love it. an avid traveler myself, i very much enjoy meeting new people and helping guests get the most out of their time here as I have been in my own travels.
On a hiatus from interior design consulting,.. I am an artist and a quiet extrovert. 
This space is a very special home with a serene and peaceful quality about it that happens to be in the center of the Wicker Park/Ukrainian village happenings. I love it here and thus far, most everyone who has stayed does as well!!

Welcome! I'm a nonprofit/freelance professional living in (and loving) Chicago with my two barky, wonderful dogs Lois and Clarence. Live music, films, and art of all kinds are my favorite things, next to bicycles and dogs.

I enjoy all too infrequent travel (and love to stay in interesting Airbnb homes!), cooking, organizing projects, and meeting new people, and I hope you fall for this great city and its neighborhoods during your visit with me. My place is always a work in progress - very homey, humble, and (I hope!) comfortable, and just a short train ride to downtown.

Conceptual artist loves to explore... 

I've traded homes with artist friends from all over the USA and Europe and have shared spaces with dear friends and acquaintances long before airbnb was created (airbnb now expands those possibilities!). I think this is by far the most interesting and rewarding way to travel and experience some "there" there. I look forward to hosting and staying. 

I live in a 1880's  workers 2-flat converted to an apartment on the second floor and art studio on the first floor in the Historic Pullman neighborhood in Chicago, IL. I have a small organic food garden in the back and love to cook/prepare; raw, vegan/vegetarian, organic/healthy/gourmet - I'm not obliged to any specific diet so I enjoy lots of different foods and flavors. I try and learn one new thing a year - last year it was learning restoration of 1880's slate roof/facades with a craftsman and architect friends. This year, bringing artists to Pullman and Pullman to artists. Next, maybe exploring more permaculture ideas/trends.  

I have an absolutely lovely girlfriend who travels with me whenever possible (Amy). She is a social delight and has a wonderful way with people/cultures (like insisting on learning/speaking Spanish when we explored Spain). She offers a genuine ease with meeting new people and a welcoming charm. You'll like her.

Looking forward to meeting you...

-jb

I've lived in Logan Square since 1999, Wicker Park and Bucktown since 1988.  Some people call us 'old timers', some just say old...or maybe pioneers?  
My point is I know this area well and I love my city.  I've seen countless live bands here in Chicago, all kinds of genres. I've worked in the music scene and I know lots about what to do in Chicago and don't mind pointing you in the right direction for anything from shopping to entertainment, thrift stores, food, culture, acupuncture, spas, etc. I may even give you a ride there if I am not doing anything else that day.  

I thrive on art, music, architecture and designing my little house for the enjoyment of myself and my guests. I am pretty much always working on some project here (in my head or literally). I would say I am not a mainstream person and thus pretty open minded.  I am looking forward to meeting some fellow travelers and giving them a soft place to land for a few days!  I've really enjoyed meeting some guests already and look forward to more!  

I also enjoy traveling (often alone) and consider myself an outstanding and thoughtful guest, and generally pretty low maintenance. Having hosted myself, I try to always leave my space clean and fully respect all the house rules.

Travel addict who has decided to settle down in Chicago for a while after living in India for the past 3 years.  Born and bred in the south (Oklahoma) and lived in Dallas for 13 years before moving abroad.  Love spending time at the beach, on the slopes or anywhere with my closest friends. Always looking forward to new adventures and making new friends.

Italian-born professional based in Chicago who loves to travel around the World! 
I'm fluent in English, Italian, Spanish, German, and Portuguese. Feel free to contact me with inquires about my AirBnB rentals.

I'm originally from Thailand and have been living in Chicago area for over 30 years, and know the city inside out.  I love Chicago for its diverse ethnicity, theaters, museums, entertainment venues and restaurants.  I love scuba diving and go back to Thailand every year.  I used to work for Accenture but retired now.  My other hobbies are golf and pickleball.

Hey everyone! 

Thanks for checking out my properties, I hope you'll come to stay! 

A little about me: I'm a 39 year old professional photographer, traveler and serial entrepreneur. I've Sailed from Panama to Fiji over 7 months and solo cycled New Zealand and Australia for 6. I spent 4 weeks on a spiritual hermitage in India, trekked around Europe a bit, bushwhacked around the jungles of Panama treasure hunting 16th century Spanish artifacts, and have fallen in love with Cuba, twice. 

I recently lived in Costa Rica for 18 months but now live in Guanajuato, Mexico, developing several businesses. 

My life motto is, 'What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?' And I'd eat guacamole or hummus every day if at all humanly possible! :)

I lived in Chicago for 9 years, and I've lived in Guanajuato now for the past 14 months, so I'm happy to recommend all the best bars, restaurants and activities (and tourist traps to avoid). I love giving local advice so please feel free to ask! 

And if ever you need anything, I'm always just a quick call, text or email away!

I hope you enjoy your visit to Chi or GTO, and I look forward to sharing my homes with you!

Cheers,
Dana
Originally from Spain, I am an educator that has been living and enjoying Chicago for some years. I love movies, cycling and swimming, and knowing people from other cultural backgrounds.

A little about me...

People tell me I am easy going, social and love people.  My passion is outdoor activities.  I'm married (to a beautiful wife and I have 4 "almost" grown-up kids.

We enjoy family, traveling, downhill skiing, outdoor recreation, and the exciting city of Chicago.

About Us: We are very easy going and laid back. I would love to meet and have other easy going Airbnb travelers share our apartments. I will do everything I can to make sure that all guests have a good time in Chicago.  I have so many different properties I stay at different locations time to time. You may not see me much if I'm staying at a different property or you may see me every day if i choose to stay at the property that you're sharing. Sometimes for my shared apartments you will be staying with other guests that are from the same Airbnb website. I require all guests to have VERIFIED Identification prior to making their payment uploaded to Airbnb website.   If you need anything or have any issues make sure to let me know so that I can help  :)

If you have any special requests please feel free to ask! :)

Guests I'm looking for: Easy going guests, quiet and respectful guests that understand that you will be staying in my home and that this is NOT a hotel. I expect all guests to respect my home and keep it clean and follow the rules. (Make sure you read all listings completely before you make payment). 

My Apartments: They are all very nice in good locations and clean. I do clean all locations before and after each guest stay. Since this is not a hotel there will be no daily cleaning services or room service :)

Favorite Foods: Steak, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Pizza!

Favorite Actors: Any Nicholas Cage, Johnny Depp, Arnold Schwarzenegger 

Favorite Vacation Spots: Jamaica, Cancun, Miami FL, California, (anyplace warm!)

I live in Chicago with my husband and three children ages 5 and 3 and 1.  I am a stay at home mom.  I left teaching middle school Spanish to raise my children.  My husband is the owner of Chicago Bone Broth, a Movnat trainer and wellness coach.  We love good food, adventure, traveling and meeting new people... airbnb has helped us to continue to do this and share in all of it with our children.  As hosts we enjoy meeting travelers from around the world and giving them a clean and equipped place they can call home while they are exploring the area.
I'm a /broker/writer/photographer living Chicago.

I am a proud resident of the Logan Square community (since 2000) and the city of Chicago (since 1995).  As an avid traveler I love getting insider tips from locals.  As a host on Air BnB, I love giving great tips to guests.  Other interests include- travel, food, live music, urban hiking, Cubs baseball, drinking good coffee, welding, craft wine/ beer, reading, biking.

I am an outgoing person that loves to travel, go out, and have fun.  When I am home, I am quiet and cool, usually reading, grading papers or watching TV.  I am easy to get along with because I love people, especially children.  I love to dance, workout, and entertain guest in my backyard (in the summer). I love sharing my home with visitors because I enjoy meeting new people!

Co-Founder of Chicago-based Medical Devices company.  Former Head of Marketing and E-Business at Audi as well as former Global Head of Internet Marketing at Motorola.  I am guy who likes to travel and stay in the centers of great cities but not stay at hotels that lack local character and charm.  Married with three kids. Cal Grad--'90.

Love Chicago, lived on the north side for most of my life, St. Louis for college, I am very social and active. I participate in community events, sitting on a Master Plan committee and President of our blockclub. Learning guitar and spanish, love Zumba and Dance Chicago, have great friends and family. Love to travel, soon to use airbnb for European trip. Live by the lake/beach, once its warm, I bike the lake.

Hi, I'm hailey. I love snacks and bicycles and honey bees. 
More than anything I am laid-back and easy-going, and would love it if you made yourself at home.
Cheers!

We are two friends who bought this building and lived in it for 8 years.    We completely renovated everything for our own comfort.   You will find many great amenities that you won't normally find in the average rental.

We are lifelong Chicago residents and we are glad to help you enjoy your stay in our city.   We have an extensive guest guide that we will send you that will give you our best ideas for dining, shopping, and transportation around our city.     If you need some advice or have a question, we are here to help.
I live and work in Chicago, I am originally from Croatia Europe

Easy going gal here, been a Chicago resident for 12 years and from the Midwest. I am in the Ad Tech industry and work downtown Chicago. One of my favorite things about traveling is meeting great new people, hoping to replicate in my hometown by accepting guests into my home. I am into travel myself, been to some fun places around the world and here in the states.  

More than happy to give you local recommendations and suggest ways to make the most out of your visit to the wonderful city of Chicago. Living with me are two lovely pets. A very friendly large yellow lab and a quiet cute tabby cat. I am a clean and respectful person and my animals are well behaved and trained. 

Staying with us will be like staying with family. My dog will become your friend the moment you walk in the door.  I like my place comfy, feel free to lounge on the couch and watch TV or sit on the balcony and enjoy a nice beverage. We want you to enjoy your time in Chicago and feel like you are home.
Love: my 22  year old son; cooking; movies;  outdoor space; Pontooning and sailing with my boat-owning friends, Chicago Bears,  travel; and my good, good friends! I'm excited to be part of Airbnb!
I grew up in chicago so let me know if you want any info.

I am a photographer and my husband is a writer.  We have lived in Hyde Park for 35 years and raised two children here.  We run, bike, and swim with our two labs, Ella and Finn, and love to hike.  We have lived in this apartment for 17 years and did extensive rehab. We garden in a community garden in the neighborhood and do a lot of cooking.

We are from Chicago and we love living in the Hyde Park neighborhood. Jon teaches, trains and works for community renewal in Chicago. Amy works with several non-profits and manages family and home life. We enjoy books, travel and walking along Lake Michigan.

After living in this beautiful city for 18 years, I have discovered some unique places- I think you will find it as amazing as I do, regardless of the season. My home is a GEM in the heart of the city! If you are new to Chicago, I can leave a list of all of my favorite places as suggestions for you to visit, dine and see, both on and off the beaten path.
My wife and I are global travel junkies.  We've been to over 60 countries, and maintain a wanderlust for exploring new destinations and encountering new friends. We look forward to welcoming you!
Chicago is such a great city. I run a not for profit arts organization here. I love to welcome people into my home to and information about the city so that you can have a great time
I am a web designer. I am originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 20 years. Love this wonderful city. We are friendly, well-organized, easy-going, and clean.

Man of the world. Travel and art are my life.
Like museums, theatre, music. Especially classic. Foodie. Very social and easy going.
Two degrees. Three languages. Meetup enthusiast.
Love to meet new people.

As a life-long Chicago resident, I know the city well and can tell you best places to visit, where to eat, what to do and how to get there. 

As a professional writer and consultant -- and the mother of two young-adult daughters-- I am especially aware of and understand the challenges and rewards of women traveling alone. My favorite cities include: New York, Paris, Toronto, Florence and Venice. I think any mode of transit is good if it gets you to your destination reasonably on time.

As a host, my job is to make you comfortable. I can chat or be quiet, offer as many or as few suggestions as you like and listen to your travel stories or share a few of my own.
I am a Chicago native.  Ask me if you need any recommendations.  I love the Cubs, street festivals, our restuarants, bars and coffeehouses.  Happy travels!!!

I am an actor and human beatbox based in Chicago.  I grew up in San Francisco and was raised in the Haight-Ashbury by a painter father and a violinist mother.  I have three one-person shows: MeTube, From Tel Aviv to Ramallah, and Sountrack City.  My wife, Rachel Havrelock, writes and directs my shows.  Since coming to Chicago, I've dedicated myself to the harmonica and to creating a new form of Hip-Hop Blues by fusing beatbox and harmonica.  I love traveling and bringing my musical form to people all over the world.

Rachel is a professor of English and Religious Stuides at the University of Illinois at Chicago.  She specializes in the Bible and the Middle East.  We have a four year old daughter.

I love cooking, making sushi, gardening, watching HBO, and live music.

Hello everyone!  I'm Jonathan and my friends JD, Ellen and Joey have been hosting on Airbnb for about 5 years.  We are proud of our city and our apartments and really want you to have a fabulous time during your stay with us.  We have attempted to create an easy low-key guest experience that really helps you feel like a local, plus providing the best bang for your buck, and and I hope we have achieved it!

Hola! I cannot  wait to meet you. I have lived in Chicago for the past 50 years, so I really know the  neighborhood. I am a retired Montessorian who owned a Montessori 3-6 children's house in Pilsen, the first dual language Montessori program in the Midwest.
Hosting for Airbnb has been great fun!  I have met so many nice and interesting people from around the world and look forward to meeting you!
I am self employed and work out of my home so I'll be available to answer any questions about the neighborhood or the city. I look forward to making your stay in Chicago a restful one.
Music Lover

We are a family of four, my husband Vince is a teacher and I am an artist, our two daughters are in college.  Our house is on the North side of Chicago, easy 20 minute trip by bus or train into downtown.  Between our house and downtown is Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park Zoo and several beaches.  In our neighborhood you will find great restaurants both award winning and ethnic (or both!), theaters, music venues and shopping within 5-15 minutes walking.  We love to eat out, hang out at the beach, go to see music in the local clubs and visit art shows around town.

I am a friendly and laid back foodie, who enjoys music, live theater,
and great wine . If you like any of these things, then this is your neighborhood!
I am self employed in the healing arts.
I love to travel, and on my last vacation I used Airbnb in both Madrid and Lisbon. Fabulous experience ! I signed up for Airbnb in 2012, but never activated my account until NOW.
This should be fun ! I look forward to meeting you...

I love travelling and meeting other travellers.  I can make your stay in my city a little bit more comfortable and leave a nice impression of Midwest hospitality.  I just want my guests to know I am sincere and provide a clean, safe, comfortable space to re-charge for the next day's adventures.
I am a graduate of the University of Illinois in Business Administration and own a floral and event company in Chicago.

My family of four lives in the top unit of the two-flat. We spend a lot of time walking or biking around in our neighborhood (we happily have no car). You can often find us out front, sitting on the bench, swinging  from the tree, or just chatting with neighbors. We love visiting other cities where we can stay in interesting neighborhoods without the hassle of needing a car. We think our place is well-suited for others  who appreciate urban neighborhoods.
author + artist + social entrepreneur + community activist.

Midwestern urban farm girl who appreciates art, architecture, travel, good food and good friends. I wear many hats, among them interior decorator, writer, corporate marketing veteran, vintage/antique dealer and landlord. I've owned my Logan Square property for more than 11 years and have lived in Chicago on and off for the last 25 with a stint in Washington, DC. I am excited to welcome fellow travelers who like to explore "off the beaten path" and proud to welcome them into my home, which is my pride and joy.  

My personal recent travels include a long weekend in Detroit, some great hiking in Park City, Utah, a very long break on Kauai and some urban fun in NYC.
I'm into sports, travelling,  and meeting people from different places
I'm awesome!

I am a comedian who moved here from Seattle a couple years ago.
In Seattle I was actually a dog trainer and fitness boot camp instructor, and a comedian on the side-- so I decided to flip that script! I have a small well behaved dog (12 lbs) and I love to laugh!

Hi everyone!  Tracy and Josue here. :) We've been living in Chicago for quite some time now. Beautiful city to travel to! A little bit about us. I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try my hand with new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

I am a professional violinist, small business owner, and a lover of all things creative.  I've traveled to Europe, Middle East, Russia, Mexico, and all over North America and love meeting people from different cultures.

From Chicago. Lovers of food, booze, travel, friends, bikes, books, people (most of them anyhow) and general merriment!

Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments. I was born and raised in California, moved to Chicago 20 years ago.  I enjoy travelling, biking, improv, cooking and volunteering.

From Heather: "My day job is managing programs at an international organization and I loved how hosting gave me a way to meet so many people from around the country and the world. In addition to travel, I also love decorating and home projects. 

Our hosting motto is a quote from JRR Tolkien -- "Not all who wander are lost."
As you set out on your wandering adventures, we hope you feel at home here in Chicago.

In a nutshell, I am a fun 30s fellow who lives in Chicago and does high end interior design work.  

I have always been interested in showing hospitality to others.  Before airbnb this was mostly done by inviting friends and others over to my home for dinner or cocktails....but I find it equally rewarding to be able to host a traveler and know that my home with influence their trip for the better.  

As I am getting older I have decided that I really want to travel and see more of the world...but limited finances (coupled with my refusal to sit int he back of planes) as well as a desire to really get to see how people live and just not how tourists are treated makes this a great option for me!  

I have quite a few different interests, but I am very into anything design related (architecture, shops, urban life) and am an avid collector of mid century furnishings and love modern art from around 1910 to 1960.  I am happy to have one black cat (I like cat's but one is just enough to keep it interesting) and love to entertain friends often.  I am also a sucker for British TV, and you will often find BBC America in the background.

I was lucky enough to have the New York Times recently devote two entire pages to me in their home section, making me sound much more interesting in print as compared with in reality and publishing some lovely pictures of my life.

Oh, and my favorite color is that of a wet seal.....greenish gray and shiny!

Performer/Professor/Journalist/Former Chicago Concierge from New Orleans living in Chicago for 30 years.  Lived in France and the Middle East. I'm a nice girl who keeps busy running a cinema and teaching media theory. I bike this city up and down, bake tasty treats, adore non-fiction, and play the cello so badly its embarrassing. I like traveling solo and conversations with strangers.

We enjoy travel, cooking, beer, walks around the city, and exploring the nooks and crannies of our neighborhood.

I'm an arts enthusiast and entrepreneur in the Chicagoland area.  I feel fortunate to be part of such an exciting and vibrant world class city!

I have been hosting for airbnb for a good few years now, and I love meeting people and making them feel at home at my place. Chicago is my hometown, and as much as I love to travel - Europe and the southwestern US are the most frequent places I go - nothing really compares to the down to earth yet often cosmopolitan culture we have here. I love sharing my city with other interesting/interested travelers.

Attention concert/music festival goers! While I very much support and appreciate the appreciation of music, this is not a good match for hard core drinkers/partiers. It's not a come-stay-get-waisted-trash-it kind of deal. If you are coming in town for an event (of any kind, really) you will be expected to leave the place as you found it, not be disrespectful or disruptive of other guests, the neighbors, OR the space.

We live in the residence with our two preteen children. The neighborhood is bustling with a mix of young families, seniors, singles , hip , not so, and everything in between. Eat and drink at  a number of establishments just a few steps away. We love our neighborhood and you will too.

My name is Janet and I am a native Chicagoan and know the the city well. I am also interested in studying energy in groups and social systems both here and abroad. I like alternative medicine, meditation, art, theater ,good food  and also to hang out with friends. During weekdays, I am hardly ever at home,often only to sleep.  I am open-minded and very sociable and if you are interested in learning about the city and restaurants and sights to see, I can be a valuable resource.  If you have any question or need further information please contact me I will be pleased to answer you.  It is helpful to know something about you and the reason for your visit to Chicago.   There are some guests that are here for the first time and are interested in local restaurants, ideas of current activities in Chicago while others are here visiting family and friends and want only minimum contact. 

The unit is separate and has its own temperature system and I am not readily available in the building as I am working.  So you will have access to me via texts and there are a list of emergency contacts within a few minutes of the building.  We like to make your stay as comfortable as we can..  
Warm regards,  
Janet

Hi there!  We're Lois and Eduardo! She's from Kansas, I'm from Argentina, we met in Spain, and now we live in Chicago!  (¡Hablamos español, por supuesto!) We have lived in the Chicago area our whole lives.  We are a family of 4, with two young boys.  We love to travel, our favorite places are the Hawaiian Island of Kauai and the Riviera Maya region of Mexico. We enjoy good food; we love to barbeque and picnic.

Hi!  :)  I'm Jason- a friendly, hyperactive, short and energetic fellow from the MidWest who loves building stuff and going places.  I'm a "people-person" from a family of world travelers; 4th generation Chicago cityboy with experience working in museums, hotels and ecolodges around the globe. 
Chicago history, architecture, and preservation are big interests of mine, and I take great pride in caring for the historic properties my family has lived in, owned & maintained for decades. 

I love AirBnb.  We have traveled, backpacked, hiked, camped, hoteled moteled, couch-surfed and home-shared... But AirBnb has been the single best thing to happen to us in our adult lives.

When we travel, we turn to AirBnb first, whether internationally, nationally, and in our own hometown.  From the glitzy new city experience to weekend trip to some small town in the country, we prefer staying with those in the AirBnb community.  The experience is always unique and always more authentic.

We are AirBnb hosts and consider it central to our lives here in Chicago.  Because my family lives in Chicago, one of us is always in the city, often while the rest of us travel. Any repairs are handled immediately. A while back, when I was moving from the building we own, we decided to open it for AirBnB guests. Now we have progressed to having vacation rentals within the building where we live.  Living nearby with my partner Alyssa allows us to keep in great touch with our guests, maintaining the gardens and accommodations ourselves, as well as hosting occasional art, music and dining events. 

I love this way of traveling and hosting; meeting the folks who come to stay with us is precisely what fuels me on the day-to-day, and it's what makes our vacations so much more enjoyable!  We've met hundreds of incredible people and stayed in fantastic homes across the world.  AirBnb has been such a great chapter in our lives!  :)
Friendly, respectful and outgoing. I’m a host too so I know how to apply to rules.

I’m Savannah, photographer, artist and art collector, legal consultant. When I'm not traveling, I call the Historic Bronzeville community of Chicago home.  I have many passions, but travel, photography, food, and wine are at the top of the list! I've been all but seven states in the USA. I have stamps on my passport from Morocco, Egypt, Ghana, Jamaica, Aruba, the Bahamas, Cayman Islands, Amsterdam, Panama, Costa Rica, and Ireland. I love taking solo road trips in my Jeep. One of my most memorable was driving the stretch of Old Route 66 from Chicago to AZ and visiting the Grand Canyon two years ago.  

I enjoy entertaining, conversation and stories. I can't tell a joke to save my life, but I do like a good laugh. I like sci-fi and well-made zombie movies. I admit to being addicted to collecting many things: books, design magazines, film cameras, masks, and art are just a few of my obsessions. I am a Chicago native, born and raised who'd never traveled beyond the continental US until I decided I was long overdue for this rite of passage and booked a trip to China two years ago.  Since then I've been to Scotland and am currently enamored with exploring the landscape of my native land and have taken several trips around the continental U.S. recently to explore the Pacific Northwest (but especially Oregon), scramble about the boulders and gawk at the Joshua trees in the Mohave Desert in California, and looking forward to tackling the topography in Utah soon. I've been teaching English (language and literature) at a local, public high school for over a decade, which affords me summers off and breaks during the school year for travel (although not the salary to stay in four-star hotels along my journeys).  I inherited the house I grew up in and have worked on transforming it into my dream home over the past few years (which I realize would be perfect for sharing with fellow travelers).  I currently share this space with two aging Siberian Huskies, who are perfectly content to live a mellow life in the city.  Having recently discovered a penchant for fitness, I enjoy spending my time engaging in physical activity and exercise, especially running.  As for other personal pursuits, I enjoy the creative outlet cooking allows me almost as much as I love idly surfing the 'net on my iphone wiling away precious hours that could've been spent finishing one of the several, partially read, non-fiction texts scattered throughout my home.  Adventure awaits; cheers! ;)
I and my husband are artists and our son is all about playing baseball.

We are a fun and laid back couple with a family of pets.  Michael is a graphic designer and a craft beer aficionado.  Jackie is an interior designer and chocolate cake enthusiast.  We love to explore our city and share our favorite places with each other and visiting family and friends.  We're happy to recommend places to go and help you find fun things to do!

I am a massage therapist and esthetician living in Chicago. I love to travel and enjoy meeting other people.  I love Chicago and everything it has to offer.  The summers in Chicago are amazing.  I love going to street festivals and trying out new restaurants.   I can be found most weekends on the dance floor dancing West Coast Swing.

Greetings!

We're Divvytrekkers, proud members of the Airbnb community and DivvyTrek (follow us on Instagram), which is at the intersection of travel and real estate, committed to balanced and healthy living—mind, body and soul.  

We love to see the world and interact with interesting people from everywhere given that travel is our passion, having savored the rich aroma of stew in Ilorin, Nigeria.  Taken in the sunset with St. Lucia's Piton Mountains in the background. Climbed the steps of a Mayan Temple in Central America. Feasted on freshly caught lobster along Maine's southern coast.  Gazed upon the faraway valleys high up in the Andes from the heights of Manchu Picchu. 

These are only a few of the amazing places we've enjoyed together. 

We also take delight in great music and experiencing cuisines from around the world, in addition to hosting.  Of course, providing a unique guest experience takes a lot of work. For this reason, we have the help of Airbnb's Valorwings service which makes hosting fun and easy.  With Valorwings we believe it's possible that everyone can be a host.  

By the way, we highly recommend downloading Acehopper, Airbnb's "front desk concierge", to explore the area. Available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, Acehopper has tickets, guides and tips on must-see places to visit. 

While our exciting careers keep us highly engaged and quite busy, we always find time to enjoy life and share experiences with the amazing people who choose to stay with us when we're at home. 

Thus far, we've had the privilege of hosting guests from Afghanistan, Argentina, Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, China, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Iran, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Nigeria, Philippines, Qatar, Russia, South Korea, Spain, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, and from all over the United States.  The list keeps growing! 

See you soon!
