I am also an Airbnb host myself, so I have a deep understanding of both what it takes to host and what it takes to be a great guest.

Who would have thought when I boarded a plane for Greece more than 20 years ago, planning on backpacking through the mountains and then heading north through then Yugoslavia I'd end up making Greece my second home?
But here I am, 20 something years later, running a fabulous Greek vacation rental business with historic homes & penthouses in Athens, planning Greek travel itineraries and leading small group food & wine focused tours around my adopted homeland and loving the life that I am lucky enough to be living. Of course I did pick up an equally crazy, workaholic Greek husband along the way, as well as a stray Greek animal or two!

Update: End of November 2017 .... This year Basil and I celebrate 15 years opening our Greek vacation rentals to guests from around the world. All these years we've been hopping between Basil's home city, Athens and Carole's home city of Chicago.  Time and time again guests in Greece ask us if they can stay in our Chicago home while we're in Athens.... so we're finally doing it - we've just completed the renovation of a fab old factory with 3 vacation rentals called the Magic Factory Lofts. We've got 3 and 4 bedroom homes in the heart of the city with Big Shoulders -  in our hybrid warehouse (which in a previous life housed a bar and a dance hall, followed by a costume and magic card factory and then a photography studio where probably every Butterball turkey advertisement in the 1980s was shot .... the photos, not the turkeys!)

So come stay with us ... and then stay with us again. Whether we share an ouzo in Athens in our Acropolis View Alpha Plus penthouse or Sky Villa or a beer and a hot dog in Chicago, in our Magic Factory Lofts  we know that you won't be disappointed.

The owner has lived in Chicago's Gold Coast for 20+ years.  A graduate of Northwestern University and the University of Chicago, he is passionate about the neighborhood and will serve as your guide to the best restaurants, outdoor events and, especially, live music!

We are a family of 3. Chicago has been our home for close to 20 years. Irena is a visual artist; Martin owns a frame studio. We love to travel; always looking for an inspiration and are always exited to meet new people. 

We have put a lot of dedication and hard work into remodeling of our spaces. We love to host somebody who will appreciate and treat the apartment as their own. Our space is very universal and will definitely satisfy your needs. It can serve a family, small group or as a romantic getaway.

host_location: Roger's Park on the North side of Chicago 6 blocks from Lake Michigan.
about_host: We have lived in on the Northside of Chicago for over 20 years and wouldn't live any where else. We love the neighborhood and its diversity. We enjoy hosting guests and assisting with the quality of their stay.  We are also so glad about our proximity to awesome beaches, Loyola and Northwestern Universities. We are lucky to live here as we do which is why we want to share the experience. Welcome.

I am from the Netherlands,lived in Germany and Switzerland before I came here.I have three daughters and five grandchildren,my husband was from Greece. I still have family in Athens and we had one of the girls baptized there and an other one got married there.When my middle daughter studied in Florence ,Italy we  went many times to see her.I enjoy art and good food.I like to read love a good book,enjoy the movies and have a subscription to the Lyric Opera and try to go to as many concerts as I can .
We are not far from Wrigley Field and if i can't go to a baseball game there I will see it on the t.v. I like sports,golf ,tennis ,soccer.The little kids here play soccer and I go to their games.
I love Chicago and I have lived here now for over 50 years which was not my intention but this place is very international and very welcoming and I stayed.

We love to show travelers around Chicago as much as we like to travel. When Tun isn't teaching at a public school and CC isn't editing and writing magazine articles, we're rock climbing or eating our way through the city. Together, we've been to over 45 countries and lived in five. 他會說漢語, y ella habla español, if you need a translator. Come stay in our urban oasis!

We are married couple, originally from Nepal. Living in Chicago for the past 10 years. We love outdoor activities, good food/drink and traveling. We are big foodies and love exploring different restaurants in Chicago. We welcome our guests to come and enjoy this amazing town. We are more than happy to host you and help with any recommendation in the city. !! Cheers !

Our goal is to make sure our guests feel comfortable and enjoy their stay, time, keep learning about hospitality and grow our experience. Thank you for the opportunity to host you!

Armando
Ana María
Casa 6528
Studio 330
Casa Anita
Condo 1531 &
Casa 2916

Hi Everyone! 

I am a Chicago native born and bred. I love showing off this amazing city and live in one of the most happening parts of Chicago...steps from Fulton Market and the best restaurants in Chicago, literally right above the Grand Blue Line stop so you can take advantage of public transportation and all the city has to offer.  

I live with my wife and baby daughter and we typically go to my parents house over the weekends, but please don't hesitate to reach out if I can be at all helpful!
I have been here for 7 years and have so much pride in my neighborhood and park side home that I just have to share it.  I am a designer / independent boutique owner in Logan Square.

Mindy // College Professor. Currently teach Animation + Motion Graphics {after effects}, Computer Graphics, Creative Collaboration & Materials and Resources. My husband and I love art, fashion, music and food.

Tony // Carpenter + Artist for many years. I have rebuilt, remodeled and out lot's of love into the iKlektik House. Camping and biking is my thing.

My wife, Nubia, and I are from Chicago.  We love to travel, discuss politics and go out to eat.  I am an accountant and my wife is an attorney.  I speak some German and enjoy camping and mountain biking.  Nubia enjoys cooking and likes to read.  She is fluent in Spanish and can also speak some French.

Lisa, Caitlin, and our son Lars live in Chicago, IL, USA. We loved traveling in Airbnbs so much we decided to welcome visitors in our spare room. When we were ready to stop sharing a bathroom with guests, we found an opportunity to offer our guests a full apartment. We love meeting people from all around the world and giving them a place to live in our corner of Chicago. Lars was born in 2016 and has given us the chance to provide family-friendly amenities to guests traveling with babies. 
 I speak a little German, and Lisa speaks a little Turkish, but neither of us speak well enough to try and answer your questions about Chicago!

Michigan native who moved to Chicago right after graduating from the University of Michigan for work. I enjoy traveling as much as possible and my hobbies include rock climbing, yoga and scuba diving. I am always open to meeting new people and love hearing other people's life stories
Originally from Los Angeles but currently residing in Chicago.  I love the city and all of the amazing things it has to offer. Museums, theater, awesome restaurants, and bike rides by the lake.

My wife, Diane and I are long time Chicago residence. We love the city and what it has to offer. 
We built the Coral Reef Beach House in Florida 10 years ago and have enjoyed sharing it with guests over the years. 
We have owned and lived in our two flat in the Lakeview/Lincoln Park neighborhood for 28 years. We have rented the 1st floor apartment as a vacation rental for the last 8 years and we have enjoyed hosting guests from all over the world!
It is interesting to have an urban vacation rental and also a vacation rental located off the beaten track out on a bridge-less island in Florida, North Captiva Island. 
We rent vacation rentals when we travel and always enjoy the personal touches and uniqueness of each accommodation. We look forward to sharing our properties with our guests. 
So if you have interest in staying at either of our properties please feel free to contact us with any questions. 
We look forward to your stay! 
Mark
I am an artist with a love for language and new cultural experiences. I am kind and warm with a preference for books over devices and people over profiles.

We are clean and neat freaks that have hosted over 2000 different sets of Airbnb guests from all over the world in our Chicago apartments!. Our apartments are in the south and west loop of downtown Chicago. The museums, stadiums (United Center, Soldier Field, etc.), and McCormick Place, Thalia hall, China town, University of Illinois, University of Chicago,  Rush university, Medical district are all close and easily accessible. The magnificent mile is: 9 minutes by bus and 5 minutes by taxi or Uber. 
 
We are friendly people who enjoy meeting new friends and traveling. We have lived in the Caribbean, London, and New York before moving to Chicago. Came to Chicago primarily for school but then we loved it and decided to stay. Yes, we love Chicago, and even the winter is GREAT! Good food options are unbelievably amazing in Chicago.

I have multiple apartments on this website. Some of the apartments are  3 bedrooms, bathroom, living room, dining room, and kitchen. Some are two bedrooms, bathroom, living, and kitchen and the others are 1 bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. We provide additional airbeds if needed. The airbeds are extremely comfortable and are queen size and 18 inches high. 

All the apartments have free WiFi, guestbooks, and basic amenities such as TV, iron, iron board, refrigerator, hair dryer, with water, pop, and juice, microwave, coffee maker, cups, plates, pots, pans, bathroom towels, shower items, etc.

Airbnb is extremely fun for us since we are also international.  We have traveled to most of the states in the US, London, Milan,  Italy, Turkey. I have also attended Universities on both sides of the Atlantic (London and Chicago). 

Favorite music are Reggae, R&B, hip hop, Latin music, country music. I love to eat and my favorite food are fish, fruits, and vegetables. My favorite sports are rock climbing, archery, diving, soccer, and basketball. 

These days if I am not out with friends, I am with family, or spending time on the computer. My life motto is working hard and taking care of health!!!!!

I moved to Chicago in 2002 and live here with my lovely husband in the Avondale neighborhood. We love flowers and growing our own vegetables like you can see in our pics and also make our own honey. For that we do have 2 beehives in our backyard.
We love to have people from all over the world in our house and treat them as we would treat our own family. Often we do have a BBQ or a meal together and also share  a breakfast. I love to bake and so you will find all the time a treat and can stop for a good cup of European coffee. We also love animals and have our self 3  cats and 2 birds. If you wish to bring your pet also, please let us know and we do our Best to make it possible.
We are both strong believers in the christian faith and love to travel to places like the library of Billy Graham in NC or the Bill Gaither studios in Alexandria, IN. We love to watch Seinfeld and anything else what is funny and we consider our self as very outgoing and easy to live with people.

Originally from Dallas, moved back to Chicago for work  (went to college here).   I travel a lot for work and play.  Love Chicago, but the weather takes some getting used to, especially for a southern boy like me.  

I do a lot of exploring for fun when the weather is nice, and eat and drink a lot when it's not.  Checking out Chicago for a foodie is great, because the possibilities are endless. 

Overall I'm a very laid back dude and I live by the Golden Rule.  My momma taught me well.
Marketing kids from Wisconsin who've just returned to the Motherland. Love the Packers and Badgers, great people, and anything outdoors (or indoors if it's raining, duh).
I'm from Connecticut, but have lived in Chicago for about 13 years now.  I lived in Rome, Italy for a couple of years.  My wife and I love to travel and are interested in seeing everywhere we can.
I'm a professional interior designer who works in downtown Chicago.

Single Father, Web Programmer.

Hope you have a great experience in my house in Chicago!

Chicago musician, vocalist, wrestling coach and educator. Tour guide in the summer upbeat grandfather. 
Love music, dance, comedy, film, sports, dining out, house parties with games. Work with youth and thos over 40 yrs. 
Travel is business and pleasure. Have aspiration of retiring in film and fashion industry.

As an avid traveler, I've used this site many times, and I also know what travelers appreciate while away from home. My goal is to provide you with the most honest, comfortable accommodations—I want you to feel the way I do when I'm at home. 

I love experiencing all kinds of culture. To date, I have been to 47 states and 39 countries on four continents.

I am originally from Michigan and live in Chicago now. If I could get paid to go camping for the rest of my life, I would do that...but I can't. I love camping, I love music, I love biking. I really enjoy a good beer and playing some guitar. Someday I hope to make a living off of playing music and owning a small language school. 

At our space, you can expect privacy, and a relaxed environment. We have hosted travelers from all over the world, and since traveling is our passion as well, we treat our guests as you would a friend, with respect.
Datus is a tax consultant and Stacey is an early childhood educator. They both enjoy hiking, scuba diving, traveling, and good conversation with new and interesting people.
I lived in Chicago for 16+ years, and can tell you a  about  neighborhoods. I am a mom of two young children. We are pet friendly and love to host people from other countries.

I am a resourceful and detailed host who was born and raised in the city of Chicago. My passions include Chicago House music, street art, graphic design and tacos. Any destination with warm weather, clear water, and a beach is a place I want to be now.

I've lived in Chicago all of my adult life so I know the city very well. I can enhance your visit to the Windy City with lots of great advice and ideas of where to hear great music, enjoy wonderful inexpensive food, find great shopping and make the most of your time here. I've traveled to Europe, China, India, Nepal, Mexico, Canada and throughout the U.S. and love meeting fellow travelers! I also love Chicago and want everyone who visits to get to know the city in a personal way. I'm an artist/designer, as well as a yoga teacher. I welcome all considerate, thoughtful guests who want to share my home.

Someone once told me, "Find a Job You Love and Never Work a Day In Your Life!" Well, in 2005, that is exactly what I did when I opened the doors to Chicago Guest House.  So, if you're the type of person looking for a unique & memorable experience --someone who appreciates spaces with a 'personal touch' then you've come to the right place. This business is my passion and I think it shows!


Find a Job You Love and Never Work a Day In Your Life!
I got lucky that way and I think it shows!

The Elect Lady Grayer is the Founder of the Works of Elohim International Inc.  She is the Director of the Omega Mansion/Bronzeville, an Entrepreneur and Author of Books: "Don't Shoot - I'm Already Wounded," "Morning Glory," - Book of Poems, "A Mother's Love" - Keep Sake Journal, and "Come and Dine" - A soulful Cook Book, and others to come.  Passionate Worshippers of Yeshua/Jesus.

Hi! We're Laura and Joel! Laura is from Miami, Florida and Joel is from Lansing, Michigan.  We are both in our late 20s and moved to Chicago to be actors.  We are always in a play or auditioning for our next gig. We met in school at Columbia College Chicago and got our degrees in Acting.  We got married in September, 2015. 

During early mornings to afternoons Laura is an executive assistant for a recruitment firm and Joel is a licensed tour boat captain.  At night, we are performing.  We are almost always in rehearsal or performing in a play! 

We are super friendly, fun and outgoing. We're social butterflies and we absolutely love hosting!  We really enjoy meeting new people and helping them experience our beautiful city.  As actors we are really open-minded people and love being around a diverse crowd. Chicago is an exciting city to be an artist! We have a wonderfully supportive and talented community of friends. When we aren't hosting Air Bnb guests, we love to invite friends over to rehearse some theater or join us for a dinner party or BBQ! 

We are year long bike riders, we love listening to Radiohead, we enjoy cooking yummy vegan meals, and we are totally obsessed with Breaking Bad and House of Cards!

Scott: professional opera singer. Travel is a large part of my life because of my career; I love to cook when in a good mood and clean when in a bad one. Finding great restaurants, attending performances of music/dance, and museums/parks are my favorite things to do while not home. Usually travel with my yoga mat, music, knitting, and lots of manners.

Nik: pastry chef. When not getting down and dirty with sugar and fats,  I like to run or bike around the city. Coffee and whiskey must be around at all times. I'm pretty quiet and reserved but occasionally unveil a dry/crass sense of humor.

Howdy,
My name is Henry.  I'm a longtime resident and local restaurateur in the neighborhood.  I enjoy hosting Airbnb guests and giving them a warm welcome to the city.  

Most people would say I'm easy-going personally but enthusiastic when it comes to hospitality. My focus is enhancing your experience in by making your stay easy and comfortable. With almost three years of hosting under my belt, I can honestly say Airbnb has been a rewarding experience and a great way to meet new friends from all over the world.
Hello

Hi, we are Brad Miller and Carrie Hood.  We live in Chicago with our three children.  After having such great times traveling with AirBnB to San Francisco and Michigan, we're inspired to try it ourselves.  We are excited to host guests and share this great city with travelers.

We rehabbed the bottom unit of our house as a rental unit, but currently use it to run a design business.  Our out of town guests stay in that unit, so it's perfect for AirBnB.  We're excited to get the best us of our guest space.

It will be a pleasure to share our home that we love.
I am a math teacher living in Chicago!

I like to visit places and feel like a local.I love to immerse in an urban environment, large in scale like Buenos Aires. But I also enjoy the charm of small towns and their pace. Easy hiking is also one of my favorites things to do in summer in the company of my husband and Marlo ( our small dog )
My husband and I enjoy meeting people and building up new friendships.We both teach at Colleges and love to share our passion for design.

I'm a writer and professor based in Chicago and New York. I'm working on my fourth book.

Thanks!

I adore beaches, babies, cupcakes, family and biking. I am a stay at home mama to the sweetest little boy in the world, live in my favorite city with the love of my life and feel incredibly blessed with my lot.

I am a classical musician living in Chicago. I enjoy meeting with people around global and getting to know different cultures whenever I host or travel. I've performed in two dozens of countries and visit China where my family lives every year. Easy-going, reliable, smart and tender are what people usually describe me. :)

We've been hosts for nearly five years. So many interesting and charming people have passed through our doors and thoroughly enjoyed their stay. The keys to our success have undoubtedly been that we take every guest's experience very seriously and have a genuine interest in making their trip to Chicago a memorable one.

From George: "I'm originally from Texas but have been living in Chicago for several years now. I majored in Economics and International Relations and I work in development for an international organization. I also enjoy volunteering with arts charity organizations around the city.

"I speak Spanish and French. I love to travel and and was lucky to be an exchange student to Switzerland through Rotary International and to study abroad in France when I was in college. I love business, politics, art, and cooking simple but delicious paleo meals."

From Sean: "I grew up in the suburbs of Chicago and have lived in the city for more than six years. I feel incredibly lucky to not only be living here but to have also had the opportunity to share the city I love with hundreds of travelers!

Our quality of life depends on how well we deal with adversity!  Feel positive. Live positive.  I grew up in a small coastal town in Maine.  When I turned 19 I realized that I was a closet wanderer.  So I hit the road and covered much of the U.S. and all of Europe.  I taught skiing in the Rockies and rode my BMW R65-LS from coast to coast.  When I was in Europe I was amazed at how willing people were to open their homes to a total stranger.  I had one of my best experiences living with a family in Romania in the Carpathian Mountains.  Amazing!  I feel this is the best way possible to travel.  It's part of why I love Air B&B.  Hotel shmotel!  Live the life of the area.  That's an experience.  Now my wandering days are over.  I'm rooted in one of the coolest communities I know.  Rich with art and spirit. I have two amazing girls that help me garden, can, collect eggs and milk.  My partner is a fellow East Coast boy, avid hockey player and my right hand man. I also tour with an ABBA tribute band as well as a Pink Floyd tribute band but don't hold that against me.  I hope you like it here half as much as we do!!
We've been hosting for years, and love meeting new and interesting people.

I am a health care provider with an emphasis in alternative health.  In addition I instruct individuals and businesses in how to recycle their waste with worms!  My husband is a local caterer and all around handy guy.  We compost year round and maintain an organic garden in our back yard when weather allows.  We welcome our guests to join us in enjoying our urban garden.

We have a pet friendly apartment and enjoy three furry friends of our own; Eve ( grey cat), Emmie (calico cat), and Ms. Pickles ( wacky little dog).  

We love to travel and stay in unique accommodations.  Unfortunately our lives here in Chicago keep us busy and we don't get away often enough.  Hosting helps fill the gap!  It is always interesting to meet our unique guests and hear about where they are from.
I am an advertising executive in Chicago with a passion for restoring old homes. My family and I are fans of the Chicago Blackhawks and enjoy the outdoors.
I am a lawyer from Chicago and enjoy traveling whenever I have the opportunity.

Anders and I live in St. Louis but we go up to Chicago frequently. Anders is originally from Sweden and I am from Germany. Being German, I am somewhat partial to the annual Chicago Christkindl Market and Gluehwein as can be seen on the picture. We love to travel and spend a few months each year in Europe.

I like to consider myself a chill and responsible adult, changing the world one underprivileged youth at a time. My favorite things include croissants, HIIT, fur, driving mocs, iced coffee with real cream, home cooking (I'm partial to my own), weather that elicits swimwear, ramen, rock music, patios, Italian beef, Bravo tv, fireplaces, Frenchies....

I need to travel more (like I used to), but I LOVE my city and my hood to the bone so it's not so bad exploring here. That's all I've got.

I just started my first "real job" at the tender age of 40: Professor of Political Science at University of Chicago. Before that I lived and worked in South America for more than a decade, as well as Asia and Europe, studying, working for NGOs, trying to be a writer, and lots of other stuff. Love to travel, love to host. I guess if I had to sum up my point of view in a mixed metaphor, it would be "If you go against the grain, there's less traffic."

I am easy going and laid back. Love to travel see the world and make friends along the way.

I love movies and skiing and even have a ski simulator downstairs that you can ride if you know how to ski or board already.  

I know the city well and can offer suggestions or directions.

Looking forward to being your host.


If you need a taxi or private ride you can use UBER which is great to have them show up where ever you are...
Use my Uber code, lik6n , and get $20 off your first Uber ride. Download uber app at apple store or (Hidden by Airbnb) play store.

We are experienced airbnb travelers that have enjoyed our stays all over the world. Our favorite part of airbnb is living like a local. We try to shop the local markets and always prepare a meal wherever we stay.

Technology Executive Life Sciences, Medical Devices and BioTech. I have  passion for food, wine, family and friends. I love to explore what the world has to offer and travel as much as my schedule permits. I love Chicago and enjoy everything this amazing city has to offer. I've had the pleasure to host guests from: Germany, Indonesia, Ireland, Turkey, El Salvador, Viet Nam, China,Poland, Spain, Singapore, Russia, Hong Kong, Canada and many US States! I'm looking forward to hosting you and your guests and its my hope to provide you an unforgettable experience.
From Chicago

This is a rare combination of an actual clothes and gift boutique/artist studio with a house right behind it. I am a mom of grown children, an artist, a community activist, an English teacher. 

I like to travel and also to cook international food and to host!
I am a school social worker and my husband is a teacher.  We enjoy meeting new people from other places.  We are excited about showing people our city so they can love it as much as we do!
Love the city of Chicago and have lived in this location for 5 years!!

I'm a laid back, easy-going, spontaneous mom of 2 kids, ages 8 and 10. I teach yoga. I've co-founded a nonprofit under the guidance and support of some amazing community leaders. YogaCare provides affordable yoga classes in under resourced communities. The classes are adapted and taught by quality teachers at accessible places within communities. 

I enjoy traveling, but it has been quite awhile ever since I had kids. Nowadays trips are geared around them and at places like Disney World. Places I've traveled in the past: Spain, Italy, Germany, Austria, Mexico, Canada, and continental US. While I loved all countries for a variety of reasons, I must say that Barcelona really resonated in my heart. The architecture, art, food, music, people, vibe, and ambiance felt like home to me. I will be sure to return there.

I am determined to hit Macchu Picchu in Peru in the summer of 2019. I'd like to eventually also hit Costa Rica, Thailand, India, and Australia. Oh yes, Galapagos Islands and Bali are certainly on my radar as well. 

In addition to kids, yoga, and traveling, I also love good food, art, and music. 

When staying at the condo in Chicago, IL, you can expect a quiet and private place.   Breakfast is available to help jump start your day.  I'm available via text to answer any questions or suggest any places to go.

Hi, I'm Jason! After spending 6 years in Prague and using Airbnb extensively, I have re-patriated back to Chicago and now host fellow travelers along their journeys. 

I have a passion for travel & cooking- 57 countries & counting. I am pleased and  very excited to be able to turn the tables and act as a host within the community. 

I'm pretty laid back, so looking to host the same type of travelers in our space.

Ciao 

Jason
Musician and teacher.

From Chicago, photographer, lover of travel, my wife and dogs.

I love the Daily Show and I secretly still aspire to host my own talk show. I love NPR, The Young Turks, and reading books on my iPad/iPhone.

I love our city apartment- it allows me to moderate my bazillion hobbies from beer brewing on the back porch 5 gallons at a time to keeping a vertical herb garden with a shoe organizer. It's kind of like cooking, but with baby potatoes you know? Plus, it's an excellent excuse to have a cigar collection... because they're small.

I'm a collection of different things- in high school I was on the football team, but also a band geek.

I still could eat pizza for every meal and continuously watch Arrested Development on a loop if you let me.

Dana Gould is my favorite comedian.

My key to life is if you're not having fun, then you're not doing it right.

Whenever I can make Ela laugh consider my day made.

I am a host who loves sharing my house and make it available for long and short-term rentals. My house is very sharable. I provide a clean, neat and nice unit, and will try to accommodate any special requests by guest. I'm very sociable, well mannered, and an assuring AirBnB Host. I love praising God and have a thankful attitude toward life.  Great sense of humor too.  Life is short so get busy living.  I live close to downtown, Hot United Center, Grant Park, Union Park. In Chicago the summer time rocks with all the outdoor festivals like North Coast Music, PitchFork ,Lalapooloza, Jazz festival,  Gospel festiva just to name a fewl.  Close to Bucktown, Wicker Park, Logan Square and Humboldt Park for Cinco de mio, largest hospital conglomerate in the US including UIC hospital, Rush Hospital, Stroeger Hospital, and Veterans Hospital. Top Travel Destinations now. Includes spots I have yet to visit.
Buenes Aires, Rio, Prague, Bora, Bora, Malta, Maaorca, Sardina, Sicily, South Africa, Egypt, Kaui, Alaska, Hong Kong. Morocco, Shang Hi.  Favorite travel destinations are Barcelona, Rome, Capri, ibiza

My life motto......."to thine own self be true".......and have fun doing it !!
I'm peaceful, energetic, fun-loving, active and love to be (Website hidden by Airbnb) the summer, spring, and fall!!  I LOVE travel (usually to someplace warm), art, food, entertaining, meeting new people and lively conversation.  I'm an avid art collector, jewelry designer, and art festival "junkie", that likes to experiment in the kitchen. Jewelry design is a newly discovered passion, and I sell my work at venues around the country.

Travel is in my blood !! I'm a native Chicagoan who was raised around the world as my father was in the Air Force.  I've lived in Germany, Paris, California and Texas.  As an adult, I've traveled throughout the U.S., Canada, and the Caribbean both for work and play.  I love meeting and hosting other travelers. 

I spent many years in the corporate and non-profit arenas, and have been self-employed in some form for as long as I can remember.

host_location: San Juan, San Juan, Puerto Rico
about_host:
Hola! Thank you so much for taking the time to read a bit about myself. I will start out by saying that to me there's nothing like a good conversation. I love talking about geography, different cultures and even finances. 

My true passion is hosting. I would love to dedicate to it full time sooner rather than later. After having studied abroad for 3 years, more than taking myself around the world, I want to show Puerto Rico and Chicago to the world. If you're curious, I was born and raised in paradise: Puerto Rico!

I know how much guests value when a host personally welcomes them, however due to work and being between Puerto Rico and Chicago, unfortunately I'm not available to greet each guest personally. Regardless, I can guarantee that all my places will make you feel like at home. I have put a lot of effort and love into getting them setup. Each one of our listings ("our" because my mom is the big helper) has been available for hosting after both my mom and I have stayed at each one and have approved them. We will say we are quite into the details; if you are too, I'm sure you'll notice.  

About me, I can't live without traveling, those deep conversations that by the end have made you question yourself and of course I most definitely can't live without Pancho! Pancho is my son (well, my dog) whom I just spoil too much. I rescued him from the streets of Puerto Rico and ever since we have been partners in crime. 

FOOD! Almost forgot about that one. Can't live without it! I love trying new dishes so if I'm around and you feel like cooking and exchanging recipes, let's do it! 

I love hosting guests that have positive vibes, are relaxed and know how to make the most out of every moment.

My favorite two board games are Mancala and Rummikub so if you think you can take a challenge, I'm more than willing to play! ;-)

Favorite quote: "If you judge a fish by it's ability to climb a tree, it will live it's whole life thinking it's stupid." A.Einstein
I'm a Software Developer at a consultancy in downtown Chicago. I'm a laid back person who loves watching sports and hanging out with friends in the city.

I run the Chicago Honeybee Rescue (ask me anything about social stinging insects!), am an open-water swimmer in Lake Michigan, woodworker and proprietor of Walker Lane Tools—selling beautiful hand tools for woodworking.

Hi! I'm a single mom who has recently moved to Denver. I was formerly the Operations Manager for the Barbara Lynch Gruppo, an independent restaurant group in Boston and a company I worked with for 8 years. 

My involvement with Airbnb has grown organically, beginning in Boston after I left my job and posted my place in order in order to take advantage of my career gap and do some traveling. Ultimately I decided to move us to Chicago to be closer to family, and I started renting our Chicago apartment during our trips to Iowa City. These trips grew more and more frequent as both of my parents' health rapidly declined. Airbnb turned out to be a unique way to stay unemployed during this difficult family time. My mom passed away the fall after I started Airbnb, and my father a year later. 
 
I completed the Executive MBA program in the spring of 2016, and opened a coffee shop and several Airbnbs in Iowa City during my time there. I'm now happily settled with my son in Denver and loving every minute of the mountains!  

It's been an unusual journey and none of it would have been possible without Airbnb. I'm incredibly grateful that Airbnb has provided me with a way to spend as much time with my family as possible and to grow a unique and satisfying business; it has truly been a gift. I really look forward to sharing my spaces with you.

Hi everyone,
We're a couple in our early 30's and late 20's with a spacious two bedroom apartment in the heart of Logan Square. I work as a consultant for a non-profit, and my wife is completing grad school here in Chicago. We both love meeting new people, traveling, cooking, music, movies, arts, reading, and being adventurous. We're very hospitable and try to be as helpful and accommodating as possible to guests. 
Our life motto: a smile can conquer anything. We look forward to meeting you!

Lover of the arts, travel, books and hiking.  I enjoy music of all kinds and of course yummy food.  I love meeting people from different cultures and learning about them.   

As a citizen of this planet, I am mindful of our tendency for overconsumption and try to do my part to make sure that this planet sustains itself for another few millennia.
Chicago area native - love living in Bucktown.

I'm a nature and animal lover that lived downtown Chicago for almost 2-decades and loved the city life. I enjoy meeting new people and opening my home to others! I also speak fluent French and have lived abroad.

A dreamer, I enjoy "spinning" some sense of the ideal. I'm inspired by MLKing, A.Einstein, P.Stamets, Emoto, DuBois, experimentalists, free thinkers and visionaries, AND PEOPLE WHO RECYCLE and compost! 
I am on a lifetime sabbatical from teaching art at the Chicago Public schools. 
And a time, I opened an experimental art and music inspired high school, The Forum for Creative Study in Blue Island Il.
 
I assist with Yoga/Movement, beginning Qigong on Tuesday  7:00 PM, at The Forum and you are invited.

We're Kelli and Jimmy who consider ourselves to be a couple of laid back do-gooders working to renovate our big, red urban farmhouse into an aspiring eco-conscious homestead that we love to fill with people! When not traveling ourselves, we enjoy exploring every neighborhood of Chicago, cooking with vegetables from the garden, and fighting over who gets to nap in the sunroom. Jimmy's a Chicago native and Kelli works as a local Community Organizer so we'd love to share our experiences and resources with you to make your trip as memorable, comfortable, and authentically Chicago as possible!
I love traveling and with my job I have great opportunities to travel.  In doing so, I am looking to host my place while I am on my adventures.
I am a very nice outgoing professional who enjoys life. I enjoy Sail boat, Bicycle, Motorcycles, travel and specially dancing. I am very involved in the dancing community in Chicago.
I live in Chicago and enjoy the culture and vibrancy of the city but also enjoy getting out into nature to hike, canoe, and kayak.  I enjoy traveling and meeting new people all over the world.

I am a former professional ballet dancer in transition hopefully another exciting career-I love yoga, people,cooking,reading,movies and wines-still amateur about gardening - but like it regardless---
 I lived in Germany for 3 years-long ago  (my German is emarassingly bad) but can get by with a little practice- I speak fluent French and am currently learning Spanish-
I have family ties in France - hence the reason i speak French--
I moved to Chicago 17 years ago for work (dancing) and still its so far my favorite place to live- Right now my schedule is random but when Im here -Im happy to hang out - or send you off to a great restaurant or connect you with friends that might have insights on other aspects of Chicago - music-clubs- art- 
If Im not here- I have a housemate that will take care of you and the house
THIS AREA OF CHICAGO has a couple of my favorite restaurants of all time- Im happy to give suggestions when you arrive
Chicago has so much to offer -whether spring summer or fall- and yes even winter- I hope to make your stay not only enjoyable but memorable as well
World explorer and Airbnb enthusiast!

I've lived on Clifton Avenue over 40 years. I love it because there is so much to do without going too far.
If you stay here I will try to be  around if you need help or information but I'll stay out of your way.

I am an attorney by trade, but can rarely stay put to do just one thing. Besides family and friends,  I love animals, sailing and ice cream.  Chicago is a great place to be or visit. I spend as much time outdoors as possible, whether it is battling it out in the prairie garden or admiring the different colors of blue Lake Michigan provides on any given day.
Live in Chicago. Director of local nonprofit.  Like to travel.

I love designing living spaces. I'm fascinated by urban agriculture and social cultures. I first started traveling on Airbnb up and down the coast of California. Now, I enjoy meeting new people and socializing through Airbnb hosting. I've met many great friends through the hosting experience. I like showing Chicago to new people and giving recommendations on what to do around town. 
Books, movies, vegetarian food, clean water, indoor plumbing are a few things I couldn't live without. :)

Single, entrepreneur and own the "life's work" of Jack Denst a mid-century modern iconic artist/designer. Some of his art is archived in the Smithsonian and you can see it hanging in the condo.
I actively volunteer running a Montessori Elementary School and occasionally teach SCUBA diving.
My 2 sons are grown and gone. The younger is a Chicago Police Officer stationed in a district close to my condo, the oldest is a new Dad to the cutest red headed baby boy.

Native Chicagoan living in Logan Square.

I'm a proud advocate of all things Chicago and love sharing my knowledge on the best spots, hidden gems, local favorites, and up and coming destinations around the city to help other people fall in love with this great place.

In life I couldn't live without dinner parties, a good sweat every day, well-balanced cocktails, live music, and a little trashy TV here and there to break up the week.

I travel a lot for work and for pleasure. I like to taste different type of food from different cities and meet different people. I am very easy going, I am not picky on staying, because I travel to see the city.

I'd best describe myself as a responsible professional who enjoys new adventures, hosting friends and family, sports/fitness, and meeting new people.  I'm very easy going rarely getting stressed out or too worked up about anything - lifes too short.   I also love Chicago.  I take great pride in our city - always happy to share the hot spots, local festivals, tourist locations, vintage shops, restaurants, transportation directions, etc.

Christopher and I have lived in Chicago for ten years, both from the midwest originally.  Christopher has had the chance to travel the world and I hope to do so soon as well.  My favorite part about Air BnB is meeting people from all over the world. 

We are both active and creative people.  We love cycling (on a tandem bike and solo), photography movies and outdoor activities.   I am a massage therapist at a luxury hotel and Christopher is a visual artist, he actually did all of the decorating in our home which many people find surprising. 
We are also animal lovers and have 2 French Bulldogs. 

We have been hosting on Air BnB for over four years now.  The one thing we have learned is that each guest is different and has different expectations and needs.  If you are the more social type feel free to hang out and tell us about yourself and your day.. If you prefer to spend time on your own in your room we won't bother you at all.  We want you to enjoy your time in Chicago.
We are Mark and Collette Witteveen.  We love to renovate old buildings and travel around the world.  Our favorite place to stay is on a sailboat for an extended sailing vacation.

Paul and Sarah have lived in the Logan Square neighborhood of Chicago for 12 years.  We love to travel, ride bikes, take walks, eat out at our neighborhood restaurants and drink coffee out on our back porch.

We have always enjoyed our stays in B&Bs and vacation rentals.  In our view, there is no better way to experience a place than to live like the locals for a few days or weeks.  

Chicago is a city of neighborhoods and Logan Square is among the best.  We moved here for its transit connectivity, beautiful boulevards and interesting architecture.  

We hope you'll come and experience Logan Square for yourself.

Hello! I am an adventurous lady looking to establish my own company curating art shows and producing community events while representing artists from my parents’ hometown in Cuba. I have a solid balance of being introverted and extroverted- which has me absolutely love both meeting new people and spend an evening solitary in the library. Much of my family lives in other states or countries, and so I do travel often. My favorite destinations include London and Florence, along with my 3 favorite islands. Advocating for young people and the arts is what I’m passionate about. Politics, music and travel is what I live for.

As a host I am very transparent in my communication. You can expect me to check in and make sure you are taken care of, answer any questions, and give you a well-balanced guide of the city and maybe some suggestions, if you’d like. When I am home I am typically eating, sleeping, sending emails, or getting ready to leave.
It is said that I love loud, and dream big. I say give up knowing how the future will go and insist what is considered impossible.
Husband, Father and Proud Chicagoan with a Twisted Sense of Humor :)

My partner and I moved from St. Louis to Chicago 8 years ago. We love entertaining, cook often and spend lots of time in nearby Andersonville. We love the arts, great food and can definitely recommend a variety of great things to do in Chicago.
Easy going, friendly and 30's

I'm a photographer & designer living in Chicago, IL. I'm passionate about cultivating a culture of well-lived life through authentic community. When I'm not creating, you can find me exploring new cities, drinking massive amounts of coffee, digging through vintage shops, enjoying the latest restaurants & spending time with friends and family.

Richard and Cathy are married with 3 grown children and a growing gaggle of grandchildren.  We are both active in our community, like to garden and love living in Chicago.  Cathy works full-time outside the house and Richard is semi-retired licensed clinical social worker and works as a consultant and short term family therapist.  When not working most of the time you'll find us working around the house and in our yard.  

We cherish our relationships with family members and friends - we love to study areas of interest - Richard plays guitar, Cathy and Richard like to draw, we enjoy walking our dogs, reading, meditating, cooking.  Cathy and Richard are both interested in politics and thought we don't think exactly alike most people would describe us as "progressive."

Cathy and Richard enjoy making guests feel comfortable, safe and we enjoy keeping our place in good shape.  We particularly welcome out-of-town guests and people from other countries.  We are happy to do what we can to help guests feel comfortable and are pleased to share ideas of places to visit, eat and enjoy in the city and surrounding area.

If you are looking for a long-term booking (more than three weeks) we are open to discussing special reduced rates.  We have hosted several long term guests (visiting professors, students, families who have come to Chicago to assist children with new grandchildren, etc.)  This is particularly true in the "off season" which in Chicago runs from late October through the middle of April.  We are pleased to see couples or individuals make our oasis in the city their home-away-from home, so please don't hesitate to discuss this possibility with us.

My wife and I have been professional dancers for the last 15 years, living and dancing for companies in Seattle, San Francisco, Antwerp Belgium, and now Chicago.  I am currently dancing with Hubbard Street Dance Chicago. Courtney has retired from dance to be the mother to our sons Rowan and Kellan. We love to travel, cook, listen to music, and laugh (The boys are helping us a lot with that one.) We have put a lot of effort into creating a welcoming and inspiring space with this home, so we sincerely hope you enjoy your stay.
Happily married parents. Self employed. Believe we'll never wish we worked more when we're on our death bed.

I am am an ambitious traveler who loves learning and meeting new people. My life revolves around art and music. I love to be social and attend festivals, art galleries, and some night life. 

I love dining and eating at all the new places here in Chicago. I attend second city taking improv classes. 

My motto is LIVE YOUR DREAMS!!

“Do not neglect hospitality, for through it some have unknowingly entertained angels.”
-Hebrews 13:2-

I am a fun and funny (yes, even though I am German....go figure!) person, who loves life and people.
 
My career in hotel business has provided hours of entertaining stories and experience... Growing up with two older sisters, I got stuck with their music - I love my Classic Rock and will see "Rush" anytime they play in my city. 

My German roots and my family over there are very important to me, as is my Catholic upbringing, but my love for THIS country rules, and I fulfilled a childhood dream by living here... 

I've lived in fabulous cities and made amazing friends along the way - I bet I have a story or two to share...

What else?! I've ran the Chicago Marathon in '11, motorcycled through Canada in '15, I like boxing and kayaking, bicycling and seriously hanging out on my couch with a good book or a great movie. 

I can also cook decently and love feeding and entertaining people, and I like heavy, dark wines and Macallan scotch. 
My husband and I like watching Netflix together and you are always welcome to join us.

Spanish professor at Univ of Chicago who moonlights as a soul/jazz singer.
I'm a fun guy on the go with a great spot in a great city.

I'm a UX Designer living in Chicago. I'm originally Canadian. I'm most interested in museums & history when I visit places. 

I listed an apartment on AIr BnB in April 2015 and have been really enjoying hosting people from around the world. I live in the next apartment which is convenient.

I have traveled and lived abroad. My favorite places (so far) include France and Turkey. I also enjoy a good road trip. The States are great for that.

I speak intermediate French and Portuguese.
I love my vintage apartment and I'm happy to share it with visitors.  I enjoy reading, playing music, and going to yard sales.

Hi! I am so excited to host you.  My goal is for you to feel at home and comfortable. I love this city and anticipate you will, too.  It has all of my favorite things....Food, wine, museums, concerts, sporting events, shopping, and great people, all on the lakefront!

Originally from Portland, Oregon, I made my way to Chicago by way of Nashville, Tennessee. Excited to host guests in beautiful Chicago and help them fall in love with the vibrant city we call home!

In my early 30's and love to travel. I live with my fiancée and even though it may sound silly, we work to travel! If you're staying at our place, there's a 99% chance we're at another Airbnb! Ask me anything, I'm here to be the best host in the best city in the world.

Hello!  A few years back, I founded a company called Peak Design that makes accessories for the photographic and outdoor industries.  We're based in San Francisco, but I split my time between there and Chicago so that I can spend half my month with my daughter Josephine.  Her mom and I live a few blocks apart in Chicago, and I live a few blocks from my work in San Francisco.

Airbnb has given me the opportunity to make this an affordable situation, and I'm grateful for it and the other marvels of the modern world that allow me to live in SF half the time and still have a full time relationship with my daughter.

In Chicago, I built the majority of the furniture.  In fact, the kitchen table, nightstands, writing desk, both beds, and the art project on the wall were all created in my basement workshop...all from wood that I found on the premises when I moved in!  This is part midwestern frugality (I grew up in Minneapolis), and part disdain for trips to the lumberyard.

In San Francisco, I live with friends and colleagues. All of us travel frequently, which is why too often our place is vacant, and that's a crying shame, because it is a truly beautiful home. We love the idea of sharing our home with the world through airbnb.

I try to take great care of my places, and I hope to find guests who appreciate their cleanliness and simplicity.

Thanks much for having a look around!

I'm an easy going person, I work Full-time, Enjoy life my kids. Family orientated. I love my home, and said let me share it with the world. to have you in our home is like inviting Family over! I plan to one day reach the 7 wonders of the world. My family motto, Work hard play hard yet make sure there's a roof over your head! food on the table, clothes on your back and in times of darkness seek the light

My name is Elena, I live in Chicago and work as Mobile Software Engineer. Beside my job I enjoy traveling, photography and meeting new people. 

I am originally from Russia , but lived all over the world (e.g. Japan, Czech Republic, Germany, USA). I have traveled to 30+ countries. 
I love meeting new people and sharing our travel experiences.

Born and raised in Chicago, but love to get out of the city and see new places (especially in the winter).  Love to explore a new city and get away from the tourist traps.  See the sights and neighborhoods where the locals go, and get a sense of what the town and people are really about.  Prefer the eclectic and random when I travel.  I'm a recording engineer, so love music and always try to find a nice local music dive with a decent beer selection to check out.

We are a loving, friendly family. Ligia is from tropical Brazil, and loves living in Chicago now.  Her home is clean, modern, and spacially exciting!   Luke is a high school teacher, and loves learning about other cultures.  Guests from all over the world have enjoyed staying with Luke &Ligia for 4 years now; the home is in a convenient location, it is very clean and safe; guests feel a sense of privacy as well as friendship in our home.  Guests have private entry and keys for accessibility.

I'm a world traveler/actor.  Originally from the middle of a corn field in an unincorporated town in Oklahoma, I have lived in Chicago since 2002.  I'm half-Belgian and can outsing you in a karaoke contest.    

Dennis, my man/guy/partner, is an actor/production dude.  He is awesome and knows how to fix anything.  He also knows exactly where you should go eat and exactly what you should order so that your life is immediately a lot better.

I am an acupuncturist and Chinese Medicine practitioner who recently returned to Chicago after living abroad for about a decade. I studied Thai Massage in Thailand for several years, then became interested in Buddhist philosophy and meditation so traveled to Kathmandu Nepal to study with a Tibetan lama for a year. While I was there I worked with a very skilled practitioner of Chinese Medicine and so decided to pursue my studies in Acupuncture and Herbal Medicine back in the US. After studying for four years post-graduate, I went back to Asia to volunteer in Nepal, Bali, and Thailand, and then founded a non-profit to send more acupuncture volunteers to work in free Nepali clinics. I enjoy my work immensely and still travel to Asia a few times each year. I moved back to Chicago a few years go and bought a beautiful 100 year old home last year. I still travel quite a bit and so am looking for a responsible roommate to share my peaceful space with. When I am in Chicago I am also an avid tango dancer and yoga practitioner. I enjoy having the occasional dinner party with tango friends, or guest for breakfast in the garden, but in general the house is very quiet and calm.

I live in Logan Square.  Love my neighborhood.  Hobbies are playing music, going to see live music, running, craft beer, and basketball.  I have a small dog named Beans who lives upstairs and does not go into the guest unit, even between bookings.
Designer living in Chicago.

I love living in Chicago and live in the perfect neighborhood!  It is great city living, with everything you need outside the door.  

I am a teacher and love weekend getaways or staying home and enjoying some wine on my back deck with friends.

Currently back on the northwest side of Chicago in the Logan Square / Bucktown neighbourhood.  Flaneur, polyglot, linguaphile, neophile, avid cyclist, amateur cook and gardener.  I like exploring new places, people and ideas and seek ways to challenge myself as a citizen of the world.

Originally from Sydney Australia, I have been living in Chicago the last 5 years or so working as a musician. I also love travelling and I use Airbnb wherever I go so I know what a difference a local can make to a business trip or vacation. I'll give you as much help as you want and will happily provide directions and suggestions, or I'm happy just to let you discover the city for yourself.

A married couple in their 30s.  Carolyn is a pediatric nurse and John is a paramedic/firefighter.  We love to travel, watch sports, go out to eat, and hang out with our 2 french Bulldogs. Avid traveler for work and pleasure. Have been to almost every continent with significant time spent in NYC, China, SE Asia, India and Brazil. I'm easy going, but love a plan.  Baking and yoga are passions of mine.  Paris is my favorite place in the whole wide world, but Chicago ain't so bad.  My boyfriend, Dan, is a musician.  We live together.  My dog Chloe is adorable and hypoallergenic.  

I'm not one for tourist sites.  When I travel, I like to make like an unemployed local.  That's why I think Airbnb is so great-- it has so much more real flavor than a hotel.  As guests, we are respectful and clean.  As hosts, we are welcoming and sometimes there's muffins.

Je suis facile à vivre, mais j'aime un plan. Je suis passionée par la pâtisserie et le yoga.  Paris est ma ville préférée dans tout le monde, mais Chicago n'est pas si mal. Mon copain, Dan, est un musicien. Nous vivons ensemble. Mon chien Chloé est adorable et hypoallergénique.

Je ne suis très pas fan des pièges touristiques.  Quand je suis en vacances, j'aime jouer comme la chômeuse native:  les cafés, la vie de rue, les ballades longs, etc.  C'est pourquoi j'adore Airbnb-- ça donne un goût plus vrai par rapport d'un hôtel.
