Hi, I'm Russ. I currently travel quite a bit for my work (with I love) which is helping groups and teams unleash more creativity and innovation. I have a traveler's soul and I enjoy meeting good people, seeing great theater and eating great food. I will be traveling back and forth to Australia the next few months for work and am looking to find some great places to stay to get a sense of what some of the local neighborhoods are like.

Villa Lucia has been the family vacation place where my sister, my brother, and I spent countless summers with my parents and many friends. And then it was the turn of my nephew, 2 nieces and their friends. But now they are grown so we decided that it was time to share this unique place with  those who, like us, seek the simple and genuine pleasure of life without sacrificing excursions, culture, trekking, restaurants, music, shows, etc. There is plenty of opportunities between June and September!
I teach and practice yoga and, believe me, yoga practice at sunset on the terrace is just magic!

I'm a vivid traveler and embrace the Airbnb concept and community.
Newly empty nesters, my husband and I are now hosting and ready to welcome guests from across the globe.

I never take my Lake views for granted! They inspire me every day, especially when I catch the sun rising over the lake from the living room!
I love living in Chicago in the center of everything. Downtown Chicago is a world class city with a Midwestern vibe. I am honored that Air BNB has named me a super host. I pride my self in exceeding my guests expectations! I have traveled many parts of the world but will always call Chicago my home. I hope you love it as much as I do!

A long term Chicago native, biking, cooking and crossword enthusiast.  

I can guide you to the wonders that this amazing city has in store for you, but mostly, I will leave you to enjoy my home and city at your leisure.  

My cats and I welcome you to to my home  Rocco (the Siamese) and Lucca (the black one) are extremely friendly and love being pet. 

I hope that you are comfortable and enjoy your stay with me,
Ask me for recommendations on restaurants, things to do, nightlife, anything!  I strive to be the best host possible and am elated every time I get a new positive review :)

The Chicago Property Concierge is a furnished housing provider, specializing in modern, all-inclusive housing solutions in downtown Chicago.  Our minimum stay is 31 nights, and we offer Studio, Jr. One Bedroom, One Bedroom and Two Bedroom Apartments in Downtown Chicago.  We pride ourselves on delivering top customer service to our guests.

Hello! I'm originally from Fairbanks, Alaska and lived in Anchorage, Alaska before moving to Chicago in 2011 where I own a spacious condo in East Lakeview.   I look forward to meeting you and helping you enjoy your Chicago experience.  I’m impeccably clean, friendly and responsible.  My goal is to make you feel right at home... in your home away from home.

I am a big traveller and love exploring new countries; diving into everything their cultures offer, from food to fashion.  
In the past five years alone I have set foot on every world continent - sometimes multiple times - and visited more than a dozen countries including Thailand, Japan, Argentina, Iceland, Italy, Peru, Australia, France, Morocco, Jamaica, England and Germany.  
All this travel means I really appreciate the facilities and touches the best hotels and Airbnb hosts have made to ensure my stay has been memorable and hassle free.
I have tried to learn from this and incorporated many of the best ideas at my own house so all my guests have a great experience and are able to live like a local in the  hip and happening Logan Square neighbourhood.
I want all my guests to return home raving about their comfortable, relaxing and unforgettable stay.  
When I'm not hosting guests at my house, I run an agency representing film directors in Los Angeles.  
I also love movies, music (especially live concerts - I'm a regular at Coachella), theatre, cooking and art.

I'm an outgoing and friendly freelance photographer. In my photography work I focus mainly on travel, live music, interior design and architecture as well as various other forms of commercial photography to keep the bills paid.

I was born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio and moved to Chicago 11 years ago. Aside from a few months spent in Nicaragua after college, a few months in Buenos Aires, Argentina, and a month in Tokyo in 2015, I've stayed and absolutely loved living in Chicago. Other travels have included Prague, Italy, Mexico, Spain, Panama, Costa Rica, Japan, Uruguay, Thailand, Vietnam, Cambodia and I'm gearing up for a very exciting few weeks photographing and filming in Kenya and Rwanda for a documentary series about extraordinary women doing great things around the world. 

I enjoy cooking but not as much as I like going out to dinner. I am equally as comfortable in a dive bar drinking cheap beer at the pool table as I am in a high end restaurant drinking fine wine and whiskey. Though, in an ideal world I would be sipping fine wine or whiskey at the dive bar pool table.

I see A LOT of live music, partially because I photograph a lot of musician portraits and live concerts for various publications, but ultimately just because I enjoy many types of music very much. 

I love meeting new people from all over the world and hope we get to meet very soon.
My husband and I are lucky enough to call Chicago and Austin home with our 2 rescue pups and 1 cat. We love to travel and are total foodies!

I've been traveling internationally since I was in high school and was an exchange student in Switzerland.  I've lived with my family in latin america and now that I'm an "empty nester" I'm back to traveling on my own or with my husband.  I still like alternative travel so would rather stay in a home than a hotel.  I like all kinds of music, am active in social movements in the u.s. and work full time promoting fair trade in Chicago.

I was born and raised in Chicago! I've lived on the northwest side, worked in the downtown River North area and currently reside in Lincoln Square! My brother and I own a 3-flat where the garden unit is available on Airbnb. I live on the 2nd floor with my boyfriend, Tom, my brother, Scott, on the 3rd and our cousin on the 1st. It's a family affair, which makes it convenient for our guests should they need anything! 

We all enjoy hanging out in our neighborhood at the restaurants, cafes, bars and bowling alley only a block away. 

I'm a perfect blend of homebody and world traveler. I love an adventure and have traveled to numerous places in Europe many times and to Hong Kong & the Philippines. I like to explore, but also believe there is no place like home! 

I try to keep that feeling in mind for my guests, creating a perfect oasis while they are away from home. 

I've booked Airbnb in Amsterdam, Nashville & Oslo, Norway and cannot wait to find our next spot in Napa, CA.

Andrew and I live in this Logan Square one-bedroom, and we rent it out to travelers when we are off traveling on our own adventure!

Genuinely convinced Chicago is the best American city to visit and live in. We love to share the city and neighborhood with visitors who want to experience it fully!

As for us... Andrew is a data nerd and Jessie is a nursing student.

I'm originally from Cincinnati, but now live in Chicago. I am a full time Senior Designer at the Chicago branch of vfx house The Mill. AirBnB has been amazing at making travel that much more unique and interesting with all the amazing rentals available.

Describing yourself is never easy. To some, we're social butterflies, to others we're laid back. Ultimately, there were a few things that came to mind when we think about who we are as a couple. 

Andrew is from Green Bay, Wisconsin (Go Pack!) and I'm from Tucson, Arizona (Bear Down Arizona!) When we're not battling each other on who cooks the better meal, we're slangin' deals at work. Andrew works to help companies recruit employees and I work to keep them retained. Monday through Friday we are committed to our jobs from 9am-5pm. But every now again we'll find ourselves at a local bar enjoying the cocktail specials on Thursdays. 

We are goal-setting, career-driven young professionals who just want to succeed in life so that we can enjoy everything it has to offer. Our ideal careers would include traveling the world and wine tasting on a nightly basis. However since that's not going to happen anytime TOO soon, we'll have to travel the world through the eyes of our Airbnb guests and just continue to wine taste fancy bottles from our local Target.

Fun-loving, flexible, open-minded, street-savvy Mom of 2 kiddos who keep me very busy and in the present moment.  Love exploring new things and going on "adventures"...attempting to expose my kids to as much of the world as possible.   Love visiting our own "sweet home Chicago" as it has so much to offer.  Very active lifestyle:  Working out at gyms, biking with kids, ice skating when possible.  Kids involved in gymnastics, hockey, swimming and so much more.
Tech Entrepreneur that loves great food, good friends, and the Windy City.

I love family, friends, travel, and reading. I have hosted many family events in my wonderful Chicago home where I have lived for many years!   Recently retired, I have started and led five not-for-profit organizations  focused on improving public education.  I work out regularly  at Cross Fit.  As an airbnb host, I  will do everything I can to make you feel at home.

I've own this building for almost 20 years.  This past fall I renovated it and decided to rent it on airbnb.  This what I do for a living and I take it very seriously.  This isn't a side job for me.  I will do my best to make sure you have a good experience renting my place.

I'm from Wisconsin so I'm a big Packer/Badger fan.  
I've a got great yellow lab named Bubba.
I'm hooked on too many series from HBO and Showtime.
I enjoy cooking.
I am a busy professional who enjoys live music and comedy shows.

Interested in gardening, food, old-time and Cajun music, garage sales, and urban agriculture. I've lived abroad and had many roommates and long-term guests from other countries. I love meeting travelers and helping people feel at home.

In 1992, I graduated from college and moved to Chicago with my college roommates.  Twenty plus years later, I am still living in and loving Chicago.  I am a computer programmer,  avid reader and movie fan.  I am looking forward to being your host!
Native Chicagoan!

I'm a born and bred Southside Chicagoan. Love Chicago and all it has to offer. Even the weather : ) I've lived in Logan Square for the past 14 years and think it's Chicago's best neighborhood! I think you'll agree when you visit.
Hi! We are Darcy and Frank Jusich, a couple in our 30s living in Chicago's West Loop.

My husband and I love to travel AND play host.  Please call on us anytime we can help make your vacation a better experience.  Our guidebook includes what we believe are the best places in the immediate area to make the most of your stay.  No request is too small, we love this place and want you to feel the same way.
When I travel, I like to run and explore.  I'm a fan of all things urban.

I'm an easy-going guy for the most part. I'm pretty clean, quiet, and laid back.

In my free time I'm into cooking, craft cocktails/beers, live music, and basically anything outside or active.

I'm originally from Australia and now call Chicago home.  I've traveled extensively throughout the world and understand the importance of having a warm and comfortable place to stay when on the road.  I work in the law profession and in my spare time love to explore new and exciting places.

I am a Sales Manager of a Wine and Spirits company. I have lived all over the country, but have presently landed in Chicago the last 12 years. I live with (and usually always travel with) my newly married husband (aka partner of 13 years) who I live with in Chicago as well as on our Farm in Michigan.   We love traveling with our toddler and also enjoying the city of chicago and the open space in Michigan. We have traveled to every continent except Antartica together and enjoy unique experiences, off the beaten path/road/mountain/boat/building adventures and always try to avoid the masses of tourists.  We own a multi-unit building so we are also landlords and AirBnb hosts. We are therefore very  respectful of people's property and hope you will respect ours as well.  We are very active (I also am a group fitness instructor) and love natural/local foods. We have a farm in Southwest Michigan where we practice permaculture techniques and grow naturally organic food.

Hi!  My name is Stephanie and I am originally from Indy but I've called Chicago home for 9 years now!  I love the city and hope you have a wonderful time here!  The restaurants are the best and I love exploring the neighborhoods of Chicago so if you have any questions on that let me know!

I'm great!  I'm pretty sure you are, too.  I'm a Stylist/Costumer for film and TV, and I have a swimwear line called Fenton Fox.  I've lived in Chicago since 2001--all the time in this neighborhood except for four months which were definitely not as fun!  I'm a big traveller, so we might miss each other.  But in any event, I can tell you everything you need to know about getting around here and recommend lots of awesome things to do.
Airbnb has been really fun--I've met adventurous people from all over the world, and it's always a treat to have someone stay at my apartment and enjoy our fab city.  xox, Lizzie

I'm a young professional living in a large studio in a very walkable area of Chicago's Lakeview neighborhood. In my spare time I enjoy traveling, dining out, going to concerts, photography, biking, sailing, and the beach.

I am a person who lives for travel and culture.  I work as both an arts journalist and an artist manager / agent.  I am also studying a Masters in Cultural Management aka Arts Administration.  I travel regularly for both work and play!

Hello!

I am a world traveler who enjoys meeting people from all over. I love cooking, traveling, biking, and exploring. 

I have lived in Chicago for the past 8 years and love everything this city has to offer.

As a fairly seasoned Airbnb host and guest I can hands down say this is the best way to experience a city. I have enjoyed my experiences using the site thus far, and hope you will too!

I love a good glass of wine, free snacks, discovering new restaurants with friends and family, and perusing food blogs – and trying to cook.

Favorite destinations are Berlin, Istanbul, Tortola, and Barcelona.

im a hairstylist born and raised in Chicago, ive been creating art for over 16 years, with a passion for education im pursuing my own salon and then a school, my home shows off my personality , i think its well put together,.
I am a happy, relaxed individual that enjoys cooking, travel and spending time with my family.

I'm an avid traveler who loves Chicago. Great food and people make the experience and Chicago has both and then some. I have a background in hospitality to ensure you'll have a great experience in my city.

We are a Canadian couple who has lived around the world. Chicago has been our home for the past six years and we are loving Wicker Park with our two young daughters and our dog Chester.   Favorite things to do on the weekends are hike and mountain bike ( as best we can in these flat lands).   We have stayed at many b and b's in our travels and love the interaction with locals.
I am from chicago.  Love to travel.   My husband Paul and I spend most of our days cooking, playing at our neighborhood parks with our kids or eating at our favorite restaurants.

I am a Dancer, Pilates Instructor, and Landlady... Love to travel and meet people.  My favorite places has been barcelona spain, amsterdam, and Peru.  I have been a host to travelers but not here on airbnb, mostly to friends of friends.  I was taken care of well during my travels and like to do the same.

Hello, This is Mary. I help my parents, Donald and Eileen, manage their Airbnb. Don and Eileen are lifelong Chicagoans.  They are active in the neighborhood and everyone seems to know them. Mention their names for an easy conversation starter with neighbors. They love to walk to local restaurants.  Their favorite is Bistro Campagne on Lincoln Ave. We'll leave a menu for you.

Hi!  I'm the guy that's always throwing the dinner parties.  Moved into this (AWESOME!) neighborhood in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and my neighbors say the block has 'gotten more social' since I've been here.  I own the building, rent out the ground floor to awesome tenants (my unit is on top floor).  

I'm a single dad, with the best 9-year-old daughter in the world.   I enjoy a nice glass of wine (or two..) and can recommend a few good places in walking distance to pick up some nice vino, or stay and enjoy in a good wine bar, bar or restaurant.  

Professionally, I create software/ mobile products (product management), and I co-created a Kellogg MBA course in the subject.  I also built my own mobile/ team-based learning company (Questily).

As a host, I'll typically be as available or "hands off" as you like.  Local-savvy: Chicago resident since (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and Kellogg alum and adjunct.  Culturally-aware: lived on the East Coast (RI and NY) West Coast (Bay Area) and Europe (Germany and France), with extensive travel (including Europe, Asia and New Zealand).  A buddy once described me as an "ESPN2-type" (water polo, surfing, snowboarding, yoga), but love the local teams and can't wait for this Cubs season - Wrigley is just 1.7 miles straight down Addison (VERY easy bus ride).

Looking forward to hosting you and your friends/ family!

City of Chicago Shared Housing Registration Number: R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) 

- John

Certified Master Gardener during the growing season (May-Nov) and traveling work exchange volunteer in the winter months (Jan-Apr). 25 year veteran labor union organizer. Love hosting travelers as much as I love being hosted when I travel.

Kind, clean, and a good host. 

I've lived in Chicago most of my life. After traveling and graduating from college I decided to stay in the city I grew up in. I love my job and my friends and most of all my family.

A charming, accented, poet type with a huge loving family. A chef, so feel free to cook and use my spices and olive oil.  There's too much work coming my way to really enjoy my apartment as much as I would like.

I'm a very chill guy that has lived with many roommates over the years so I know how to be accommodating and attentive to my friends and guests. I work in public relations. I love working out, dining out and trying new places to eat and drink, drinks with friends, Netflix, quality music (all types), street fests and creating amazing experiences and memories.

My wife, Lynn, and I are in the Restaurant business...
I love to travel with my family and friends

I own a cleaning business with several clients in the loop area and I rent several properties in the chicagoland area. I love to travel and I believe laughter is good for the soul so laugh as often as you can.  World Traveler and lover of all living things!
I love to race sailboats, hike, camp and take my jeep off-roading. I've explored most of the world, but still have south America and Antarctica.

We've lived in Chicago for over 25 years, and Roupen was born and raised here. Our family restaurant, which is located on the first floor of the apartment building, has been in the neighborhood for more than 45 years. We enjoy traveling, trying new restaurants and spending time with family. We love hospitality and believe that experiencing other cities and cultures truly expands the mind and heart. We are proud to offer our guests a very comfortable and cozy experience and wish you an unforgettable stay in Chicago.

We have been living in Wicker Park for about a year and half now and love it! Our neighborhood is full of great restaurants, shops, art and things to do. 

I work downtown for a Social Media marketing firm that specializes in luxury hospitality and have been in Chicago for over 4 years now.

Christophe, who is originally from Paris, France has lived in Chicago for 7 years and works in Finance. 

We met here in Chicago and have grown to love the city and enjoy being a host on AirBnB. We are also avid travelers and love sharing stories with our traveling guests that come through our home.

Hey, 

My name is Daniel. I'm a Chicago native living in Wicker Park. I work full-time and am in school getting my Master's in Business Administration. I'm looking to supplement my income a bit and help defray the cost of expensive books. 

I'm relatively low key during the work week but like to go out with friends on the weekend, try new restaurants and explore my great neighborhood. My interests include: snowboarding, cooking, travel and rummaging through junkyards in search of interesting things for my place. 

 (Hidden by Airbnb) /Instagram: @dannymcgrath

I'm an educated professional single guy, born & raised in Bombay and Chicago is second home for over 20 years. I come from a very hospitality oriented culture and family, so love hosting, entertaining, and meeting new people from all over the world and learning about them and their culture. I love traveling and make friends wherever I go.

I like good meals, dining out, craft beers, coffee, music, love cooking, dancing, culinary trips and traveling in general, 15 countries & counting. Occasional home brewer. My friends consider me a roaming Chicago GPS & guide to food & bar scene.

I look forward to hosting you in my humble abode.

Will and SuzAnn - married for 8 years and have a 4 year old baby girl. We have lived in Wicker Park for 3 years and love it!  We love traveling and have been to Thailand, Shanghai, Beijing, Mongolia, Russia, Paris, Norway, Sweden, Finland, etc...  SuzAnn is an Interior Designer and Will is a former professional soccer player.

Young professional is the term, right? Love traveling and meeting new people. Happy to live in such a great city as Chicago. Live and work in the city for many years, and never get tired of rediscovering its music, food, events, and awesome authentic neighborhoods.
Personally, had nothing but a positive experience with AirBnB anywhere I went, in the States or Europe. So decided to share my place with the same wanderlust type of people like myself.
Would gladly suggest you the things to do and places to see, even some cool hidden gems. 
Enjoy your travels! 

- Best things in life aren't things.

Hello,

We have two cats, but they will not be at the house while you are staying there.  We enjoy taking advantage of living in the city, but can't wait to relax with nature in our off time.  We have hiked Kilimanjaro, the Milford Trek, the Inca trail to Machu Picchu, and Annapurna.  I love to travel and explore the world, but will always call Chicago home.  I hope you feel welcome and comfortable in our house.

My wife and I love to travel and host friends, so Airbnb is the best of both worlds for us. I enjoy restoring and designing furniture, swimming, cycling, and soccer. I cook every night, read, and love music like everyone else out there. I am a paramedic on the Chicago Fire Department, and I try to travel every possible moment I have away. Favorite US destination is San Francisco and favorite destination abroad is Madrid.

I'm a French professional living in Chicago. I have been in the US for quite a few years, and now call Chicago home. I have experienced living in many cities in the US and internationally, and I think Chicago offers the best compromise of everything I like: a vibrant city, nice seasonal climate, cool activities for every season, and a very cosmopolitan community

Proud father and family guy. I work the printing industry and have brought our 135 year old house back into shape with my own two hands. Chicagoan to the bone, well versed in political and local history, speaks fluent Chicagoese. Dreams of traveling the globe

I enjoy hosting people and seeing to it that guests have a great time in Chicago. There's tons to do and the pizza is second to none and is also my favorite food. Downtown is fun, but there are also fun neighborhoods, like Wicker Park, that are nearby. There's a cool pub that I've discovered that I'll go to with friends sometimes, I spend time with Ziggy, and I work. I'm a teacher. I live nearby the United Center and recently saw a UFC event there, which was cool. I'm generally a down-to-earth guy, so if you want to know anything ask or book a reservation. Thanks!

Chicago is the greatest city on earth, and when I'm not in town, I want others to experience why Chicago is so great.  My condo is right on Michigan ave, the perfect location to enjoy the city.  The bus stop is right in front of my door, or you can walk to McCormick place, or walk to the loop, or for a couple of dollars just order an Uber or hail a Taxi.  My south loop locations is surrounded by the ethnic areas providing some amazing access to a world of flavors.  Pilsen (Mexican), Greek Town, Taylor Street (Little Italy), Greek Town, China Town.  I'm a few blocks to Soldier Field, the lake, and the Museum Campus.

My Chicago condo is upscale and your experience will be above and beyond the usual AirBnB experience.  Clean, crisp white sheets, towels, and custom bathroom soaps and lotions will welcome you home, morning coffee will help you get going in the morning.   My condo is not over crowded, everything in the place is meant for you to use, and that includes the wifi, HDTV, DVR, Netflix.

This is now our fifth year living in Chicago and we love it! My wife, Jolin and I originally met when I was living in Taiwan and now we are a family of four. I teach Mandarin Chinese in the Chicago Public Schools and my wife has the more daunting task of managing her own private tutoring along with raising our little ones, Baea and Kylin (3 years old and 11 months old respectfully). When we are able, we love to travel and have had the most wonderful experiences here on Airbnb. Can't wait to meet you!

We look forward to meeting you!

Hello! My name is William.

I am a self-employed artist living & directing a gallery in Wicker Park. Last year I completed a Masters degree in Fine Arts at the School Of The Art Institute of Chicago where I studied Video, Performance, Photography and Film.

Important things to me are dream recording, writing, correspondence art, experimental film, movement practices, reading & traveling. I try to travel as often as possible, even if it's just a driving trip of two hours to camp somewhere for a night or two.

I want to provide an environment for artists & other creative, passionate individuals to have a voice & present their work. Sharing stories, ideas, experiences & realities are what we're in it for. We at the gallery are holding the torch in the neighborhood to provide a space for what might be unsayable elsewhere. We are daily developing our intentional space here to create an inspiring atmosphere for all who step foot inside, whether it's for a project proposal or a short visit. It's an older building, lovingly-worn, rooms with character surrounding an open gallery space.

As an airbnb guest, you can expect that we'll be curious about you. Our roommates & us all get along really well: It is an easy going dynamic here at the house. We are an eclectic variety!

Looking forward to meeting you)

Expat Brit married to an american beauty originally from Wisconsin. 
We love to travel but hectic work life interferes.

I'm a Chicago area native, who has lived and worked in the city for 15 years. I'm a diehard cub fan, that knows the city and its neighborhoods pretty well. I used to be a traveling consultant so I know how overpriced hotels can be, especially when you're not even there most of the time. I have many favorite spots in Chicago, too many to list, but can share them with you if decide to stay with me.
My name is Mark. I´m originally from Chicago.  I live in Seville with my wife (Toni) and my 3 children.

I try to surround myself with courteous, inspiring, and genuine people.

Having lived with various people in a wide array of accommodation situations through traveling and hosting, I'm pretty flexible and easy to jive with!

I work a lot including many evenings and am rarely home.  Always available to answer questions or provide recommendations!

We've lived in Logan Square for the past 20 years and love the Chicago vibe.  I am married and live with my wife and two kids upstairs in the same building as the condo we are renting. We love to travel, check out new restaurants, explore the wealth of activities that Chicago has to offer, dance, listen to music, play ping pong, work in the garden and spend time with friends and family. As an Eagle Scout, I'm always prepared, so I'm close, ready and available to help if guests need anything to make their stay more enjoyable.

Don't go to Chicago -- LIVE in Chicago! 

Bienvenue!! на здоров'я!  I am a friendly Ukrainian-Canadian who now lives in Chicago's historic Hyde Park district. I know the city well and love going on culinary field trips around our great city. Nothing makes me happier than discovering a new dining treasure or a big fat Polish dog from Maxwell Street at 3 in the morning!

I'm the mother of three adult children, a grandma, and a servant to my spoiled little poodle.  I enjoy a wide breadth of music, cultural festivals and dining at mom-and-pop restaurants.  I also enjoy curling up under a fluffy blanket with a good book and a cup of tea on my quiet down days.

I believe that hospitality is something we should offer to every person, every day. Hosting makes me happy. I genuinely enjoy getting to know each and every one of my guests who arrive as strangers and depart as friends. 

Be kind to one another. Safe travels!!

I am a young professional, born and raised in Chicago. I went to University of Wisconsin - Madison (Go Badgers!) and decided to come back home to this city I love. When I am not working, I enjoy checking out new bars and restaurants and going to concerts and sporting events. I also love to travel, especially if it involves golfing or snowboarding.

I'm a documentary and fiction filmmaker, a musician, and a writer.  My day job is teaching cinematography and editing, and I'm also into pottery.  I like old things (including my 1969 VW bus), traveling, and getting lost in projects and ideas.

When I travel, I like unique experiences, learning from the locals, seeing different neighborhoods and exploring the area. I also like to be comfortable and appreciate an updated style. If you are anything like me - you'll love my place - good luck!

Hi, We are Marissa and Nathan. We live in a super fun area called Logan Square that we think you'll love. Marissa is an actress and I'm a teacher and we've been in this hood for over four years.   
Nothing too cute or catchy for us to share, just that we're a young married couple and we love to travel. If you're coming through town and want to stay in a hip, fun area then we say check out Logan Square. Other than that happy travels! 

Cheers from a midwestern Kansas City Chiefs fan to a sweet, cute Korean actress!

I enjoy playing the guitar and performing from time to time. My hobbies are riding my bike along the lakeshore path when the weather permits, traveling, snowboarding, and going to shows. I also enjoy switching my apartment up with new rehabbed furniture from pieces found at your local salvation army or antique shop. 

Favorite travel destinations: Paris, Guadalajara, Rome
Favorite Books: Art of Love by Erich Fromm, Siddhartha by Herman Hesse
Recent Favorite shows: Avenue Q, Brazilian Girls, Rodrigo Y Gabriela, Bonobo

I want my guests to enjoy their stay in Chicago, I believe it is a world class city. I like to think that my space highlights this awesome city and is also cozy enough to chill in if you don't feel like going out.

We are a local Chicago couple who has lived in the area for 12 years. We are always able to help guests to make their trip more enjoyable. Please contact us for recommendations for anything from restaurants to tourist activities.

I am a realtor and a lawyer who lives & works in Miami and Chicago.
I enjoy traveling and enjoy helping others explore their passions in a new place.
I am here to help you explore art & dining and music in Chicago!
Please get in touch as I have an art collector and music expert to help you!

I am a dancer, teacher and choreographer who has lived in Chicago for more than 25 years.  I am a creative, people oriented person who enjoys travel and making new friends.    I have lived and worked in the city for more than 25 years.  I know my way around pretty well, can share the major tourist attractions,  share some things with you that are off the beaten path and be a good resource to you about the arts community.  I am the founder of a small dance company that is in its 20th year.  I value long term relationships, collaboration and mentorship.

We love to travel.  We have been hosting friends and family for years and enjoy sharing their experiences.  Our home is pet and smoking free with an organic garden.  We look forward to welcoming you to our home!

I love traveling without having an itinerary, and wandering new locations to get a feel of the city/town and culture.  I studied abroad in Granada, Spain and taught English in Jaen, Spain, so lived in Andalucia for about 1 year.

We are designers and artists who love food, travel, and music. We've lived and worked abroad in Varanasi, India and have also enjoyed traveling in Europe, Japan, West Africa, Turkey, Mexico, Peru, Southeast Asia, North Africa, and various road trips all around the US. Grew up in the Bay Area and Chicago where we live today. When not building furniture or traveling we spend time making art out of metal and cooking Italian and Indian food.
We've travelled quite a bit and know how valuable a good space and great host can be. We sincerely want you to have the best experience and will do everything to make sure that happens!

Hello and Welcome to Chicago!

I'm born and raised in Chicago. When I'm not running around the city going on auditions, I practice and teach yoga. As a Registered Yoga Teacher by the Yoga Alliance, I have a focus in Vinyasa Flow and Prenatal Yoga. 

I welcome those traveling, those who have traveled, and those who want to travel!

A few things I can't live without are:
laughter, family, friends, my siamese cat, Cosette, and a cup a tea. 

I look forward to meeting you.

I am a single parent, as well as a local business owner. When I am not working, you'll find me in the kitchen cooking, heading to the lakefront or going to the local jazz club. My son is currently a university Freshman. But if you're lucky enough to meet him with his busy schedule, he seems to be my guest's favorite.

We love to host and have visitors, but we travel a lot too. I have been to 18 countries and my son has been to 9. Many families have hosted our visits in their cities, let us Chicago natives host your stay here in our fabulous city.

I'm from Chicago, IL and I work in medical device sales.  I love music, film, animals and travel.  I'm pretty laid back and enjoy just hanging out with some wine and good friends. 
I suppose I should add that I loved using Airbnb so much, that I have put my beloved home in Chicago up for rent on this sight.  So far I have had the pleasure to meet some really nice, cool & interesting people who enjoy staying at my old home as much as I did!!  Safe travels everyone. :)

My husband and I own this 3 unit flat, we live on the first floor, rent the 3rd floor to great tenants.  The 2nd floor is primarily used for our friends and family when they visit but when it's empty we love to share it with other travelers. 

The apartment is completely separate from the other units, but we're near by should you have any issues or just want to know which of the many cafes are the best in the neighborhood.

Come enjoy all that Chicago has to offer with us!
From Chicago, love this city. Enjoy the beach, traveling, and anything fun. If you have anything you'd like to know about me don't hesitate to ask.
Born and bred Chicagoan, south-sider. Love Chicago and all it has to offer. Even the weather : )
I am an Airbnb host as well as traveler. I am a native Chicagoan and travel any chance I get
I'm an easy-going, clean, and responsible actor-living and working in Chicago.

I'm originally from Chicago and have lived in Portland for about eight years. I've always had a passion for travel and have been lucky enough to visit about 40 countries, most recently Vietnam, Cambodia and Taiwan. Closer to home, funky, big city neighborhoods are my favorite places to explore. The natural beauty and mild climate are what drew me to the Pacific NW, but I return often to Chicago where I maintain business interests.

Hey guys! Just a little about me, I work in management at a large convention hotel.
I'm pretty relaxed. My favorite thing to do is relax with my three cats, Oliver, Huxley and Luna. I also like to craft. So if you have any questions about great places for thrifting, or stores in your gal! 
My boyfriend, George, lives with me. He works also works in the service industry. He also enjoys practicing magic as a hobby. Ask him to do a trick for you! 
Our favorite part of hosting on Airbnb is getting to meet new people from all walks of life. We may not always get to sit and talk with all of our guests but our little apartment is made so much better when its filled with life!
I love to go shopping, travel, go to basketball games, and eat the very best tasting food.

Born and raised in Louisville, KY, I have made my home in Chicago, IL. since the early 1980's.  I am a communication coach and consultant and have had my own small business practice for nearly 20 years.  I love helping my clients be better communicators and advocates for their ideas and goals.  I'm passionate about the arts, love movies, theatre, yoga, dance and exercise.  And of course, I  love to travel and have been lucky enough to see many wonderful parts of the world.
I'm 27 years old, and I'm a very clean person.  I always keep my loft and my apartment nice and tidy.  If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me.  Thank you for looking!

I'm an avid traveler who loves to explore and get as close to culture as possible.  I live in the city of Chicago, work in the business of building brands and love sharing time relaxing with my superstar husband.

We enjoy seeing live music, seeking out the most amazing food, and walking through new neighborhoods. 

We believe in leaving things as we find them - better in some cases!

Thank you for your interest in the Goose & Fox Hostel! We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world to dine with us, now we are opening our doors for the first time as a Hostel, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors. 

I've lived in the Lincoln Park neighborhood for almost 10 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes. There is always a new bar or restaurant opening. As a Chef and Musician I am tapped into some great scenes here in Chicago. We are lucky to have such vibrant Art, Music and Dining in the Second City.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 2006 after earning an Communications degree from Carthage College. After many years working in the Hospitality Industry I started Goose & Fox Supper Club in 2013. Over the years, we've updated and expanded our space to include the Goose & Fox Hostel, A laid back environment with access to a great city.
We have lived in Garfield Park for fifteen years, and love hosting people at our home.

I'm a 29 year old artist in med school... was raised in Qatar, grew up in Houston, moved to the Caribbean, and now live in Chicago and I'm loving it! Traveling, food, art, and music are a huge part of my life. I'm easy going and love meeting new people so I can't wait to meet you :)

I'm not a Chicago native, but I have been here long enough to the know the city like the back of my hand. I am a toy designer and I work in the west loop. I bought my 1870s row house 16 years ago and have been slowly working to turn it into an awesome home for my 8 year old daughter, my dog  and I.
I am a college professor who enjoys living in the city and taking advantage of the many sights and experiences it has to offer.

I recently graduated with an MBA and accepted a position as a Consultant in Chicago.  While I was in business school, I used AirBnB everywhere I traveled, including in Colombia, Argentina and various cities in the United States.  I met tons of great people through AirBnB while I was traveling and promised that I would host people when I returned to Chicago.

Young professional individual that love to live life to the fullest, travels a lot, and believe the best way to learn culture and to be educated is by traveling and taking to others. I like to work hard to play hard. I believe that nothing in life comes easy or free, and the way to success is by trying, failing, learning from those mistakes, and trying all over again.
I am professional, and work in digital marketing for a for a performance marketing agency.
Professional living in downtown Chicago in the River West neighborhood.
Siddharth from india. Gerontology major. Love photography,traveling, Kind, helpful, caring, understanding, patient, and loving.

I'm from the northern suburbs of Chicago. After serving 10 years in the military, I've lived basically all around the world. My wife and I had our son while I was stationed in Hawaii, and we can't wait to move back there someday. I am now an Actor and Graphic Designer living in Chicago, while my wife is a teacher.

Hi, my name is Daria. I am a woman in her 50's , an actress and teacher here in the great city of Chicago. I have lived in London and traveled many places such as Italy, Holland, France and closer to home New Orleans, New York , 
Los Angeles (where I grew up) etc. I have loved my experiences with Airbnb and hope I can provide a great base for someone looking to enjoy Chicago. I am friendly, neat and caring person and hope to assist you in your travels.
I am a wine importer and distributor in Chicago importing from Spain, France etc...

Chicago writer, theater-crazy.  Lived in Lakeview for 27 years.   I love this neighborhood!  I love Chicago and that the lake is always there to look at.  I love that there's SO much theater here (150 theaters or more) and great food and people from everywhere and young and less young too.  It's a big city and a small city all at the same time.

My wife and I are avid travelers and love meeting new people and exploring new places. I LOVE Chicago and as a lifelong Chicagoan I know every single neighborhood in this city and I am able to guide visitors to hidden gems all over our great City.  I am happy to share my knowledge with guests and to help them enjoy their stay. My wife of more than 20 years and I own this unique home and love sharing the experience of authentic Chicago with our guests.  Privacy is what we offer because here you have your own entry to come and go as you please and a Suite to yourself to relax after a day exploring America's greatest City.
Young gay couple born and raised in Chicago. We know every part of the city so I can give you pointers and maybe even join you if you'd like! Feel free i'm an open book.

I live in Chicago and love to travel with my husband and three young kids. We love to stay in neighborhoods and have a kitchen and appreciate providing that for others when we host guests in our home. Airbnb has made travel possible because we host in our own home while we are away. 

I work at an investment firm and my husband has his own business making vinyl records for local bands. We love to explore new areas and bring our kids along for the ride!

Young, successful and responsible professional gay male from Chicago.  Looking to experience the world, one fantastic vacation at a time! Both a guest and a host- I enjoy meeting interesting and fun people from around the world.

I'm an Iowa native but have recently found myself splitting time between Milan (Italy) and my favorite city in the U.S., Chicago.

When I'm in town I love to: spend hours at any one of the amazing local coffee shops, window shop on Milwaukee Ave., scope out the live music at Chicago's many street festivals, and browse Yelp to try a new restaurant–which you could do every day for the rest of your life in this city!

Hello!

My husband and I live in lower Lincoln Park near Downtown Chicago.  Originally from Minnesota, I have been living in Chicago since 2011 after doing a small tour in Seattle, WA. 

Traveling is one of my favorite things to do and I have been fortunate enough to spend a summer in Shanghai, Christmas in Kuala Lumpur, Spring Break in Washington, DC and my husband and I spent our honeymoon in the Mosel Valley in Germany. 

When I'm not traveling, I am cooking delicious vegetarian dishes and enjoying my silly dogs.

I'm a fun easy going person. I work as a flight attendant so meeting travelers and being a host comes naturally. I have a passion for music and the scene it travels in. You’ll always find me out and about enjoying the city life... Chicago is bursting with things to do! I'm happy to be your local guide to all the entertainment, dives, and eats. As a host I will always be welcoming and and accommodating. Don’t be surprised if I ask you to join! Life is full of fun.. Enjoy the ride!

I'm an artist and musician married to another artist/musician and we live in an apartment of the building we have listed on Air BnB. We both appreciate good food and loud music and find the most joy in trying to tackle a million projects at once. We picked Pilsen to live in forever because it has a strong sense of community and cherishes its artists.
Work in architecture, live in Chicago, travel the world when I can.

Eating, drinking, and travelling are my passions.

I'm an avid bicyclist and love to cook as well.

I teach grade school during the week and wait tables/bartend on the weekends.

I'm a super laid back host and happy to recommend places to go around the neighborhood and city.
Jon and I can't wait for you to stay with us in our newly remodeled two-flat!
I am originally from Guatemala and I have lived most of my life in Chicago near Logan Square. I am very energetic and loving by nature, so I can't wait to have you as my guest!

I've traveled in Asia, South America, and Central America where I've met wonderful, interesting, cool people.  I'd like to continue to do that by meeting travelers and being part of their trip by offering a place to stay in my extra bedroom.

Hi! Thanks for taking a look at my listing! I've lived in Chicago for around 5 years now and love it here! Exploring all the restaurants, breweries and bars is my favorite part of living in the city.
I hope you enjoy your trip to Chicago whether you stay at my apartment or not!

Hi! We are a young family living in Chicago's northwest neighborhood of Logan Square. We met shortly after moving here to attend college 12 years ago and have been busy making Chicago our home ever since. Brad is originally from Michigan and Leah is an American who grew up in southern Germany. Over the years we have gotten to know this city pretty well and are excited to be raising our family in such a culturally diverse part of the world. 

We enjoy travel, cooking, biking around the city and are eager gardeners in the making. We actively participate in neighborhood organizations and very much enjoy meeting the many wonderful people who work hard to make our community what it is. 

We are new to hosting and look forward to opening up our lovely home to fellow travelers who are looking for comfortable and cozy family friendly accommodations.
Avid traveler, love to explore food/drink/music scene wherever I go.

I'm a tech nerd currently running product management at a startup in Chicago. I fancy myself a very simple and trustworthy host with great communication leading up to and during your stay. Very few rules other than no smoking, no parties, and no shoes on in the house.

My favorite place to ski is Jackson Hole, WY. My favorite place to golf is Palm Desert, CA. Can't live without my wife (Aly), my dog (Birdie), my golf clubs, a good beer, and learning something new every day.

Hello, Thanks for your interest in my Airbnb.

My wife and I are both young professionals who recently moved to chicago because we love the city and everything it has to offer. We travel all the time, and are always on the road, so Airbnb was a good way for us to share our space with fellow travelers. I try to offer a space that has all the modern conveniences you would expect from a big chain hotel stay (i.e. toiletries, fresh linens, etc.) but with the look and feel of being at home. If you want to experience chicago living this is the way to do it. My home is close to all the things chicago locals enjoy, such as night life, music, festivals, and food. We hope you enjoy our space as much as we do.

Hi! :) I'm an occupational therapist working with kids, and my husband Steve is an attorney. I'm a Chicago native, and we both love traveling, live music, yoga, and bicycling. Our favorite vacation spot is Tulum, Mexico and our favorite food is pizza. :D We both really love to meet new people!

I became an Airbnb host after amazing Airbnb experiences while I was traveling! As a host I strive to create a serene and joyful experience and to think of every detail from good linens, to a spotless and sanitized space, spa shampoos and toiletries to good coffee. As a traveler I am gracious and happy to be there...

Dear Airbnb Travelers,

It is my great pleasure to welcome you to my home in Chicago, steps away from the lake on a quiet street, but nestled in one of the most vibrant neighborhoods and cities in the country!  I've lived in this historic home for 11 years, and love opening it to families and visitors from around the world.  

I'm a bass player that has traveled the world playing music, including most recently to India, and my work as a classical music radio producer has taken me to China, Bosnia, Colombia, Indonesia, Russia, and far beyond.  I've played with Chance the Rapper, interviewed Yo-Yo Ma, and even worked for the White House!

Airbnb has been so transformational in my life that I'm currently writing several books to help both travelers and hosts get the most out of the platform.  I pride myself on being a responsive but not overly invasive host, always ready with a restaurant recommendation or hidden neighborhood hotspot.
I'm a flight attendant. I travel for work and for fun. Have any questions?  Please ask.
North Dakota native, navigating life in Chicago. Always up for the next adventure!

I am a scientist at-large and a design entrepreneur. I have a Master’s Degree in Biophysics so my design process involves a lot of biomimicry

I have developed a keen eye for creating awe-inspiring surroundings with minimal and functioning styles and strong integration of indoor and outdoor spaces

Five things I can't live without:  great food, best friends, awesome family, my kittens, and frequent INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL.

Favorite Destinations: India, Paris, Thailand, Spain, Dubai, Jordan, Cyprus, Israel...anywhere we go has something new and interesting to see (and to eat).

Upcoming Destinations: Vietnam, Iran (still waiting on this one), Singapore, Philippines.
I am an entrepreneur, venture capital partner, love working with start-ups and love to spend time with my family and friends.

I moved to Lincoln Square last year and love my neighborhood so much that I cannot wait to share my place with travelers from around the world. The  community is wonderful and I look forward to helping you navigate through Chicago and have an amazing experience. 

I love history, politics and traveling.  Looking forward to meeting you.

- Sara

I'm a single man who is native to Chicago. I have two beautiful daughters and a large extended family that I love and enjoy spending time with.  I'm also an educator who enjoys making a difference in the lives of young people.  I love to travel and have been to most of the states in the US as well as many countries abroad.
I have used AIRBNB on several occassions and will continue to use it in my future travels.

An American living in Paris. I've been here for eighr years.  Travel extensively.  I know the city inside and out, including those hidden gems.  Live in a quiet passage nestled behind other buildings and away from traffic.  As a host I can speak with you about your plans and provide advice.   Love the city and enjoy sharing that with others.

I'm a retired business executive, and occasional business consultant in the Life Sciences and food industries.  I have one grown son who is married, and two beautiful grandsons.  I co-own a fine dining New American Cuisine restaurant with my son, who manages the operation on a day-to-day basis, in the Miller Beach community of Northwest Indiana.  I have a beach home in the Indiana Dune National Lakeshore near the business and family.  My favorite travel destinations are France, Italy, Arizona, Napa/Sonoma, and Key West, to name a few.  My interests include wine, dining out, literature, live music, film, art and culture.

Hi and thanks for taking a look at my place! My name is Daniela and I am from Chicago. I love this city! So much to see and do. I love exploring all the lovely neighborhoods Chicago has. My place is centrally located and is easily accessible(public transportation and by car)whether you're looking to explore or even a great place if you are just looking for some serenity during your visit. Enjoy!
Singaporean living and working in Chicago. Former consultant with ZS Associates, currently a real estate investor and developer.
Laid back, easy going, respectful to people & property.

I'm a traveller that looks for the next positive experience. Love to meet people and explore. I've been a teacher, bus operator, and many other  exciting careers. I'm now self employed and enjoying the perks of getting around.

I am both an Airbnb guest, and a host!   I am a very avid traveller, and am always on the lookout for clean accommodations.  Airbnb has been a great resource in my travels.  Conversely, if you contact me for a stay in my home, I would love to hear about your reasons for travelling to Chicago and I offer a clean and comforting space with 5 star reviews.

More about me:  I am a financial professional, born and raised in Chicago.  I often work abroad, which has included stints of formal abroad living for long periods of time.   I am easy going, low maintenance, friendly and respectful.

I grew up and lived most of my life in Chicago, just moved out to California and I am enjoying all of the new places I get to visit. I work as a high school English teacher along with teaching yoga on the side. I am a very mindful and respectful guest, as I used to host Airbnb and know how wonderful it is to have one's home cared for.
From Chicago USA and am a guitar manufacturer

I'm a native of the Rocky Mountains but have found a great home in Chicago.  This city is full of life!  Our home is a vintage (frame) bungalow in a safe and green part of the city.  I hope you enjoy the beautiful art on our walls and the beautiful garden that we have.  I want you to feel at peace and yet adventurous when staying at my home.
From Chicago.

I work in the heart of Chinatown. I own a travel agency and on my free time, like to dabble in real estate + health/life insurance. I have a spacious home and love to house short or long term guests. My daughter Maci lives on the property- we have private rooms in shared units or whole units available. 

My whole family loves to travel, especially to Asia. If you need information on Chicago or any other traveling tips, don't hesitate to ask!

I'm a travel fiend from Chicago that is looking forward to adventuring on Airbnb!  I enjoy soccer, languages, yoga, and meeting new people.  I've had great experiences staying at Airbnbs in Chicago and New York, and now I'm looking to do a bit of hosting myself.
I'm from Chicago. I like walking and exploring the city. I teach environmental design and urban planning.

We're a couple that loves hosting as much as we love traveling.  Seeing the world has been and remains a major source of fulfillment in our lives - which you will see expressed in our collection around the home.  But meeting new people and giving them a great experience is also a very fulfilling part of our lives.

I love to host, it's fantastic to connect with people from all over the world and make them feel home away from home.  My life's motto is:  You take one thing with you when you die and that is your word!  No one on Earth can replace it...
I love to travel and thus far my two favorite places due to the weather are Puerto Rico and Hawaii, absolutely beautiful.

I grew up in Pittsburgh, PA, lived briefly in Hong Kong and London, and settled in Chicago.  I've been here for over 10 years now and I love it!  You will too...

I'm really crazy about FOOD and beverages (tea, coffee, beer, wine, bourbon, Japanese whiskey)...  I've been to most top restaurants in Chicago at least once, and I'm always on the scene sampling the latest...

I'm also nuts about traveling, so I usually get out of the country 4-5 times per year.  So far, I've been to nearly 60 countries and my favorites are pretty much all in Asia and Central/South America...  I love soccer, health and fitness, photography, skiing, surfing, hiking, biking, scuba diving...  DIY projects are fun and most nights you'll find me cooking up some food and enjoying some tea.

I never watch TV, ever.  I listen to all types of music, with a balanced concentration of hardcore hip-hop and contemporary piano.  I don't have a personal life motto, but I strongly believe that the world would be a better place if people were able to live in someone else's shoes for a day.  The more exposure to others and the more new experiences we encounter, the less ignorance, fear, and problems in the world.  Airbnb is great for that, and so I'm a big supporter...

I'm a travel junkie always researching my next trip! 

Right now I am traveling through Australia with my partner Kevin. We are currently living in Melbourne.

I live on the northwest side of the city with a few small dogs and cats. I know that finding housing in Chicago when visiting can at times be difficult and is always expensive. I want to share my guest room with kind, respectful, animal loving visitors to help you have a pleasant stay and put some extra money in my pocket. I recently started my own business, called Pitter Patter Parenting, to help families manage kids and pets together safely. I enjoy hosting out of town guests so I can serve as an ambassador for my wonderful city and so I can make a little money to help me grow my new business. I love to cook and drink wine and I have a nice backyard that can be enjoyed all spring - fall. I've installed some raised garden beds and love to grow my own vegetables. I'd be happy to share a glass of wine with you and answer any questions that I can about the Chicago area.

We are a friendly, down to earth, semi-active couple. We love to catch Broadway in Chicago shows, walk by the lake, sit out on the deck, and use Groupon to take downtown adventures.  We are also minor foodies and love to indulge in new restaurants.

We love to meet new people from all walks of life and from around the world. We have a great deal of respect for other cultures and love to watch documentaries concerning such.

- Take the high road in life, it will get you everywhere -
Husband, father and therapist living in Chicago.
I'm Mark, a photographer and filmmaker from Chicago IL.  I live on the 2nd floor of a 2 flat in Logan square, and host guests in the garden apartment (with a private entrance).

Love traveling, discovering new places, finding great places to eat.
Decided to be a host at the end of May 2015 after having such great experiences being a guest through Airbnb.
My happy place is Austin, Texas. Great outdoors, great food, great people. Plus wonderful yoga studios.
Love helping people out as a host and help them discover our neighborhood.
My motto is keep on smiling no matter what happens.

Hi my name is Miranda! I am a Ohio native and have been living here in Chicago for four years. I come from a big loving supportive family. I have five amazing sisters. I have the best parents in the world. I live for my family first and foremost. They are my everything. I enjoy traveling, spending time with family and friends, trying new restaurants, music, fashion, and all things great!

I am a singer, songwriter and homeschooling mom of two boys. Our family is passionate about travel and learning about and exploring cultures different from our own. We cherish the friendships and connections we've made on our adventures and look forward to many more.

I am a school social worker who loves to scour markets for vintage finds, travel, work on home projects, read, spend time with friends, and practice hot yoga. Entertaining and hosting is a joy and I look forward to providing a lovely Airbnb experience!

We live a very busy lifestyle so our home is our sanctuary. We are well traveled people  (6 continents!) and our travel collection can be enjoyed in our worldly home. We are practicing Buddhists so we have a sacred space for meditation or just an area to relax and read a good book.

This is our home, so we decided to have a four night minimum that will be enough for us to share our home and go on trips ourselves :)

I love to travel, and I love the idea of Airbnb. I had a wonderful first experience with Airbnb during my visit to Costa Rica, and I am excited to offer my own home as an Airbnb in Chicago. 

I am a single mom with a 14-year-old son, and am in the process of stepping into the gig economy as a free-lance writer, eBay tycoon, Airbnb super host, and farmer's market "flower girl." For the past year, I’ve been working as an Uber driver, and it is actually is one of the reasons I decided to become an Airbnb host. After picking up/dropping people off in downright unsafe or “middle of nowhere” neighborhoods, I realized that my place has a lot to offer. Even though it is a bit off the beaten path, it is close to a bunch of very cool neighborhoods, and it is easy to get downtown or to the lakefront. 

I have a master's degree in historic preservation from the University of Vermont, and Chicago’s amazing architecture (and music scene) contributed to my decision to move here. I have actually lived in Chicago three separate times--the last time being the longest--when I moved back from Providence, Rhode Island, in 2003, leaving my job as the director of a history museum to be closer to my family before the birth of my son. 

I am a very easy-going roommate. Late-night noise, as long as it is reasonable, won't bother me, and I am not going to freak out if you don't do your dishes (although I will be very appreciative!). I am a smoker so if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke, this space will not be a good fit. 

It is very likely that during your stay, I will either not be here at all (except during sleeping hours, loosely defined, of course!), or holed up in my bedroom/office working on various projects and job hunting. 

I like meeting new people and am generally up for a chat, but I am also cool with folks that want to keep to themselves and prefer more privacy. 

My son, depending on the rental date, may or may not be here (he stays at his dad's apartment part of the week).  If he is here, you probably won't see him much either--he likes to chill in his room or go out with his friends. Despite the fact that he's a teenager, I think he's a pretty good kid with good manners.

My other "roommate" is my 22 lbs. Labradoodle named Chestnut (or "Chessie,") a very sweet, cute dog who is shy around strangers. Fellow allergy sufferers please note that this breed is among those considered to be hypoallergenic, and I have had basically zero symptoms since getting her. (She doesn't shed at all.) If the dog being here is a big problem, I may be able to make arrangements for her to stay at my ex-husband's apartment, just let me know.

With a passion for travel and a background in luxury hospitality management, Airbnb is a natural way I can share my own version of hospitality.  My partner, Gus, and I love to explore different places, try new foods/wine and spend time with our friends and family. As an Airbnb Superhost, rest assured you will have a comfortable and memorable stay in our “Uptown Gem” Chicago condo.
Accommodating, loves traveling and appreciates different cultures/food etc.

My fiancé Irec and I closed on our Logan Square 3-flat building in July of 2014, an exciting and overwhelming moment for us! After having time to settle in and find our ultimate style of living, we decided to run an Airbnb in our garden unit. We love the idea of being able to connect with people from all over the world, and look forward to learning what brings our guests to Chicago and to our home!

5th Generation Chicagoan with a deep knowledge of all the great attractions that makes the City of Big Shoulders great. I'm a consummate traveler having hit 30+ countries across all seven continents who is eager to swap stories of adventure.  

I've recently returned to hosting after a break of a couple years which I used to renovate my apartment and another apartment in my building.  Great hospitality is something I've received so much of and I am always excited to pay it forward.  

I love cooking, coffee, culture, and being as active as I possibly can.

Hi my name is Anthony and I love being an Airbnb host in Chicago! I take great pride in hosting people from around the world in my luxurious homes and welcome you to the wonderful city of Big Shoulders. I look forward to hosting you!

Born in India, raised in London and transplanted to America as a well-established Chicago immigration attorney, I'm thrilled to be hosting local, national and international guests. We are into cycling, creek-stomping, delicious food, open air concerts, beaches & street markets. We welcome our airbnb guests with warmth & excitedly look forward to continuing to develop our network of worldwide friendships.
Easy going, fun loving guy. I believe in respect and integrity above all.

Hey everyone! My name is Amanda, I was born and raised in beautiful Chicago, IL. Like most people on this site I love to travel which I have to attribute to my parents, who from an early age took me and my sister all around the world, seriously there are a lot of pictures of us on camels and horses. We have been lucky enough to travel to crazy places like Bhutan and crawl through ancient Mayan caves in Belize, its been a lot of fun and will continue to be an integral part of all our lives. 

Through our travels we have met amazing people who welcomed us into their homes and made us feel connected to the local community! I first started using Airbnb obsessively when I was living in Denmark and using every free moment to travel around Europe. I loved the experience so much that I was able to convince my parents to ditch the traditional hotel route. We all have become huge Airbnb advocates, and wanted to open our home to people coming to Chicago!

Like most Chicagoans we are very proud of our city! There is so much to do and see and so many great restaurants to eat at, yes our local cuisine extends beyond deep dish pizza (but seriously deep dish is amazing)! 

Feel free to reach out to us regarding any questions you may have! We look forward to welcoming you into our home!

Airbnb Chicago 'Above & Beyond' Award Recipient. 
Airbnb Community Leader Host.
Art For Life Chicago, a non-profit organization. Founder and Philanthropist.

Proceeds to your stay will supports local artists and support my non-profit organization that help people in need  including youth homelessness.

Laid back, down to earth professional.  Volunteerism is healthy for the soul.  

Home to me isn't about how fancy the furniture is, the knick-knacks one collects or how well decorated the place is. Home is a feeling.  A really, really good feeling once you're inside from the hustle and bustle of work and the everyday life.  The home I created is full of memories when I was a kid both growing up here in the States and the Philippine countryside; my dad's mid-century furniture, my aunt's $1 table find in the second hand store, the discarded dresser I found on the Detroit curb ,the books that makes me happy when they're opened, and to the art collection that spans 30 years.  They're all inside.

As an Airbnb guest, you are welcomed and greeted with open arms during your stay. There is no hustle or bustle here.  Those glitz and trends are all outside.  Please note that this it's not a hotel because nothing here is perfect.  The wood floors creek, left over paint still clinging onto the wood door trims.  The linens are clothes lined sun-bleached, the flowers and fruits are fresh from the farmer's market and iced tea is made the old fashioned way. I truly believe that authenticity is the best form of luxury.  Please feel right at home.

Want to know more about me and my Airbnb home?  Check out these internet accessible sites :

Airbnb Story:  "Airbnb Chicago Oliver"
Vimeo: "Aircurate Airbnb"
Thrillist Chicago:  "10 of the Most Unbelievable Airbnb in Chicago".
FBook: "Uptown Chicago Greystone Apartment" (recommend looking for current events)
Local News highlights: NBC. Fox. CBS.  Crain’s Chicago.

I love to travel and have had the best experiences when I was given the opportunity to stay in other people's homes.  I enjoy the idea that someone can have the opportunity to enjoy Chicago from a perspective  offered  from a viewpoint a little less as a tourist, and more as a "guest"
I am an artist and metalsmith and make my living doing custom fabrication for restaurants and other people's homes   For my own home, I use repurposed/salvaged materials as much as is possible.

We have traveled the world and though Vietnam is our favorite country, Chicago is home and we love it! We are foodies at heart, try to hit at least 1 Michelin Star restaurant a year. Fun fact, both our children have enjoyed The French Laundry in utero.  We are laid back and live in the heart of Lakeview, minutes from the Red/Brown Line to easily access downtown as well as access to dozens of restaurants and activities within a mile. So settle in with us for a short stay or an extended period of time and come find out why Chicago is the greatest city in the world.

host_location: New York, New York, United States
about_host:
Diane is from Chicago, I am retired from United Airlines, I like to work out and go to movies, shop,
watch old movies and cook healthy food.  I have a 31 year old son that live in New York he is a artist. I have a 19 year old in College in Illinois I am new empty- nester starting a new life.
I stay up late, I am neat and I respect other and mind on Business. I love my neighborhood.
Clarence - Likes to be called Sonny he is a DJ by night and works in retail by day and when he has time he is a personal trainer.  He is very out going and loves New York & Loves Music.  He is very busy and out of the apartment a lot.

I work for a famous game company, and also have been a working artist for over a decade, and love to travel to develop my understanding of people and space. I grew up in Alaska, have lived in Berlin, and have traveled all over the US. I'm super good at bananagrams. 
Usually I am taking dance classes and working on a show. Sometimes I leave my home of Chicago to visit friends and take dance workshops elsewhere.
Blerg, I feel like this makes me sound so dull. Really, I'm a very amusing creature. Promise.
Ok, check it out. I'll try harder.
I know way more about squid and different kinds of genetic mutations than anyone I know. How's *that* for interesting?! I watch lots of films, but truly love the horror genre. Ask me about my interest in restorative justice if you don't have anywhere to be for awhile. 
A hamburger has never crossed my lips. I don't drink soda, and I don't have a TV. Never learned how to drive. 
My cholesterol, blood sugar, and heart rate are pretty right on though. And I can change a flat bike tire.

Originally from Brooklyn, New York, Chicago is now my home. after a 20 year career in accounting I am pursuing my more artistic leanings. I'm an accomplished actor on the Chicago theatre scene ( (Hidden by Airbnb) David Adams Chicago Actor) I am an avid art collector, and citizen of the world. I love people of all nationalities, political viewpoints, and other distinctions. I love Disney movies with memorable songs, Broadway show tunes and interesting people. My favorite sound is laughter and my favorite sight is tears of joy.

Hello!

We are a married couple living in Chitown.  We love meeting new people, especially travelers such as ourselves.  Looking forward to the Air BnB experience!

Aloha,

Dave & Anna
An outgoing female professional who loves to play host ! :)

Hello
My guests call me “Mr. Aughty”. I hope to be your host when you visit Chicago. My cozy townhouse with clean rooms and comfortable beds is located on the south side of the city. It’s just a 5 minute walk to Public Transportation trains (Red Line) and a 3 minute drive to the Dan Ryan Expressway.
I am a devoted vegan who enjoys cooking. I have lived all my life in Chicago, and I attended Columbia College here where I got my BA in Film & Video. Now that I am a senior citizen and retired for the most part, I spend most of my leisure time photographing and gardening. I have done some traveling to Jamaica, Mexico, Puerto Rico, South Africa, France, Ireland and England.
Wishing you and yours safe travels to Chicago or wherever your adventures lead you.

Dear Host,

I am a homeowner/traveler who runs a small business that focuses on hiring Mandarin Chinese speaking candidates for various industries. I do a lot of traveling between Chicago, Las Vegas, New York, Miami, Shanghai and Taiwan. I will definitely treat your place, like its mine.

We love to travel and we've had such a great experience doing so with Airbnb that we figured we'd open ourselves up to the hosting side!

Having lived all over Chicago, in Lakeview, Wrigleyville, Streeterville, and now Ukrainian Village, we consider ourselves a wealth of knowledge on how to enjoy this awesome city!

host_location: New York, New York, United States
about_host:
I'm truly a citizen of the world!  To me nothing rings truer than the old expression, "home is where the heart is." No matter where we've been during a hectic day of work or travel, and no matter what the day brings, coming home should be very special, and give you a sense of entering your sanctuary. Because home is so important to us all,  I take pride in knowing that the homes that we occupy are filled with love, warmth, and happiness.  Sharing our homes with friends and family brings us joy, and hopefully gives others joy in the process. My Motto: "You today and me tomorrow" sums up the feeling of making guests feel welcome and at home in our homes.
I travel the world for a living, and have an equal measure of love and respect for beautiful homes, architecture and design.  I tend to make myself at home where ever my travels lead me.
We share homes in gratitude to those who have generously and most graciously shared their homes with us along the road in our travels.  I am a true Chicago native, but have also made Brooklyn and all of New York City home.  In sharing our homes, we hope that you'll find your own love for the Amazing Cities that we call home as well.  Happy Travels!
Designer. Mom. One who wishes she could travel more often.

Hi, my name is Carrie, I live here with my 3 kids: 2 boys (16 and 19) and 1 girl (14).  We've lived in Chicago our whole lives. We love to travel as a family and always use airbandb when we do.  So we thought we could share our home for people to enjoy.  We hope you enjoy your stay!
Sailor girl that loves travel, food, wine and people!
Rosa and Jeremiah are loving partners who collaborate on a variety of art projects while working in creative and art industries in Chicago.

I love Chicago. Love the architecture & culture, food, goofy pockets, it's endless possibilities.

Our 1896 home-- small, clean, contemporary-- is less than a 12 minute stroll and 30 minute subway ride to the world via O'Hare Airport. 

We are located in a safe, clean, quiet neighborhood with mature trees and free street parking should you have a car (but you don't really need one).

A stay is designed for the budget traveler: private room with one queen-size, super awesome comfy air-mattress. 

The room is cozy -- rooms built in 1896 were-- best suited for a couple. 
Private bathroom, continental breakfast, wifi access. 
At this time, no private tv but why would you want it when there's so much else to do?

House dog will enthusiastically welcome you. 
This is a nonsmoking space.

GLBT friendly. 
Easy walk to Blue Line subway, bus terminal and Metra train.
Sonia & Syed are Chicago Natives. We can give you recommendations for food and fun! Mother to my beautiful baby Sofia
I'm a girl.
Chicago, IL

I'm a Chicago transplant via the Quad Cities and have lived in the city since 1993.  I've lived in several neighborhoods and my husband and I settled in Humboldt park for the diversity of the neighborhood and the beauty of the actual park.  

I'm the founder and executive director of The Arts of Life- a professional arts' studio that supports artists who have developmental/ intellectual disabilities.  We have two studios (Chicago and Glenview) and we'd love to show you around if you are interested in intuitive art and a unique not-for-profit. 

I'm also involved in my husband's not-for-profit, Rogue Philanthropy- a restaurant concept that gives our profits back to local not-for-profits.  

We have a chocolate lab, Tucker,  who loves new people and looks forward to our guests.  We spend most of our free time with him at the park or other forest preserves.
