I am a single, straight, 39 year old male artist and musician. I do graphic design by day and play music by night. I work closely with a lot of visual and musical artists. I also work with a few venues, bars and festivals, booking bands and intermediating with organizers and artists. 

My background is mexican-american. I travel to Mexico 2-times a year for festivals or other music related activities. I travel the US on tour with my band about 2 times a year. 

I do like to go out to new venues, bars or galleries every weekend. 

I am non-religious, politically active, bilingual (spanish) and work too much.  I am Friendly, respectful, intelligent and easy going.

I live in Chicago for more of 20 years and is a wonderful city,  Why I love Chicago? for its diverse ethnicity, people, theaters, museums, diverse neighborhoods and its street festivals, its amazing architecture in downtown, entertainment venues and restaurants.
Chicago has a long story of developing a strong and multicultural community, working united for their people, sharing their multiple values and skills to support each other.
- Here is a little something about myself: I am self employed and Community Organizer and I am work for many years around social justice issues promoting leadership, civil rights and education,  I am also part of a global company as an Entrepreneur and Global Trader, I'm Hispanic and I was born in Perú, with German Spanish descent; non-smoker very respectful, laid back, easy going and very friendly.
We are a family of three and we are very friendly, respectful and also we have three cats that are part of our family that lives with us in the first floor (no cats in the lower floor or second floor)

Greetings from Chicago

Yo vivo en Chicago por más de 20 años y es una ciudad maravillosa, ¿Por qué me encanta Chicago? por sus diversas etnias, su gente, teatros, museos, diversos barrios y sus festivales callejeros, su impresionante arquitectura en el centro, lugares de entretenimiento y restaurantes. 
Chicago tiene una larga historia de desarrollo de una comunidad fuerte y multicultural, trabajando unidos para su pueblo, compartiendo sus múltiples valores y habilidades para apoyarse mutuamente.

Somos una familia de tres y somos muy amables, respetuosos y también tenemos tres gatos que son parte de nuestra familia que viven con nosotros en el primer piso (no gatos en El Segundo piso o el sótano) 

Saludos desde Chicago!
I love exploring new cities, eating our way around Chicago, and meeting new people from all over the world! We can't wait to welcome you to our great city!

I am an artist, living and creating in my homeland of Chicago.  Zach and I met singing a'cappella at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, and we live together in the Ravenswood neighborhood of Chicago.  Zach is a musician. 

We are health-concious, active, and love food!  We are also road hungry -- we like to travel, and many of our trips end up coinciding with Zach's endurance races.  He aspires to run not only a marathon in each state before he turns 50, but also complete a number of Ironman triathlons and Ultramarathons!  Zach is a badass.  I like to think he would say the same about me.

Hi Airbnb friends. I am a pioneer in this neighborhood- been here 26 years and I am still always discovering something new! I am an interior designer and had fun decorating this space!
I live upstairs with my very non- barking dog RooBear who is sure to delight!

I've lived and worked as an artist in Pilsen for over 15 years. My home is a live/work studio gallery in a Victorian storefront house! My soulmate Bob and I work to keep the place organized and filled with a variety of artists' works.
In 2003 I received a Master of Arts from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.  In 2003 I started a 501(c)(3) that provides art programs for underserved communities, called the Museum of Universal Self Expression, or MUSE, Inc. This is It Studio/Gallery is a branch of MUSE. Bob & I are grateful for our lives together blessed with serenity now!

A seasoned educator and entrepreneur who is actively involved in cultural events and educational initiatives. I like to travel, enjoy all types of music, go to the movies frequently, love international cooking and work hard in the promotion of my home care services small business.
I am a Senior Creative Consultant at Chicken & Egg Pictures and a Producer at Our Film Works. I love to read and to travel!

My wife, Kira, and I are new to hosting, but with the help of our cats, Motor and Millie (in spirit only), we are excited to be a part of this community.  We love hanging in the yard and watching our veggies / fruits grow.  Come stay with us and get to know us!
I live in Chicago with my husband, two kids and two dogs. We love to travel every chance we get.
Minimalist traveller, usually opt for the scenic route.

I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I worked for Apple. I currently consult with companies about technology/internet/social media/marketing/branding. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first floor. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private), the second floor is a hostel style AirBnB, and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that are available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me).
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek. I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. I also just started playing hockey! At age 52! Crazy. 
We have been hosting guests for three years now. We have over 141 reviews. We are a SuperHost. We love this. And we are really good at it.
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

I love outdoor and water sports, and since moving to Miami I have picked up Kayaking, Paddle boarding and Kite boarding.  I am a Professional systems engineer and consultant and constantly travel for work or leisure so my place is often available and has everything you will need for a pleasure or business trip and if there is anything I can do to make your trip more enjoyable just ask and I will be do my best to make it happen. I know Miami and Chicago pretty well so I can provide any recommendations from Best restaurants, cheap eats or things to do just hit me up :)

Hi! Welcome! My name is Hussein and my wife’s name is Saarah. We have lived in Chicago for 6 years. I am originally from an island located in the shores of East Africa called Mombasa in Kenya. Saarah grew up in the capital city called Nairobi. We love to travel and meet new people :)

Hello!  I'm Rebecca, but call me Stolie. I have been a self-employed musician and condo owner since 2007.  I get to sing and entertain for a living, so my job is basically to make people happy!  It doesn't get much better than that. :)

I feel like this sentiment transfers to my style as an Airbnb host -- I want to make people feel immediately welcomed, at home, and comfortable.  When we meet, I will greet you with a HUG (my dad taught me this and I can't help it!)

About me:  I love being outside, riding my bike, going to the beach, the gym, the park. I don't watch much TV, but if I need screen time, I've got Netflix to marathon series or movies. I eat pretty healthy at home, but I love going out to eat even more, accompanied by a cocktail, wine or beer. (Or out for drinks accompanied by food!)

I've got some travel plans ahead of me, but in the meantime, I'm learning about other cultures just by having YOU stay with me! Every new visitor opens my eyes to something new about a place, or a people, and it makes me love humans even more. Thanks for sharing yourself with me! :)

Hi there, 
I'm Stephanie. Born and raised in Eastern Europe - Ukraine. Came to the States over 20 years ago and love both this country as well as travelling to new places. 
Back at home, I was an economist, now I am a caregiver and I absolutely love what I do. Love the people and personal connections I make with them, love helping others and seeing how happy they get when they know they can rely on me. I have a daughter who lives abroad and a son who also lives in Chicago. I like keeping myself busy, work a lot, and I also love cooking. Have met some interesting guests and am happy to share my home good people from all over the world. 

Safe travels, guys!

We love travel when we can afford the time, and when we do we always look for unique places to stay.  We love the relaxed nature of home sharing, so we're very excited about sharing our Chicago home with other Airbnb members!

My name is Sheila. I am a worker in a local non-for-profit. My roommate and best friend, Nick is a craftsperson who loves community and travels a lot for work and visiting the various places he calls home. I like being creative, but would never call myself an artist. More crafty than anything else. I would love to travel to Asia again someday. 

As a traveler, I am low-key, low-maintenance and helpful. Its the art of being present and useful but not being underfoot. Understanding that people have a need for both company and solitude. 

Nick is friendly, outgoing, and very helpful, and has a quiet contemplative side as well. He has traveled all over the US.

I was born and raised on the north side of Chicago.  My wife is from Manhattan by way of Rochester and Cleveland.  We live with our son in Logan Square.

She's an academic and I am an entrepreneur and real estate investor.  We both love design, art and photography.

We keep telling ourselves that we're going to start cooking more, but constantly find ourselves out exploring new restaurants and revisiting neighborhood favorites.

As hosts, we pride ourselves on being responsive, providing a clean, friendly environment, and sharing enough local knowledge to help you experience the city not only as a tourist, but also like a local.

I was born and raised in the Chicagoland area which has made me an avid Chicago sports fan. I love to attend Cubs, Blackhawks, Bulls and Bears games and coach local youth sports teams in my free time. I also enjoy good food and craft beer and will gladly travel out of my way to go a highly regarded restaurant or a coveted beer release. I am currently studying for the CPA test which takes up a good portion of my free time, but I hope to be able to travel and see more of the world once I have completed all portions of the testing. I strive to provide my guests with the best possible lodging experience and my goal is to make their trip a memorable one. I have done a fair share of traveling myself so I know how important the little thing are, and try to accommodate any groups specific needs.
Love food, travel and wine....

Young Professional who loves to travel the world. I like to take a vacation every chance I can get. I know what its like to arrive to a new city with no idea what to do first and with a burning desire to experience the best culture the city has to offer, let me help you enjoy and discover Chicago! I enjoy hosting with the help of my mother because we enjoy meeting new people and listening to a new point of view on life that my guests may have.

Chicago is"My Kind Of Town"... We have lived in the neighborhood for many years. Friendly neighbors. The Botanic Garden is one of my favorite places to visit in any of Chicago's 4 Seasons. We enjoy Lincoln Park Zoo, Navy Pier, Willis Tower & The John Hancock, Cloud-gate, Art Institute, MSI, MCA, Field, Shedd Aquarium, Planetarium, Soldier Field, United Center, Wrigley Field, Sox Park & The Chicago Theatre, just to name a few. Chicago is full of "neighborhoods" like Ukraine Village, River North, Uptown, Wrigleyville, DePaul, Logan Square, Old Town, Chinatown, Gold Coast and so many more.

My husband and I started staying in Airbnb's while exploring cities in America. We travel so much, and love Chicago so much, that we thought it made sense to share our home as well!

We adore this city and are happy to give you any tips or tricks to have the best possible trip.

We love to travel too and are always on the lookout for suggestions. We love Puerto Rico, and recently visited Germany, London, Paris & Barcelona. Our next big trips are Iceland and Italy.
Project Manager and Founder of a non-profit in Chicago. Loves traveling and exploring new places. :o)

I'm a single mother to a beautiful 5 year old (so if you have children I'll be able

I love to travel and do it as much as possible. I've used Airbnb all over the world I'm looking forward to hosting and meeting a ton of fascinating people. I've lived in Logan Square for the past 18 years "I just love it" and believe you will too. Feel free to ask anything, we will see what we can do.

My husband, Zev, and I live in Chicago with our four kids, Avi, 12; Tomer, 11; Shayna, 6; and Moshe, 4. Both Zev and I have full time jobs in the computer sector, he as a web coder and me as an eLearning developer. We're passionate about music (Zev leads a great Jewish rock band called Farbrengiton) and dedicated to family, friends, and community.

I'm a working professional with a passion for travel, dance, and adventure.  I work in the music industry and love live music, so you can usually find me checking out a concert around the city.  

I tend to keep very busy and am always on the go.  A typical summer weekend might consist of biking to the beach, attending a street fest, BBQing with friends, attending a book club, running a race, working out, camping, bike riding, checking out a new restaurant...basically anything.  I'm always up for a random road trip, and trying new things or seeking out an adventure.

In 2010 I made a New Years resolution to get out of the country at least once a year; it was the best New Years resolution I've ever made.   Since then I have traveled to the Dominican Republic, St. Lucia, Costa Rica, Italy, Thailand, Vietnam, Jamaica, Grand Cayman Islands, Mexico, and Peru.  

In the interim between my own travels, I love to host fellow travelers and help make their own experiences as comfortable as possible.

We are a brother and sister team born and raised on the north side of the city of Chicago. We have spent our whole lives in the city. We love to travel, listen to a wide range of music, and enjoy the arts. Our careers take up most of our time, but we are looking forward to hosting our listing on Airbnb and welcoming everyone to Chicago like only we know how to do.

My wife and I have been living in Chicago since 2014 and are both teachers in Chicago Public Schools.  We moved here from the great state of Iowa and both graduated from the University of Iowa.  We love football, biking, playing card games, and drinking good beer.

We're usually free during the summers.  We'd happily show you around the city and introduce you to Chicago's many great dining/drinking establishments.  If you're attending an event or a show, we'd also be happy with pointing you in the right direction and then getting out of your hair!

A young professional who grew up in the suburbs of Chicago. I enjoy staying active by exercising on a regular basis and traveling as much as I possibly can. I absolutely love meeting and getting to know new people, everybody's story is unique. On the weekends I like to get together with friends for some drinks, hit up a street festival or try a new restaurant. There is never a dull moment in the city.

We are an adventurous couple, who love to cook, travel, and meet new people.  We are happy to host visitors to Chicago who need a convenient location to explore all that the city has to offer. Things we love include brunch, a good movie, the outdoors, friends & family, and our precious "Daughter" Nixy. Our favorite movies include Death Becomes Her, the Harry Potter series, Lord of the Rings, and The Shining, just to name a few. We have a taste for spicy ethnic foods, especially Thai, Indian, Latin, and Cajun cuisine. 
We are easy going, and always enjoy getting to know new people.  As hosts, you can expect us to be attentive to your needs, and can be as engaged or private as you desire.  On the weekends, we will be happy to cook you a meal, and guide you to some incredible local entertainment and amenities.  We speak speak English, Spanish, and Portuguese and love to share cultural experiences and talk about world travel.  

 (Website hidden by Airbnb)

BridgeStreet Global Hospitality is the leading international provider of serviced apartment experiences. Whether you're staying three days, three weeks or three years we can give you the space, freedom and comfort of serviced apartment living, wherever you need to be. I'm an artist, wife, family gal and dog-owner who enjoys the pure and simple moments of life.

I've also slowly started a real estate and packaging consulting business for my long term career goals to work for myself. For fun, I spend as much time as I can being a Dad and raising my daughter. When I take a break from that (every other weekend), I'll get out with some like minded friends for fun in the city or a weekend getaway trip.
I like to travel, eat healthy and have long walks by the lakefront, I have a busy schedule. I like to welcome all!

I am an artist in textile, costume, theater and fashion. I do much of my work at home;  in my studio.
 I spend as much time out on the porch as possible, doing writing and some stitching, tending flowers and a veggie garden out in the surrounding yards. I have my own little happy zone right here in the middle of a major metropolitan city, including friendly neighbors.
My little rat terrier Mayzee is my constant companion. 
Things I like to do...  Indie Films usually turn out to be my faves.  I go to some live theater, as well as help make it here in town. Books, got to have books always. And Bike Riding!.  I probably would love yoga if I would think to do it more Ha! 
Veggie food for me, sometimes I like to cook. Former foodie, did my time in the restaurant biz. 
If you would stay over here with me, you are welcome to make yourself at home.  Have your privacy or hang out, I leave it to you. My dog may like to have a cuddle, if you are up for that. You might want to hang by the electric fireplace heh, very mod, and toasty. I have lots of books to peruse for such an evening.
I know in traveling I look for the food of the people! I can tell you my spots or help you find what you might be looking for. Or bring take out, eat in the living room, or back porch if you like al fresco. 
But maybe you just want to  crash someplace tidy and less sterile than a hotel, that's cool. The building is old, maybe a hundred years? but it has all new plumbing and such, so I feel it is the best of both worlds. 
I don't know that I have a life motto, but I firmly believe in doing what makes me happy!
I look forward to meeting interesting people on their travels; feeds the brain!

I am a writer and editor, currently Senior Editor at Pipeline Magazine, a trade publication that focuses on international telecommunications business ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) I'm also a professional musician. ( (Website hidden by Airbnb)  I live in Chicago, IL, but currently, I'm staying in Hawaii for work and pleasure.  I love to travel and experience and learn about new cultures. I'm 36 yrs. old.

I am a lifelong traveler, whom, over the past year has become a seasoned AirBnB host. I live for seeing new places, experiencing new things, and meeting new people. The golden rule is my guiding principle and I appreciate this quality in others. 

I often travel for work, but I do sometimes work from home. When I'm not working, I'm out on the bike, running on the new 606 trail, or having a few drinks with friends. 

My Travel Resume:
Objective: See as much of this world as I can before I shuffle off this mortal coil
US States Visited: 44
Countries Visited: 24
Favorite Travel Destinations: Peru, Brazil, Spain, Germany, Alaska
What's next: Probably Northern Ireland (where my fiance Rebecca is from), but Iceland and Sri Lanka are on the short list.
A city family that loves the outdoors

I'm a native Midwesterner, have a love for the global diversity of the big city, and a serious case of wanderlust! A Chicago resident for over 10 years, I love my city, but jump at the chance to hop on a plane to go to a beach, mountain, concert, Broadway show, or any other exciting destination.  Airbnb enables me to stay in awesome locales, and host folks from all over the planet.

I am a lawyer who is currently staying at home with my three-month baby.  My husband and I love to travel - we spent six months travelling Europe and could not have done it without AirBnb!  On the host side, our partner, Jeremy, and I run the vacation rentals in Chicago.  Jeremy is a "recovering" lawyer and now devotes his time to real estate.

I am a graduate student in Chicago, IL, USA. I traveled in Brazil and Argentina in order to do research for my dissertation in history, and experienced the warm welcome and hospitality of many Airbnb hosts in those countries. I speak fluent Portuguese, Spanish, and am a native English speaker, experienced traveler and love getting to know new cultures, places, and most of all, people! Now back stateside and enjoying hosting. Please consider my place if you find yourself in this wonderful city! 

No smoking as either guest or host!

My wife and I absolutely love to travel, we go anywhere we can.  One of our favorite parts about traveling is making life long friendships with people from around the world.  To this day we have friends, in Fiji, London, Ireland, India, Belgium, Costa Rica, and so many more.  Now we have two babies, and makes it a little more difficult to get out and travel as much as we want to.  So we thought to ourselves, let's bring the world to us.  Let us meet fantastic people, and share the stories of what their part of the world has to offer.  We love adventure, discovering new things, The Chicago Cubs, Chicago Foods, music, dancing, Improv Comedy and we love a good happy hour.  I like to think of us as the ultimate Chicago host, because we know all the little secrets this city has to offer. 
My life motto: To Dream as if you'll live forever, but live as if you'll die today. - James Dean

Once or twice a year I like to get out and see the world.  Sometimes I go to one country for a week, other times I spend 2-3 weeks traveling through different countries. I love to explore new places and take in the food, architecture, hot spots, and sights.  The one item that always comes with me wherever I travel are my running sneakers. I've done 6 marathons and plan to do more.  

I am a considerate guest and will leave any room or apartment the way I found it.  I tend to travel light so that it's easy to move from place to place. I like to enjoy a city for a few days before going some place else. 

Je parle francais aussi.  Je ne parle pas francais tout les jours, mais je peux tenir une conversation decent. Petit a petit mon francais est amelioration.
Hello! I am a recent college graduate. I enjoy all types of music and learning new things. I love to travel which is why my apartment is often available to stay at.

Newly graduated learning psychology PhD student now working as statistician / test developer downtown.  

I've lived in this area for 6 years, so I know all about the nearby restaurants, shops, sites to see, and the ways to get there. I love Chicago and hope to let you experience my favorite city :)

My place is an old vintage building in the heart of Andersonville which is the Swedish neighborhood of Chicago and so you will find old hardware and black and white checkered flooring! I love offering guests the bests within walking distance as well as top Chicago picks. I also have a tea and coffee station with seasonal treats!

My work as local real estate professional gives me in depth knowledge of the city so you can ask me anything about Chicago! In my free time I enjoy exploring the outdoors(year round), exercise includes running & yoga, love eating all types of creatively styled food, drinking good wine and beer, perusing art of all kinds. I was trained as a designer so I have a special love for design and architecture as well. I love sharing my home and knowledge about this wonderful city and helping to make a stay in Chicago a memorable experience. There is SO much to do, see and explore here---just ask me! Cheers to adventure!
I'm a city girl who loves to travel far and wide, internationally and across the US.

We are newlyweds taking on a new adventure. We're new to the Airbnb community and are excited to share our spacious, stylish, functional home to make life a little easier for those traveling away from home. Our home is your home.

A passionate traveler, I have visited more than 50 countries and love connecting with people from around the world.  Back home in Chicago, I am a professional woman with a Leadership Coaching and Executive Search Consulting practice.  I love the arts, spend time with family and friends, and live in a fabulous urban neighborhood full of restaurants, bars and theaters and Wrigley Field – Home of the Chicago Cubs.  Come visit our fine city!

My husband and I are life long Chicagoans. We like to travel and in the summers we enjoy boating on Chicago's lake front. We love the energy and rhythm of the city and delight in spending time with family and close friends.
Lifelong Cubs fan, this is our century!!!
I am a marketing Professional.
I am born and raised in Chicago and have a good knowledge of this place i can share! I work nights so i will be away in the evenings. Anything i can do to help you have a great stay let me know!

I have lived my entire adult life in Chicago.  Though I have travelled to many places, Chicago remains my favorite city and I look forward to sharing my city with my guests.  I live upstairs in the second floor apartment so I will be around and available as needed.

Hello! I am a traveling musician. I have stayed in hotels and slept on floors. 
I know what I would like in a place to stay and I hope to provide that.

I began my career in Rome Italy where he studied cosmetology  I immigrated to the United States 1995 .I  opened my first  Chicago salon and spa in Roscoe Village Chicago . as businessman In 2009, I decided to created my own extensions line created Tony Odisho Extensions and beauty company. I speak Italian, Spanish ,Arabic, Aramaic and English.
I'm an artist.

I moved to Chicago to be in a place full of life, art, culture, and history. This is a place where anything can be happening at any time of year and I love being a part of it!
I'm a huge fan of music, especially classic rock and vocal music. I'm a singer, so I love to listen to music that I can recreate myself. If you love making/experiencing music, I think we'll get along fine.
Theater and acting is my main passion, and I enjoy watching it as much as doing it. Thank the Lord for Netflix! But nothing compares to watching live theater, and Chicago has some of the best.

If you like your privacy, I can fully appreciate that, but just say the word and I can also be good company. There may even be breakfast/a cold drink involved. Your choice, I'm happy to provide.
I am a retired CPA (Accountant in U.S.) I am finally free during any time of the year to travel and see the world.  New experiences and new friends are always exciting to meet.

I'm a former academic, current maker of drinks, living in Chicago with my girlfriend, Anjulie (also pictured), a magazine editor. We're both into cooking, eating, taking trips, and spending time with friends. We will have a dog, someday.

Friendly Chicago-loving couple happy to host you!

We've lived in Chicago for over a decade, and are very excited to share our city with you. Whether you need a recommendation for a great restaurant or a great museum, we're happy to give you advice from our conveniently located, comfortable home.

My wife and I live in Portage Park neighborhood of Chicago with our two teenagers, our newborn and our dog, Roscoe.   We try to keep moving (running, biking, traveling) and love to take in interesting films and the Chicago live theatre scene.
I am a dog lover, sports buff and work-a-holic.....

I like traveling and hosting, and sharing Chicago's best! Chicago is an amazing city, and I take pride in living and working here. 

Wherever I go, I try to explore the unique culture of my surroundings, and prefer a more authentic local scene to tourist-oriented travel. I work hard to be a super-respectful guest when I travel, and I know I can expect the same from those that I host here in Chicago.

I am an ex graphic designer, working in experiential marketing here in Chicago. I love travel, culture, architecture, interior design, visual stimuli, music and animals! I thrive on discussing good ideas and being surrounded by those that care about the world and all living things that inhabit it. I take coffee seriously and find it hard to go a day without good coffee. I recycle and do what I can to take care of the earth. I enjoy fine craft cocktails and food that nourishes the body. I welcome travelers from all over the globe to spend some time exploring all the great things that this city has to offer!

I am a retired high school English teacher and a landlord.  I love old buildings, architecture and antiques.  I think Chicago is absolutely amazing, but love the country too.  As a host, I want you to relax and enjoy this unique property.  It is a place meant to be shared.  I enjoy people.

My friends and family always say I am the 'Hostess w/ the Mostess.' Growing up in a large family with 4 siblings, I am used to having people around and love it. Which is one of the reasons I joined Airbnb. I love meeting new people and making their acquaintance. As a guest of mine, you will definitely feel secure and safe in my home. I am pretty laid back and love to engage people.

A few facts about myself:
 - Love to cook
 - Very into fashion
 - I am a wine and whiskey gal, bourbon to be exact. I am more of a red wine drinker, but I recently just discovered a love for New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and can't get enough. It has been my summer wine along with Prosecco, which never lets me down.
 - Because I am a foodie, I love having dinner parties and cooking for my friends and family. I also love trying out new restaurants and bars.
 - I am the kind of person that will try almost anything once, so bring on the new and challenging experiences.
 - I love to binge watch shows and movies on most streaming devices. A few of my favorite shows are Game of Thrones, House of Cards, Scandal, How to Get Away with Murder, etc... The list can go on and on. Also LOVE Korean dramas, especially the period pieces.
 - I am a lover of Art and History (I get the history part from my Dad)

I believe travel is the best form of education, there is nothing like immersing oneself in a new culture. You learn a lot about yourself and others when you do this and get to experience so many amazing things and people. The more I travel the more I learn that we are all the same on this planet and I realize that there is nothing I have gone thru that someone else hasn't. I always find myself in awe of the world that I live in and fall in love with it once again.

Anyway, I cannot wait to be your hostess or possibly your guest in the future. And I am excited to build new relationships that I hope will last a lifetime :)

I am a member of the American Institute of Architects, a real estate broker, and an importer and distributor of French wines and spirits.  I manage several rental properties, one of which is now an AirBnB.  I am a private collector of rare Armagnac and Cognac in Chicago.  I live across the street from this AirBnB.  We go to Ireland every chance we get, as we are both duel citizens; born here with Foreign Citizenship there. I have been an AirBnB host for 3 years.    My wife is a paramedic with a Chicago private ambulance company.  My wife and I love Netflix and the old time movies.

I'm a designer for a college study abroad program and my husband, Brian, is a dog walker. We've lived in Chicago for over 10 years and love our city. Chicago is such a diverse place, each neighborhood holds a different style all it's own and we really like finding all the hidden gems the city has to offer. We both like to travel but of course don't do it enough! 

We're fairly laid back and enjoy doing anything outdoors. We have a sweet dog and a few backyard chickens all of whom are friendly.
ive lived in chicago for 17 years. went to college in toledo, ohio. Very laid back and flexible.
Working professional, first time home buyer. Love my home and take great care of it, I hope you will love it and take good care of it too!

Hello, Welcome to Airbnb. I am excited to be a host on Airbnb because I love to provide people with a comfortable place to stay. I love hosting and getting to know more people, I will provide with the most excellent hospitality standard. I will guarantee your satisfaction in Chicago.

Hello! I'm Christina!
I rent this modern, 2 bedroom, Condo on behalf of the restaurant that I manage right below. Oyster Bah is an East Coast inspired seafood restaurant. You'll have to come join us! 

I also AirB my own home on the weekends; I love hosting guests visiting Chicago from across the Country (and overseas!) to explore this amazing city. Nothing beats the beautiful Chicago lakefront, all the great shopping and of course, the restaurants!

The first thing I look forward to when I travel to a new town is dropping my bags, embracing the space and exploring a new town. I like guests to feel at ease and comfortable. The place you stay can make or break your traveling experience, and I understand that.

My name is JP, and I'm an active person. I play the piano and accordion in my band, run with my dog, ride bicycles with my family, ride motorcycles with my friends, and love to cook. I read a lot, do crossword puzzles as often as possible, and love to learn new languages.

My favorite question to ask people is, "What do you do for fun?". I don't care about your job or career, unless that's your fun. Otherwise, let's have a conversation and get to know each other!
Lover of animals and all things wild and free.

I am a laid back person who likes to travel, enjoys music, comedy, sports, cooking/dining out and meeting new people. I have been fortunate to travel quite extensively and have been able to stay in many terrific Airbnb properties, many in different countries.

I am a bit of a clean freak, so you will note that my listings are clean and I pay attention to details. I have listed all possible details you need to know fr transportation to sleeping arrangements. I keep instant book on so once you have read the listing you can tell if my listing works for you or not.
Go Cubs Go!
I am an Interior Designer with my own business living in Chicago with my husband Tim and my dog Izzy. I love the energy of the city and the uniqueness of each neighborhood.
Hello! My name is Catherine. I'm a full time musician born/raised and currently living in Chicago, IL. I love to travel, watch movies, go hiking, bike, food and of course MUSIC!
A great deal of love goes into my home and I thoroughly enjoy being able to share my space.

Hi there and welcome to my Chicago home. We (myself and my co-hosts) look forward to providing you the best customer service possible.

Larry has been making tenants and visitors happy in Chicago for 39 years, during which time his daytime career was in business and social service. Ti Juan has a master's degree in psychology and works in social service. He enjoys super-hero conventions and in his spare time works on the comic book he is writing.

Hello ,

Business Manager located in Chicago. I happily host those traveling to my city for work/relocation, occasionally book travel for my clients, and if I'm lucky enough to find the free time, do a little traveling myself. 

Amateur chef, iced tea addict, action movie buff, penchant for doodling.

Hey there! I'm a pretty busy appointment based interior designer and salesperson. I'm in and out of the house a lot during the day. I am a very friendly person who likes to welcome people into my home so that they can be very comfortable.  I have one daughter who is away in college. Currently, I am in graduate school pursuing a masters degree in special education.  I enjoy teaching kids with special needs. One half of a gay married couple who have been together 29 years.

We're active: Bike, swim, run, yoga. 
I'm a marketer. 
My husband is a professor.
Looking forward to a fun adventure.

Hello. I am an experienced property owner. Also I'm an artist, and you'll see some of my art around the space. I love travelling and immersing myself in different cultures and ecosystems, though for the last several years I've been more stably here in Chicago. My travel style has gradual shifted to become moe sustainable, practical, and grounded; I have some great stories of travel, some that was quite by-the-seat-of-my-pants. I'm usually reading a few books at a time. I'm more of a daytime person. I cook most of the meals I eat. I'm a huge music appreciator and also love singing. a wanderer at heart....

Chicagoan born & raised that works in IT. Enjoy travel when I can. Love the local feeling you can get for a travel destination with Airbnb hosts.

We are family living in Lakeview - there are four of us including our 70 lb canine.  We love the city, the culture, the music, the theater, the architecture, the food and all the goings on in this city.  We pride ourselves on trying to drink up every opportunity to enjoy the city.  We love to share our knowledge.  We love to cook and bake.  We all partake in activities at the Old Town School of Folk Music.  We are active in the community.  We love to travel - we have driven the lower 48 states and most of the lower provinces.  We love to share our knowledge about our city, our neighborhood.  Come on and stay with us. Wanna be world traveler and writer, while currently management consultant and non profit director.
My goal is to hit all 50 states and all 7 continents before I die and I am behind by 30 states and 5 continents! I love meeting new people, I am easy going. I am kind of conservative in that I do not drink or smoke or 420 but I enjoy fun and conversations and trying new things.
I love music, photography, dogs, veggie burgers, reading, and trees.  My boyfriend and I love to travel and are also out of town for shows a lot, so while we're gone, mi casa es su casa!

I'm a curious, life-long learner who values a healthy life-style and environment.  As a younger man, I taught English in Colombia where I learned Spanish and met my spouse of 30+ years. I'm a Chicago native now raising my own family in Wicker Park.

Hi there.

Culture seeker

I have lived in Chicago for 8+ years now, so if you have any questions or are looking for suggestions around the area, please don't hesitate to ask!

Young wild and free... I've been running my own design build studio for the past nine years in Chicago which focuses on primarliy restaurant and bar design. I love people and always up for meeting new friends. Im a Husband and Dad of two. Real Estate has been my trade for Thirty years. After purchasing several Rental Buildings I decided to convert an apartment to an AirBnB. My Flat is Professionally Designed, Renovated and  Managed. I look forward to your visit.

Hi! We are Brad and Elizabeth. We live on the Northside of Chicago with our pup Macchiato and newly born son (2018) in the Logan Square neighborhood. We spent some time in Italy a few years back and are still working learning the language. We are artists; Brad is a muscian/actor and Elizabeth is a photographer and  art teacher. We are pretty laid-back, love to hangout and ride our bikes around the city and play around with our pup.

Hello Airbnb-ers,

Irv & I have lived in our beautiful landmark home in Chicago since 2003. We run Fresh Picks, a local organic farm-to-table delivery business. I'm pretty easy going and really love life. Traveling is my hobby, so I'd love to hear about your trips!

Personal Trainer who likes to cook, and take in local theater. I can't live without camping, friends, dinner parties, weight lifting and biking. 

We are a fun bunch. We both work but enjoy hosting and giving suggestions for dining and entertainment.

Travel enthusiast who has called Chicago home for 12 years but love to experience new places as often as possible. 

On a mission to visit all 50 U.S. States (currently at 48) and U.S. territories (currently at one) while simultaneously expanding my travels worldwide. 

Midwestern girl born/raised who loves the big-city vibes of one of the greatest cities in the country (Chicago) that boasts a low-key, Midwestern foundation... and a lot of tremendous dining options!

I am a thirty-four year old, single gay male.  I try to live an active lifestyle and spend my time socializing, travelling, at the gym and at work.  A former Floridian, I have been living in Chicago for seven years!  I love this city, I love this neighborhood, and I love my home.  I work in the travel industry, and am often out of town.  There's a piano in the home, and I love to play!
I like to play tennis, run and eat spaghetti. I frequently use AirB&B as a guest, but just started using it as a host. Looking forward to it!

Cosmopolitan, positive, respectful and friendly.  I love to explore on foot and probably will not be in the room much...  yet, I enjoy a clean place.  I am neat and will leave your place in great condition.

Hello, my name is Kay! I've been in the service/hospitality industry for almost 20 years, and love every day of it. It would be my pleasure to be your hostess! I am a Superhost with Airbnb, and I dedicate myself to making your stay wonderful. I decided to become an Airbnb hostess because I feel Chicago is such a beautiful city, but it's shame that hotels are so expensive. Since lodging is the weight of most trips' cost, this is a wonderful way to help each other. I am a Chicago native, born and raised, and know the city very well.

The atmosphere of my home is peaceful, pleasant, and fun.  I enjoy music, film, sight-seeing, dining, travel, photography, yoga, and nature. I also love to cook, and will provide fresh fruit, coffee/tea, yogurt, and muffin for your stay. You are more than welcome to bring and store your own food for extended stay. 

A sweet cat lives in unit--16 yrs young! He's very friendly , but if you're allergic to pets, please be aware. I DO NOT allow other pets to join you, I apologize in advance. I also do not allow other guests without prior approval. The Landlord has a strict policy. 

I have some ground rules for my BnB home: BE courteous, BE friendly, BE honest, BE open. If you have ANY questions or concerns, feel free to ask any time. I am a very reasonable, down-to-earth person. I'm here to help you have a wonderful trip! 

I also have a NO DRUGS,  NO SMOKING policy, as my Landlord is a police officer, and is on premises.  The check-in times are case-by-case basis--I have somewhat normal hours and am home in the evenings. The checkout time is 10am. Please message me with any questions. 

I would love to make your stay in Chicago a great one!

I am professional in the Women's health field. I have both an undergrad and  graduate degree from the College of Nursing at UIC.  I work in a local Healthcare Center.
I am fluent in Spanish. Chicago Native. 
I enjoy Bikram yoga, jogging, photography, traveling, art walks, and I am a complete MUSIC NERD, listening to records, love live music, will travel long distance even out of country for a show or favorite musician..... 

Before the airbnb era, I often house swapped, couch surfed, traded room& board for a service, used other popular websites to find room rentals, etc! 

Favorite quote “What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?”
― Vincent van Gogh

My partner is paraprofessional in the library science field. He works in a near suburban public library. He is fluent in Spanish. He is also a professional musician, plays guitar and bass. Chicago Native
He enjoys reading, writing, biking,jogging, cooking, traveling and yes he is also a music nerd.

We both have traveled extensively, having been to several countries outside of North America, we most often prefer the comfort of a home when away, rather than a posh hotel. For both economical and sustainable reasons, most of these travels have been on a budget, in which we prefer to defer the big tourist hot spots, and spend our money in local communities.  Live like a local is our travel motto!!

So far we have hosted a very diverse array of guests: medical & nursing students, people here for internships, work projects, railroad engineers, vacationers, last minute get-away trips, road trip pit stops, stranded at the airport, music festival junkies, the list goes on, feel free to add yourself to the list!!  Our longest airbnb reservation was for an international graduate student  who stayed 8 months as she awaited her work visa to be approved,  while working as an accountant at a manufacturing company a few miles away from our home. Our shortest airbnb reservations are one nighters who sometimes just want a few hours of sleep or rest while stranded or waiting on a flight from midway airport, but even ohare airport has provided us some lovely guest as well!

My wife and I are Spanish Teachers for preschool aged children in Chicago. I enjoy spending time with my family, relaxing or working on the house. I am always looking for things to improve or fix around the house and love working on my Bonsai trees.  You might find me and kids in the backyard cutting wood for a project or working on Bonsai trees all while listening to movie scores on Pandora and sipping on some wine.  
We also enjoy grilling in the summer, so dont be surprised if you are invited to BBQ if you are staying at our place, I typically grill some mexican skirt steak for tacos and I make awesome guacamole and salsas.

Golden day super pleased to host you!
      I love creating and sharing beautiful "homes" in all areas that I frequent.  My Chicago home looks like a vintage urban Castle on the outside.  The 1880 rich brick structure is covered in green ivy with birds chirping on its face by day.  Dramatic exterior lighting, gives the home a warm sophisticated glow, in the evening. The spring planting has begun in the garden. I love flowers! 
      I have a motto, HappyHealthyHumans.  Living a raw vegan lifestyle attains my goal of being energized and sharp.  I have provided some of my favorites in this Airbnb, such as Green Mattresses made our of bamboo an natural cotton, alkaline ph balanced water in the shower, all natural cleaning and personal products, a juicer, blender and awesome coffee maker.  ( Stanleys Fruit and Vegetable  Market close by)  I believe using natural products allows the immune system time to work on regeneration instead of detoxification. 
    I also work as a Medical Intuitive with InteriorWerx, providing people (animals) with a frequency release to regain and fine tune health and success goals.
 My clients and I find it super rewarding! 
   With lectures and private clients in LaJolla, SanDiego, Temecula, Scottsdale, LasVegas and Chicago, I spend time is some of my other beautiful homes 
as well.  
    I love fine style, design, interiors, health,chocolates, nutrition, athletics, automobiles, horses, planes, children, gardens, consciousness and experiences.  
    Much love and appreciation for choosing my home for your Chicago visits.
Fantastic Times!
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) Susan

Originally from Michigan, spent 14 years living in NYC, NY. Bought and sold my apartment there a few years ago to move to Chicago. Executive Assistant and Office Manager now. Former Actress & Singer. Love wine, travel, museums, golf, running, kettlebell training, music, theatre, reading, animals, my family and friends.
I'm funny, honest, clean, responsible. Extremely loyal. Enjoy volunteering. Go Blue!

When Im not spending time in the city working as a classic model with Ford Chicago, you can find me on our farm in the country where I raise honeybees and grow Lavender for my handcrafted skin care products. I love having the best of both worlds and am so happy to share our space with travelers!!!

Things that I can't live without: My reading glasses, a strong cup of coffee, being woken up by the sound of birds singing, the smell of lavender,  garden tomatoes, being barefoot in the grass and snuggling my son.
 
Favorite book: Cabin Porn
Favorite movie: Wasteland
Favorite show: The New Yorker
Favorite food: Anything fresh from our garden....and...well... french fries :)
Favorite lyrics: "Im an alligator. Im a mama papa coming for you"-David Bowie

Originally from the east coast (Baltimore), I spent many years on the west coast (San Francisco), and I now live on the third coast (Chicago) with my lovely wife. I'm an English professor and my wife is an architect. We travel a lot both for work and fun.

Originally from the California Sierra Nevadas, I remember what it was like to be new to Chicago. When I arrived about eleven years ago, lost — so many friendly people helped me find my way around until I learned to be at home in the city. Now recently retired,  it's my turn to be the helper for newcomers here on a visit.  Usually busy in my home — a popular stopover with both friends and grandkids, I am known for incessant baking, and being perpetually prepared to share a hot pot of coffee with whomever stops by.

I am offering you the peace I enjoy and a comfortable, private stay here without interference. If you should need anything, however, do not hesitate to message me. Most likely I'm upstairs and available to answer any questions or concerns—or even just to chat! I want you to have a relaxed experience here, conveniently comfortable and at home away from home.

I am a 28 year old single guy. I have many "jobs" a lot of them allow me to have a lot of free time. I work part time in a bakery. I have recently needed a little more extra income to afford this beautiful space I am living in. So I decided to try out Airbnb.

I am a marathon runner and I love dogs! I don't spend a lot of time indoors in the summer as Chicago has a wonderful lakefront and a nice big dog beach. I do spend any free time I have during the summer sitting on my deck with friends or by my self reading. My favorite destinations are France, Germany and New Zealand (great sauvignon blanc).

Jessica is a professional Dancer and Choreographer and I am Lighting Designer from Chicago. We are both extremely well traveled and have used AirBNB as guests in multiple countries across several continents.
We are super excited to now be hosts and share our city and neighborhood.

My wife and I are fairly avid travelers. Since we live in Chicago, a lot of our trips are to warmer climates. Some of my favorite places to visit are New Orleans, Phoenix, Puerto Rico, Jamaica, Kenya, Vietnam, Colombia, Sweden, and Toronto (not warm, but we love that city). My favorite trips have been to Kenya and Colombia. My dream trip would be to any country that I have not visited  yet.

5 things that i can't live without: my family (my wife, daughter and son are my travel companions), my cellphone, music, traveling, public transportation.

We very seldom stay in hotels. Due to the fact that we normally vacation for a least a week at a time, we tend to rent vacation homes/condos. We like the flexibility of being able to cook some meals ourselves in order to save money and we prefer to stay in regular neighborhoods instead of being surrounded by tourists in hotels.

There's a big world out there.....see it!

We recently purchased our Duplex Down in 2014. I have an 19 yr old son who is a Freshman away in college and a 14 yr old Shih Tzu, Buddy. We are rarely home all at the same time since our schedules very. We are non smokers and I am an occasional drinker who enjoy hosting for our friends and family when we can.

Hey Guys,

Hannah and I are excited to join the AirBnB community. We spend the majority of our free time figuring out our next trip. We love to travel and hope that we can meet some cool people and host some of those cool people so that we can help fund our next adventure. 

Our interests are as varied as can be- we are just as happy sitting at home drinking tea and watching a Friends marathon as we are taking our motorcycles for a ride or disappearing to go camping for several days. 

As hosts we guarantee that you will enjoy your stay with us, and as guests we promise to leave your space in the beautiful condition that we found it in.

I love Chicago!! I am a restaurant manager downtown so my schedule is all over the place. There are so many things to always go and see. My favorites are the food/drink scene. I love to go out and try new places and I definitely frequent my favorites. I also love to go to different music shows around the city and the beach in the summer is a must. I am a runner that is always exploring new trails which lets me see the city from many different ways. I love to give suggestions to newbies about the city and I know a ton of people that can help out if I don't have an answer to your questions!!

I moved to Chicago in 2004 for college, and it has been my home ever since. Since then, I've experienced Chicago as a college student, a single person, a married person, and a mom.  I have completely fallen for this city in every phase of life. As much as I like the idea of traveling, I find that when we have vacation time, all I want to do is explore my city more.

Delicious food is plentiful, and I find the culture to be much more welcoming than most big cities. The city is big enough that there's always something new to experience, but the unique personality of the neighborhoods can still give it a small town feel.

The appeal of Airbnb for me is the thriftiness of it, but honestly, when I travel I appreciate more privacy. That's why I feel like our apartment was built to host guests because it provides you personal access to your room so you can feel like your on vacation and not meeting a new roommate for the first time. However, as I've said, I (and my whole family) love this city, so if you do have questions, just ask!

We're Jeff and Lisa, Chicago residents for 20+ years, and we hope you will come stay at our Airbnb! Though originally from Oregon and Indiana, we absolutely love Chicago and everything it offers. We're more than happy to recommend our favorite local bars and restaurants and help you explore the great Lakeview neighborhood and all of Chicago. 

Hope to see you soon!

We are a newlywed couple who recently bought a new construction home here in charming Logan Square. Mark and Emily both work downtown most days and from home time to time.

Mark is a Chicago native and Emily has lived in the city for 10 years. 

No matter what your interests are: sports, restaurants, live entertainment, or just general tourism in the city, we can help give you recommendations and explore transportation options with you too.

We both love to travel and have been to five continents and to over 25 countries, and to 30 States. So, we have a strong appreciation for great hospitality!

My husband Ken and I have been residents of Old Irving Park in Chicago for 25 years. We raised our children in this neighborhood and love the peaceful family environment in a park like setting.  Ken is  a born and raised Chicagoan and I am a transplant from a farm in southern IL.

We love to take advantage of all the fun things to do in our city. Museums, shows, tours, especially the Segway Tour with Bike and Roll Chicago, and last but not least the amazing variety of food and restaurants.  If you like pizza you must come to Chicago and sample the best varieties America has to offer.
There are so many great things to do in Chicago, we rarely travel, someone is always home.  You won't be bored in Chicago. 

5 things I can't live without: Things are things. Life goes on but family, friends and great neighbors are important.  I love to read, we try to go to the movies as a family every week when our schedule permits. 

Chicago is the best place for food with a vast variety of authentic multi-cultural cuisines including pizza.  We know all the best places for the most delicious pizza.  

We have had guests in our home so often one of our friends suggested Airbnb as a way to help make ends meet while working our way through school.  All four of us are college students that have graduated with our Bachelor's and are currently looking for great jobs. My husband and I returned to college after our children were enrolled. Our son Quinn graduated from U of C and is looking at Medical Schools now.  Our daughter Savannah is a recent graduate from Columbia College in Chicago and plans to be a Cinematographer.

We are hospitable hosts and willing to provide tips on how to navigate our fantastic city.  

Ken grew up in the city and is retired from CTA so he knows a lot about getting around.  We know plenty  of great spots for entertainment, food, music and nightlife.   

Airbnb has proven a wonderful way to connect with people of the world. We have developed relationships with many who have stayed with us.  It has been a great way for us home bodies to make meaningful new friendships.

I build musical instruments, fix various broken things and am always trying to learn something new. Come and learn with me. Meeting new people is an adventure and I live to adventure. I have studied music in India and Musical Instrument Craft in Delhi as well as Japan.  Come see what I am working on or bring a broken guitar and we can fix.

Hey,
My name is Thomas and i've been living in Chicago since 2014. I used to be french (born and raised - Paris), but i decided that i needed some change! So i packed my stuff and decided to go see my Uncle Sam, and so far so good!! :D
For the serious part, i worked in finance and i'm now trying to learn how to program... But let's face it, computers hate me!
Other than that, i'm the most normal extraordinary person on earth!!!
(True story.... well, maybe not...)

Hi! We are a friendly family of five. We love Roscoe Village- it's a special neighborhood and a hidden gem on the northside of Chicago. The guest quarters are in the coach house next door to our home, so we use it for our own inlaws and friends as well. We have thought of everything we can to make sure our guests are comfortable. We will be delighted to meet you!

After growing up on the east coast and traveling to over 30 countries, I now call Chicago home.  The Logan Square neighborhood has great energy and various options for entertainment including superb bars and restaurants within a short walk.  We are always more than happy to recommend some of our favorite local places to explore.

My wife and I live here with our dog, Avo.  We both enjoy hosting company, and after recently getting married and furnishing our new apartment we are looking forward to sharing our space with guests.

Hi there!  I'm a proud, very experienced Airbnb "Superhost" who has hosted over 100 times!  I've also never canceled a reservation!  

I'm a down-to-Earth girl who goes above and beyond to make sure my guests feel at home during their stay in my flat.

Bruce has been a Chicagoland resident his whole life and has been a staple in the Chicago music, art and culinary scene for over 20 years. He is currently involved with bands such as Yakuza, Bloodiest, Led Zeppelin 2, Corrections House, and his solo works. He has been a longtime bartender and manager at the Empty Bottle, Thalia Hall, Goose Island Brewing Co. He has travelled all over the world and hopes to continue to find new place and meet new people. His life motto is: DO IT!
Chicago natives, that enjoy entertaining people and making people feel at home.
I am a recent graduate of DePaul University and a Chicago native. I love music, art, nature, and traveling. I am so proud of my city and love hosting on AirBnB!

Hello,

My name is Miles and I am a young professional living in Old Town, Chicago. I moved here from NYC where I worked for a few years after college in San Diego, but I grew up a midwestern boy in Michigan. I really enjoy traveling, discovering new music, dancing, experiencing new cultures and foods, and overall enriching my life with all the world has to offer.

When traveling, I prefer to take the advice of locals over that of online blogs or tourist books. So I really appreciate all the input I can get from my hosts, and provide all the suggestions and help I can to my guests. 

Let's travel together and explore the world!

I'm originally from Austin, TX and live between there and Chicago now. 

I consider myself a spiritual person that explores naturism, well-being and the concept that we are all mirrors of each other. I love meeting new people and learning about things outside my daily life.

Evenings walking through parks, going to see live theatre or music, a good flick at the cinema, having a nice lie in, and a pot of tea. Always up for a yoga class, a lifting session, and food. Chicago has the best restaurant weeks.

I work as a musician playing the piano, vocal coaching, and conducting in the musical theater industry. I'm a bit of a nerd for anything technology related.

I'm a quiet, clean, non-smoking, trustworthy person friendly, but respectful of others.
I  love to travel to Europe, especially Italy and France because I have a passion for food and wine.
When I travel I like to stay with Airbnb host because make me feel like home.

Hi, I'm a single professional in Chicago who enjoys pets, people, and good conversation. I'm clean, organized, a non-smoker, and get along with generally everyone. I've been living with roommates since I was in high school, so I'm used to sharing my space. In my free time, I enjoy hanging out with friends over wine, reading, playing tennis, biking, and oil painting. 

Throughout my AirBnB experience, I've met many wonderful people who have been so kind as to offer their home to me throughout the world. I hope to do the same, so please feel free to contact me with any questions!

If I am not on vacation I love DIY projects, Pinot Noir and eating out with my friends. I'm not much of a homebody, but when I am at home, I'm usually catching up on my netflix shows

While on vacation, I love to be adventurous when I'm on vacation. Some rest and relaxation mixed with the best cocktails my destination has to offer. Love to go on vacation and live like a local. Eat at the local restaurant and go off the beaten path.

I'm a college professor of communication.  I love comedy and the arts in general and am a performer of a cappella music, the ukelele, comedy and acting.  Born in Detroit I am a Detroit sports fan in general even though some Chicago teams have worked their way into my heart.  My favorite travel place was Prague... gosh that was beautiful.  BUT Michigan is pretty beautiful too and I have family there.  My favorite book is How to Win Friends and Influence People, I like Rom Coms like "Love Actually" as well as films with plots.  Ben Folds is my favorite musician at the moment although I really do like Taylor Swift too ;).  And for food... I love Thai!

Having me as a host, you will find I am hospitable and knowledgeable about the area.  I know of some fun things folks like to do when in town and a lot of off the beaten path activities that us locals love.  I generally get a feel for my guests and if they are more quiet I have the complete ability to be the same.
And as far as a life motto is concerned- Lets go with "Whether you think you can't or you think you can, you're right".  Love that one :)

I am a traveler, a lover of animals & books, I practice yoga, I love a great meal and am always seeking a delicious cup of coffee.  I work as a prop and wardrobe stylist on tv, commercials and print ads.  I work hard and take great advantage of the breaks between projects to travel.  I love everything about travel - the discovery of something beautiful I've never seen before, something amazing I've never eaten before, someone wonderful I've never met before.  

I always seek the most cozy place I can find when traveling and hope to recreate that experience for you in my rental.  I will leave you to your adventure, but am happy to guide you in any way I can if you are looking for suggestions.

Please have a completed profile if you are interested in a stay here!
Traveling aficionado of Mexican spirits
I'm a cartoonist and Illustrator from Chicago, IL.
Busy mom who enjoys decorating, cooking, travelling and having fun with my daughter.

I have called Chicago my home for 6 years. I travel a lot for both work and pleasure, which makes me a great host. I am an artist and collector of all things cute…hence all the nick knacks personalizing my space. I would call my decorating style "vintage eclectic". My place is always clean but I am in no way a neat freak. I love offer local Chicago suggestions. So feel free to contact me if you have further questions about my listing or Chicago!

I love to read and watch Science-Fiction (5th Element is my favorite movie!) And being a Chicago native, my favorite food is a piping hot piece of deep-dish, butter-crust Lou Malnati's pizza with plenty of parmesan cheese on top!

I love my two kittens, Kane and Toews, and my job as a District Partnerships Coordinator for ThinkCERCA. When I'm not at work, I'm usually playing volleyball, running, or playing board games with friends. I also enjoy watching movies on Netflix and practicing my Spanish!

I am a young entrepreneur living in Chicago. I enjoy traveling, investing, and reading. 

Favorite show: Game of Thrones
Favorite food: Sushi
Favorite book: The Fountainhead

I really like to stay in Airbnb's when I travel. You are more immersed in a city's locals. You get a good idea of what it would be like to live there and meet some interesting people.
University professor, mother of two sons (born 2004 and 2006).
We love the art, parks and outdoors; biking, water sports/yachting on Lake Michigan, and all kinds of activities. We also enjoy the Blues/Jazz music , dinning and night life in downtown .
interior designer, love art  and love to travel on my days off!
We are a loving couple with a cozy home. Happy to host respectful and responsible travelers on their way through Chicago IL.

I am a licensed real estate broker and massage therapist. I am often working from home but tend to come and go. I'll be available for directions, light conversation, and emergencies. 
I love plants, and I'm 420 friendly.

I am a mother of 5 and grandmother of 6 currently living between the woods and hills of Georgia and the hustle and bustle of Chicago.  I like to cook, to paint, to read mystery novels , explore neighborhoods and restaurants, riding my bike and spending my time with family and friends.  
Diversity in life is what drives me and living in Rogers Park has put me in the midst of people from all over the world.   I love to travel and when I do, I prefer to stay off the beaten path; experiencing every day life with local folk.  I'm not a fan of luxury resort/hotel chains  so Airbnb is perfect.  My building is now a century old and takes me back in time with its Chicago vintage charm.

FIVE COMPLETELY RANDOM THINGS ABOUT ME:

1. I once survived a hot air balloon crash.

2. Many years ago I won a contest and had lunch in New York with Michael Stipe.

3. I've been to over 1400 bars and restaurants in Chicago and have eaten everything from shark to horse to pig brain.

4. Some friends and I won "best group costume" at LebowskiFest 2008. (We were told at the time that no one before us had ever dressed up as the TV series "Branded.")

5. I take my karaoke so seriously that I have a mic stand in the trunk of my car at all times.

I love traveling and I enjoy cooking, and Airbnb is just perfect for making it all happen! I also enjoy music, new technology (check out all the tech in the apartment!), trying new restaurants, and spending time outdoors. I used to live in California and in North Carolina, and studied Business and Hospitality Management in college. Happy traveling!

I'm a bartender from Chicago who is well traveled. If you have any interest in the Chicago food and drink scene I am someone you should know. My place is impeccably decorated. 

Being a frequent traveler I understand your needs. I know how important it is to have a very clean comfortable environment after a long day of travel. I've been in the service industry for ten years, I think that makes me a fabulous host

Arkansan living in Chicago building Schlep - a service to take care of your heavy lifting and local logistical needs.

Love traveling, exploring the outdoors and people.

Me, my husband and our 2 cats enjoy meeting and hosting guests from around the world! We are avid downhill skiers, campers and bikers. We love Chicago and all the things it has to offer, and we'll do our best to help you love her too!
I live in Chicago but travel frequently. I am a very quiet and respectful guest. I enjoy decorative arts, antiques and drawing.

I'm an architect that has lived in Chicago since 2007 with my family. We love biking, art, architecture (of course) and Chicago. I was inspired to start hosting after we traveled to Guatemala and had a wonderful experience staying with a family there. We know lots of great places around Chicago and great ways to get around.

My name is Peter and I grew up in Florida but I have been living in Chicago in this same neighborhood for 10 years. I am an interior designer as well as a visual artist in sculpture and illustration. I've enjoyed sharing my home on AirBnB for the last 4 years and also love staying in other homes via AirBnB. If you are interested in booking my home for your trip, please send a quick reservation request and I will get back to you.

I'm a portrait photographer and theatre producer in Chicago. I love big cities, but also treasure beautiful, peaceful places with little stimulation other than their beauty and peace. I have a darling daughter in middle school. Other housemates include a dog, some fish, and 3 chickens. I love open-hearted people, spicy food, live music, plays, strong coffee, and finding out about strangers . 

I'll give you a key and you come and go as you like. I can help with transportation logistics, and places to go. I love chit-chatting a bit, but won't entrap you!
Avid traveler, food lover Chicagoan! Happy to connect with the broader traveler communities.

About me: Chef, farmer, photographer, soapmaker, agitator, rock climber, reader, yogi, biker, homebrewer, beekeeper, butcher, baker, doggie treat maker, betty crocker punk rocker... all disguised as a (mostly) mild-mannered HR professional.   Kind of a nerd, but not a dweeb?  Geeks welcome!  I love to travel, and sharing my home with interesting people from around the globe! 

Favorite quotes (the second one might double as a life-motto): 
"In order to make a pie from scratch, you must first create the universe."     ― Isaac Asimov

“Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.” 
― John Muir
My husband and I love to travel and to host guests.

I like art, design, furniture, and all sorts of beautiful things. My apartment in Chicago is a haven for like-minded travelers, and I'm grateful for all of my amazing guests and their thoughtful reviews. Airbnb has been a wonderful experience for me and I'm constantly striving to be the best host and guest I can be.

I’m a Chicago native but love traveling and experiencing life all over America and the world. I’m a craft coffee drinker, cycling lover, and pastry consumer. I love meeting new people and sharing adventures!
Nice, friendly, and very welcoming!

I'm a laid back, creative type. I work in a few different fields and am always looking for new sources of inspiration. I'm a naturally curious person and genuinely enjoy getting to know new people. I love to travel myself and do so as often as possible so I know how important it is to have a nice home base to anchor yourself.

I love to travel, so I am home very little. Hopefully it stays this way:)
I am originally from Lithuania, but moved to the states in 1998. I usually keep to myself and do my own stuff in the apartment. I don't rely on you for a conversation:) 


Thanks for reading:)

Hello! 
I am a well travelled guy who has been all over the world. I am a true budget traveller and that is why I set up this profile and my condo to answer to the needs of the traveller who share the same values as I do. I enjoy meeting and hosting travelers from all walks of life and every corner of the globe.

I always keep my place clean. After hosting and being hosted in different places by different people, I realized that not everybody has the same manners or understanding. Or not everybody was thought basic manners at home when they were young. 

The whole purpose of setting this profile was *to help* people and give back a little to return the good karma that was given to me by others. I know I am helping to people and *giving them a deal*, so remember that if you appreciate my hospitality you can always come back. My intent is to create a pool of regular guests and future friendships based on this.

I am a very caring and considerate host; also I am a very busy person and my life does not shape around Airbnb and I do this as a hobby. If I decline your request without providing a reason, it means I am either travelling for work or using the place for other purposes. Do not seek other meanings behind that.

Good luck.

They call me the greatest host in Chicago's nightlife. Rather it comes to hosting a great dinner at many of my favorite river north restaurants to hosting a great party at one of my downtown clubs. I into EDM, Hip hop, Future House and much more. 

My preferences guest is someone visiting Chicago to have a great experience or just looki in g to have a vacation from home my place is perfect with a little gift of wine and Netflix.

My style of travel is always luxurious. I try to live the high life and do nothing but surround myself around successful people so that I can learn.

Life motto is you only live one life, make it count and enjoy every part of it.

I am a 60 year old artist who loves to travel. I live alone in a lovely artist loft right in the middle of exciting River North Chicago.
Come have a unique experience. I will be glad to give you some insights to this beautiful cosmopolitan city by the lake.

I am a traveling musician based in Chicago. Other than that, I like taking random trips to NYC, LA & other big cities. Rollerblading, dancing, Karaoke, parks, water & deep conversations are hobbies. Love to cook. Like meeting new interesting people.

When I go out of town, I use Airbnb and I also host. Come stay at my awesome place!

My dad will tell you that I get along with everybody. My mom will say “Jide makes people feel comfortable”. My older sister will tell you that I am cautious and I am a romantic. "She is my best friend but boy, is she cra-z-y”. My older brother will tell you that I am his confidant and that my fashion sense has improved overtime. My younger brother will say that I am too laid back, yet surprisingly entrepreneur minded. My younger sister will tell you that I always need an excuse to laugh. My friends will say that Jide is ambitious, funny, outgoing & addicted to personal growth. My coworkers perceive me as a team player, innocent, efficient; they call me hustle B. I would say.. I LOVE , LOVE SALSA dancing... AND potlucks!
