If you find yourself in Chicago please book a few nights at my place!

Hello,

I'm James! I currently live in Chicago, IL U.S.A. I love traveling and prefer not to stay in hotels, because I enjoy being immersed in the culture of the place I visit. I've come to appreciate the convenience and accommodations AirBnB provides and am grateful to my hosts & guests. :)

Bio:
I am a medical student in Chicago and former graduate of the University of Michigan with a Bachelor of Science in Neuroscience, minor in Musicology. I received my Masters of Science in Health Sciences. I formerly worked as an Associate Healthcare IT Strategy Consultant for Strategy&, formerly Booz & Company (post merger with PwC). My previous research on Alzhiemer's Disease at the Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine was published in the Journal of Neuropathology & Experimental Neurology.

How I host:
I host how I want to be hosted. Traveling for leisure and work, I enjoy staying in the best hotels or homes. I have made my accommodations reflect the places I've traveled and the small (& large) luxuries I've seen. I offer a comfortable welcome in my home with large, sunlit rooms, high ceilings, king-bed, clawfoot private bath tub/shower, coffee/snacks, TV with Netflix & surround sound, and personal recommendations on attractions & restaurants. Being a foodie & coffee-fiend helps! I will respect and accommodate your stay as we share a mutual respect for my home. I hope you enjoy your stay in my humble abode. 

How I travel:
Because I used to travel weekly across country for work, I travel light. I stay clean, quiet, and neat because I respect myself and my hosts. I keep friends with the same mentality. I have excellent hygiene. When I travel, I only use where I stay as a place to sleep or rest. I prefer to spend my days exploring the area and evenings visiting nice restaurants or musical performances. I try to absorb the communities I visit and learn and embrace the culture. I'm very open to learning, talking and always prefer to be honest with my communication. I'm also very humble and caring for my friends and family. I look forward to staying in your beautiful home. 

Likes:
Travel 
-both international and domestic (U.S.A.)
-visited over 15 countries and 40 U.S. states
-lived in Ecuador for a summer

Music
-Jazz, Classical, R&B, Soul, Hiphop

Reading 
-Shakespeare fan
-Favorite book is "Brave New World" & "Audacity of Hope"

Movies
-"Up" & "Up in the Air" & "Shawshank Redemption" & "7 Pounds" & "Inception"

Food
-All kinds from ox tongue & snake to sushi/sashimi to traditional "cheeseburger & fries"
-Omnivore, definitely like my kale too :)

Sports
-Golf & Alpine Downhill Skiing (tournament, trained for U.S. Olympics for skiing- G.S. & Super G.S.)


Personal Quote:

"The past is a ghost, the future a dream. All we ever have is now."
-Anonymous

I am an artist.  My main line of work is in ceramics, but when I'm away I enjoy sketching and watercolors. Hi I'm Lara, and I am very proud to be an Airbnb Superhost! My husband and I love trying new places to eat, and have a real passion for traveling to exciting parts of the world. Having prior experience in the "hosting industry" ( in the Corporate arena as a Maint. Mgr.), I really strive to help make your stay here very cozy and comfortable. I rehabbed this 150+ yr. old historic Victorian home and it continues to be a 'work in progress' as I am finding better venues for improvement without compromising the integrity within the uniqueness of this old house. 

I'm an Artist and work with mediums such as glass & stone as well as carving Ostrich, Rhea and Emu Eggs in my spare time. Other than that, I am a relaxed host & will respect your privacy and feel 'if you need me' you can always reach me via phone or text.

I hope you enjoy your stay here and feel as if you've finally reached a place where; "Your Needs Are Met & Your Comforts Realized..."  Thank You.

Easy going, reliable, team player and love interacting with people from different places. I truly value clear communication in order to have a good understanding of life. Lucky wife to my best friend, and blessed parent of a vibrant little girl and  two cheerful little boys! I love to cook, host, hike, travel and explore!

Trying to instill in my lovely little boy my passion and need for travel...have visited 47 states in the USA and 59 countries. We are a married couple from Europe. I`m from Lithuania and my husband is from the United Kingdom. We moved to Chicago from Utah in 2013 and we just love it.

Living in Chicago and loving it.  I am a musician, artist, and filmmaker.

When we are home, we spend a lot of our time at Lake Michigan (we know the best swimming spots, away from the beaches), eating tacos in our neighborhood, riding bikes and exploring all over the city, and hanging out with our baby, the sweetest Pomeranian named Lamb (who also joins in on most of our adventures).

We both love to travel.  Some of our favorite adventures have been camping all over New Zealand, staying in a treehouse in the Phi Phi Islands in Thailand, hot air ballooning in North Georgia, scooting and lounging around Culebra, Puerto Rico, and snowboarding in Zermatt, Switzerland... to name a few.  

We both enjoy interior design, backyards, photography, minimalism, coffee, being outside, swimming, building fires, and biking.

My husband and I were born and raised in the burbs but are city people at heart, long term residents of our amazing Andersonville neighborhood. We're frequent patrons of air b&bs and are excited to offer space in our home to fellow travelers. I  like a good farmers market (I'm the proud manager of the one in Aville), a good meal, and a good book, and am happy to share tips on where to go for all three.

I have lived in Chicago for a decade now and have loved every minute of it - well perhaps there have been some sub zero degree winter days that I have questioned my decision to move here. On the other hand summers here are spectacular. Feel free to ask me about what neighborhood street festival or other activities are going on during your trip to Chicago.

About me I like Hepcat, Joy Division, King Khan and The Shrines, Smiths, The Get Real, Tribe Called Red, Excision, The Dead Milkman, Cantinflas, Trailer Park Boys, Cramps, Nancy Sinatra, X-Files, Black Lips, P5, CSS, Futurama , J Philip, New Order, Os Mutantes, The Clash, The Cure, Rubblebucket, Alicia Delgado, Reakwon, Major Lazer, Sherlock Holmes,Deer Hoof, Bjork, De La Soul, Ministry, Buraka Som Sistema, The Expendables, Cafe Tacuba, The Ventures, Fishbone, Calle 13, Book of Love, Eydie Gorme Y Trio Los Panchos,    Star Trek, teaching, and creating art. These are some of the things I love.

If you have ever wondered what it's like to meet the perfect neighbors wonder no more. We are a mid 40's married couple that enjoys evenings on our deck (weather permitting), home cooked meals/Family time, and a good laugh every opportunity we get. 

Both are gregarious and fun loving. The wife keeps our abode in excellent condition and the husband loves his backyard. A 3000 square foot home provides solace away from busy downtown which is still conveniently located 10-15 mins away. 

To sum is up, to know us is to love and appreciate us. Family oriented and our close friends are like family to us. 

You'll be pleasantly surprised at how giving we are and we are excited to open the comforts of our house to respectable, pleasant guests. 

We look forward to meeting you.

I'm an artist/designer who has a passion for cooking, reading, hiking & painting.
I'm always my best when in a beautiful environment;  I especially love being outdoors, in every season!
Current graduate student studying Arts management that doesn't mind sharing his space part-time.

I left the cornfields of Iowa a year ago in search for variety and adventure in a bigger city. Without a doubt, I have found it. I enjoy taking advantage of the unlimited concerts, restaurants, bars, festivals, and free events that the city has to offer- there are so many!

My partner and I are first year medical students. We're laid-back and quiet people and that will be reflected as hosts, but we're always down for nights out with friends. We like reading, writing, watching a few choice TV shows, hiking, camping, road trips, rock climbing, inline skating, and exploring this pretty city.

I was born and raised here in Chicago and he was born and raised in Tennessee, and we managed to meet and fall in love while in school at Alabama. We've both lived abroad (him in Iran, me in Austria), and love traveling and meeting new people. However, we're hoping to set down roots here in the city.

When I was 17 I wrote myself a contract to "always try to HOWL: Strive to be Happy, Open, Wise, and Loving." "If I HOWL, my wolf pack will follow," is a lame thing I wrote a few moons ago, but I still think my heart was in the right place :)

When he was 8 he wrote that his goal in life was to lead mountain climbing trips for those with visual impairments. He hasn't met that goal yet, but he's still as golden-hearted now as he was then. Also, he makes some delicious meals. If you're lucky, maybe you'll get one :)

I am a spontaneous, curious, and fun loving kind of gal with a fierce love for travelling and knowing more of this world. Different cultures, languages, and ways of thinking excite me and provoke a eagerness to keep travelling, learning, and growing (and now hosting).  Wanderlust at it´s finest!

I am currently living in Chicago, after a long (six year) stint in Madrid. I loved Spain so much and miss it every single day, but I´m lucky to live in one of the greatest American cities, and I know my warm and cozy home would be a great place to experience it!
We're an active family and enjoy hiking, camping, running, skiing, and cycling (especially far away from home!). When we're not in motion, we like coffee, beer, and good books.
A very laid back Chicago kid who studies anesthesia, loves to play music, and enjoy outdoors activities!

My husband and I live in Chicago with our son who was born in September 2015. Every day with him is a new adventure. I work as a Transplant Coordinator in research and my husband is in Finance. Most of our traveling has been to NC to visit family, but we are ready to venture out and have some fun vacations!

I live in Chicago and Austin!    Aside from managing a few rental properties I am in the motorcycle industry.     Being seasonal, I have had the chance to fill 2 passports and see the world ( in the winter mostly)   Looking forward to hosting you!

That's me at the top of the great wall of China. I've been in the hospitality business in Chicago for about 20 years.  My husband and I run a pub style bar and restaurant that is best known as a great place for karaoke.  We also operate a  10 room  B&B near Wrigley field  in Chicago. Our cottage in Grayslake, Illinois is a retreat we enjoy when we want a quick getaway from the city without having to travel too far.   We love to travel and like comfortable but simple settings, places that feel like home and we want you to feel the same.   We love history and have lots of cool antiques at our B&B which also is home to Room 13, a prohibition style speakeasy. We like classic cocktails, jazz, art and baseball too!  We love Chicago and Lake County and are happy to give you insider tips and recommendations, especially for unique, independent places.

My family and I are native Chicagoans and have owned our home since 1994. After my parents became empty nesters, we decided to turn my unused apt into private guest quarters and here we are!!!! We love our city and all of the amazing things it has to offer; especially in the summer. I'm happy to answer any and all questions you may have. I'm all ears:))

I've been self-employed for 20+ years from Real Estate Broker to a Restaurateur and now back as a Real Estate Broker. I specialize in locating that Dream house for that inspiring Family to the best Hospitality home for Air B-N-B Guests , so I'm definitely a people person. 
        Quoting my Mentor, " Allende has a unique kindness that is not understood by society.... Very professional and kind. ...Juan Mendez ..  
      On the social level,  I been a Chairman of numerous non-profit organizations and still involved in a number of neighborhood organizations . I'm also a Advocate for a Youth program mentoring  groups of male youths. 
    I like to read, attend church  workout, go to live events , enjoy as much as this beautiful City has to offer and visit as many restaurants as time permits.
An adventurous experience collector passionate about real estate, dogs (especially rescues!), flying helicopters, running fairly long distances, and meeting interesting new people
I'm an european living in Chicago, love traveling and art.

I love to travel to new destinations. I am the Superhost of a lovely duplex apartment in Lincoln Park, Chicago. I have children in college and visit them often. I am also an attorney in private practice.

I am a 32 year old professional who has lived in Chicago her whole life.  I have lived in my current neighborhood for over 5 years with my long time boyfriend (native Cincinnatian) and 2 adorable kitties.  I LOVE to travel and spend the majority of my free time planning or on my next big adventure.  Some of my favorites include Turkey, the Czech Republic, Croatia, Ireland and Mexico.  I have traveled in all different types of style from back packing and hostels or luxury hotels and spas...I am an equal opportunity traveler and so long as there is something to do, eat and drink and I am not at work, I am happy as can be.

When I am not working and traveling, my boyfriend and I love exploring new restaurants and bars in Chicago.  

We love meeting new people and hope you will enjoy staying with us as much as we will enjoy having you as our guest.

I've lived in Chicago for nearly 30 years and I love it! 
I am active, enjoy travel and love cooking for friends and family. I am still curious and try to learn about other cultures to get to know our world a little better.

I enjoy helping others to have a great time when visiting Chicago. There is so much to see and do in this neighborhood and in the city! There are four distinct seasons here in Chicago and each brings unique weather, sights, and sounds. I hope you will come to Chicago and stay with me here at The Villa Toscana Chicago Bed & Breakfast!

Hello, all. I'm Wes. I'm a big Blackhawks/Cubs fan. I'm a big traveler. I have a B.S. in Hospitality Management and I have a strong background in just about every role within the hospitality industry. Now I've downsized a bit and run this Airbnb. I've lived in the area for a long time so please feel free to reach out for recommendations. I look forward to being your host!
I have been hosting Airbnb travelers from all over the world for over 7 years. I am dedicated to an exceptional guest experience.  If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask!

Hello future guests,
I've been an active Airbnb host for nearly five years. Skilled in overall guest hospitality and a truly kind, generous and warm hearted being. I take pride in my ability to go above and beyond with my guests and guest interactions.
We love to travel, especially internationally! Enjoy seeing new places and meeting interesting people.
Artist/feminist/ art therapist / activist/social justice/ aesthetics of space/ Dog lover/ travel and history nerd/ PhD student
Chicago native who loves to explore the city and meet new people.

Things that make my life worth living:

 Love: Makes the world go round.
 Good Food: a party in my mouth.
 Sunny Days: guaranteed smile
 Music: Defines my days.
 Dancing: always up for a good booty dance.
 Fashion: My favorite reason to spend money.
 Laughing: Side splitting, tears, feels like I'm gonna pee myself. The best.
 Meditation: My church.
 Belief System: law of attraction, abraham-hicks, the Work.
 Friends: most often my reason for laughing.
 Myself: a divine being.
 Books: My teachers.
 Good Conversation: a reason to get lost for hours

I'm a host and a traveler, an excellent packer and vintage market shopper.  As a designer, I look for interesting properties to visit and I think my property is an unique and carefully furnished place to stay.

Hi There!  We're Jaclyn & Keith -  a newlywed couple who loves to travel and meet people. We've lived in the city for about 5 years now. 

So why Airbnb? We LOVE people. We love to meet people and I certainly love to host people. It brings me a lot of joy to meet the needs of our guests. We love being able to open our home to strangers who are soon to become friends.

We have been all over the states and abroad, some of our favorite places include New Orleans, Philadelphia, Santa Monica, Reykjavik and London.  

We also LOVE food. Come stay with us and we'll give you about 1000 food suggestions. There are so many delicious and unique foods in Chicago!

As travelers, I love to rough it. Why spend a lot of money on a place to stay when I just want to explore? I'd much rather eat ramen for a week then have to spend money on fancy food. As hosts, we love to meet people and help them enjoy Chicago. We hope they are able to get out and experience all the city has to offer while having a nice place to sleep at the end of the day.

Hello! My name is Nicole Mazade, I am 30 years old (oui) and am IN LOVE with traveling! If I could be gone all the time I would be! There isn't anything else in this world that gets me more excited, enthusiastic and just happy then being able to see different parts of this great world of ours. 

5 things I cannot live without: 
1. My camera(s)
2. My family
3.  My friends 
4. My jewelry
5. A pen and journal to write in about my travels

I do NOT have a favorite travel destination as of now...I LOVE to go everywhere! I kind of travel differently every time I go somewhere...Depending on where i'm going, who i'm going with and what is available to me. I use Airbnb a lot, but also hostels, regular hotels, friends, and have used couch surfing in the past. 

I am a quote person! I could look for a new quote/a new motto every day. Today it is.....

Self-help
How to stop time: kiss
How to travel in time: read
How to escape time: music
How to feel time: write
How to release time: breathe

I love hiking, the Chicago Cubs, craft beer, and trying new restaurants!

As a guest: I love visiting new places - I'm in a perpetual state of wanderlust! My upcoming wishlist includes Peru, Iceland, Costa Rica, Thailand, and Kilimanjaro!

As a host: I look forward to welcoming you to my city! I love our public transit system. I am happy to recommend things to do around Chicago and ways to get there. Let me know if you have any questions - I am happy to help you as best I can!

My wife Courtney and I have lived on the north side of Chicago since 2004, and in the West Lakeview/Roscoe village neighborhood since 2006.   In the summer of 2014 we added our daughter June to our family. Needless to say we love it here and are very excited to welcome guests from around the world into our new space.   

Courtney works as a wardrobe and prop stylist in film and commercial photography.   She has done a great job applying her craft in the design and layout of our space. 


We have been fortunate to have done quite a bit of traveling ourselves over the years (both in the U.S.and abroad).  We know that having great accommodations can be the difference between an amazing experience in a new place, or a total nightmare.  

It's our goal to provide our guests with a space that is clean, comfortable, safe, and conveniently located.  Because we are parents we have set up our space with families in mind.   The opportunity to provide travelers with the type of service and comfort we would hope for on a trip is something that is very exciting to us.   

Please feel free to reach out with any questions you may have about the space, neighborhood, or Chicago in general.  

Thanks!

Ricky, Courtney, and June.

I am originally from Cleveland and have lived in Chicago since 2008. I love to jog, hike, and explore other cities.

We're looking forward to hosting visitors in our 2nd floor Chicago Flat soon and continuing to travel to other AirBnB places in the rest of the year!

Our family consists of two adults (Gin and Michael), one almost ten year old boy (Miguel), and a friendly, loyal, black lab mix named Meatball. We also care for three friendly feral cats who patrol our yard and alley to keep away unwelcome critters. They stay outside, so don't worry if you have cat allergies. 
When you enter our building, you might first notice our interest in bicycling and travel. Michael and I met through bicycle activism and we enjoy visiting new places.  We both speak a little Spanish. He is more the world traveler, having visited over 25 countries. Miguel has also been on a fair number of trips. In fact, we lived in Ecuador for 5 months when he was three. Search for  8monthsafuera to read about our exploits. 

You might also notice many flowers and other plants growing in the parkways on our end of the block. Gardening with a mix of ornamental and native plants is one of my passions. I try to grow enough lettuce and greens to get us through the summer, with varying degrees of success. I also enjoy running and writing. I blog about all of the above. Search dashtothestart. 

We consider ourselves fortunate to have jobs that align with our values. My work is in bicycle advocacy, and Michael develops affordable housing. We can see one of his organization's award winning projects from our kitchen window.  Michael's other interests include brewing beer, making music, local politics, and history.

Miguel is a gregarious 4th grader who shares a love of language with his English major parents. Watch out for puns and silly jokes. He is also learning to play piano, and is working his way through Harry Potter scores and West Side Story. One of his current interests is the Titanic. He has become quite the expert!

A few years ago, we combined our first and second floor apartments to make more room for visiting friends and relatives, and better accommodate our desire for an office with a door since I work from home (i.e. to get all the files and office supplies out of the sunroom!) We love sharing our extra space with travelers from around the world.

Hi there!! Nice to "meet" you!
I am a world traveler. I am also a writer, photographer, TV producer, & video consultant. I recently traveled for 2 1/2 years solo around the world. It was amazing. I've now been to nearly 60 countries. 
I work from home...or wherever I am in the world. :)
I love food of all kinds, animals, and laughter. 
I am organized, neat and clean and like to meet interesting people and learn new things. I also like my quiet, alone time. 

I've both hosted and been a guest on airbnb. 

I grew up in the suburbs of New Jersey and have lived in Chicago for 17 years and love it.
Chicago Public School teacher, love this city.

Adventurous, kind, and creative couple living in Chicago, but originally hailing from Ohio. Mallory is a Dance Therapist, dancer, and choreographer. Edmund is a Logistics Account Manager by day and creative writer by night. We are inspired by traveling, culture, art, music, and insightful discussion. 
We would love to share our humble abode with you and the cozy, calm, and  creative vibes we have created to call our own, and now yours when you book with us!!
I will be your host I will do my best to accommodate all your saying needs . love to travel, love to cook and experience new food. I enjoy keeping fit and active.

We have stayed at Airbnbs in both Europe and the United States during recent trips and just love the idea!  We began hosting in July 2016, and it's been a great experience so far.  We hope our guests enjoy Chicago and the Lakeview/Wrigleyville neighborhood just as much as we do :). We are long-time residents of the area and welcome any questions/recommendation requests you have during your stay!

I am a Chicago born and raised.  I believe that Chicago is the best city in the world in the summertime.  I am a really laid back host and I give my guests their space and privacy.  I enjoy video games, listening to audiobooks, and visiting all of the placed you can eat in Chicago.

I'm now a superhost! Book with confidence :) Former ESL teacher living in Chicago. Traveling internationally and hosting people from all around the world are two of my favorite activities. I'm happy to give suggestions to make the most of your stay in this incredible city. I speak fluent Spanish and English, and enough French to get in trouble.

Thanks for reviewing my profile. I am from Omaha, Nebraska and am the youngest of 15. I have 9 brothers and 5 sisters.

I absolutely love traveling. I started traveling at a very young age and have been all over the world. My first international trip was to Japan. I went there as a United States Ambassador when I was 17 with a singing group I founded. I have since been to China, Korea, Thailand, Cambodia, Mexico, France, Spain, Guatemala, Dubai, Kenya, Bali, Brazil and several other islands & countries. One of my goals for the coming years is to explore more of the United States and check some of the boxes on my bucket list like Iceland and Australia.

It would be an honor & a privilege to utilize your space during my next adventure to your part of the world.

Hello!  I am a teacher and mother of a young son who keeps us very busy!   I love to travel on my time off whenever possible. I like meeting new people, which is one reason why hosting with Airbnb has been so much fun. :)

I am a thrifty attorney, beer lover, and sincere fan of monosodium glutamate. I am a dog person by upbringing, but I've converted to cat person. In general, I don't worry about things.

I am a homebrewer and am happy to share.
Builder Real Estate Agent Music lover musician
Respectful traveler who is also an Airbnb host herself! Loves checking out new places and sites off the beaten path.
Hi! I'm a teacher for Chicago Public Schools. I'm married with two little girls. My husband and I have multiple rental properties and understand the importance of treating someone's home with respect
I'm a working professional in my 30s that loves to stay active by running, going to the gym, and playing ice hockey.  I'm really laid back.  I love cooking/grilling and my favorite band is Wilco.

I'm a nurse in the Pediatric Emergency Dep't. I love my job but I love traveling even more! I love exploring new destinations as well as returning to favorite ones. I enjoy cooking, wine, and live music.
I host Airbnb guests in my home in Chicago in the summer and cohost our condo in Jaco, Costa Rica.
Bindi is a nutritionist, mom, and likes art/crafts. Avi is a dad, writer, and teacher. Raiva is a 7 year old girl. Rafi is a 5 year old boy. We love to read, travel and nature.

We loved our little Chicago neighborhood so much that after 5 years in a vintage apartment, we bought and renovated a building just around the corner. My husband and I have two little kids and decided we needed more space for relatives to visit. We enjoy hosting friends and family and meeting new people, sharing the neighborhood we love. We are on the line between Avondale and Logan Square. We take walks through Logan Square regularly, and keep an eye on every new building/restaurant, etc.
Traveler. Love good food. Down to earth.

I grew up living between Chicago during the school year and Costa Rica during the breaks (The benefits of having both parents employed as teachers with summers off). I loved experiencing it as a child, teenager, college student and whatever label I am now. In all honesty, being able to experience the urban and rural through the different perspectives of age, responsibilities, interests, and groups of friends really expanded my knowledge of and interest in Chicago, Costa Rica, and the world in general. I like to think of myself as an aged local historian in training, trying to accumulate as much knowledge as humanly possible through first hand experience and people's stories. I am a huge fan of swapping travel stories over local ale and cherish getting local insider tips about anywhere I'm traveling to. If you stay with us, I will be sure to dish on all the great hidden gems Chicago or Costa Rica have to offer.

I'm a foodie and over the years have tried hundreds of restaurants in Chicago. I love them all. From the $2 tacos in Pilsen to the $200 dinner in the Fulton River District/West Town, I appreciate Chicago's unique culinary style. Feel free to ask for any recommendations, I love an excuse to share my passion for Chicago.

Talkative and ambitious. I am a wife, mother and active in my community. I run my own real estate business. I am passionate about restoring my community. I've committed myself to helping others and enjoy every aspect of making someone else's day a little easier.  My travel has included the South of the United States, Ghana, Jamaica, and some of the other Islands. I'm a avid reader and my favorite book is the Warmth of Other Suns. I love all kinds of foods but I don't normally eat pork or beef. I like the theatre, live concerts, jazz and vocals. I'd love to host so that I can connect with others and hear your story.
My life motto is, "Live Your Life Like Its Golden."

I have a corporate job with an alternative heart. My favorite things in life are art, food, post punk music, motorcycles, joking around with friends and family. I travel as much as possible. Sometimes utilizing airbnb, sometimes camping, sometimes fancy hotels, sometimes beach shacks with sand floors. I like to mix things up.

I'm originally from New Hampshire but moved to Chicago in 2005 after finishing my degree in advertising at Arizona State University and then Miami Ad School.  When I began my career, I lived  in New York and a job with a new firm put me in Chicago and I never left.   It's my home and I love this city. 

I began working as an art director in advertising agencies until I realized my true passions are interior and set design.  So I began designing commercials, stills, and fixing up old houses. I was even once nominated for an Emmy I production designed so you can tell your friends you stayed at a kinda famous person's house ;) . 

I love to travel, sifting through antique shops and a lover of arts and culture.  I love good food and I will always be trying out the new hot spots in my neighborhood.  My favorite cuisines are Asian fusion and Mexican.  Also who doesn't love a good cocktail?  I can tell you which bars are great and what to order.   

I've been an Airbnb host for 4 years and I would love to share my knowledge about all the cool spots and what makes this place so special.  I hope that one day you will see what I saw that made me fall in love with this phenomenal city.
sleep?

Hey I'm Amber! I am originally a resident of Arizona but moved to Chicago in '02 and have loved it ever since. My husband and I bought this lovely grey stone in Logan Square in February of '15. We love it here! We are both real estate brokers and would be happy to help you get to know the city. Also think of us if you ever decide to rent or buy here! Look forward to meeting you.

"Enjoy life, this is not a rehearsal"

“We can complain because rose bushes have thorns, or rejoice because thorn bushes have roses.”

Hello! Hola! Ciao! Bonjour! Óla! Hallo! Halla! Привет! 你好! こんにちは!

Come and welcome to Chicago !!

Gay Married Couple, together 24 years. Me in the Hospitality Staffing Industry for over 30 years, my husband owns a dog walking service for over 11 years now. We love cooking, traveling, snow & water skiing, boating, the beach, theater, concerts, sporting events and dining.  We own 2 Norwegian Elkhounds: Brewster & Kelleigh, who love company!!

As a traveler, I am on the road a lot for work and end up staying in a lot of Hotels. When I travel on my own or with my kids I like to have more room for us. 
As a host I try to give to our guests the same that I would expect as a frequent traveler.
My rental is managed by Owl Management.

Hi, my name is Francesca and I was born and raised in Italy. I trained as a pastry chef and am also a professor at a university research center. I love yoga, archery, the sunshine, my husband (not in this order necessarily), good food and wine, smart people, beauty, justice and flowers. I grow orchids. That is all the important stuff.

We are from Chicago, we like to travel, obviously, enjoy new experiences, my parents retired to Seville Spain (even though they are not Spanish), my wifes from Bogota Colombia, so we are quite well rounded, we are respectful and considerate individuals.  We enjoy life, cultures, food, etc..

My wife and I love to travel and have a knack for putting together interesting spaces- more her than I.  Airbnb has allowed us to combine these passions, strangely enough.  We strive to deliver a great experience and want to share our space.  We understand what makes travel enjoyable and want to deliver that experience with every stay.  

Lakeview is a great neighborhood and the Cubs definitely help make it great, but the off season is very enjoyable due to the neighborhood, ease of transportation, and people!  Remember when the Cubs threatened to move to Rosemont- most of the neighborhood didn't mind them moving!  Southport is a great area, North Sheridan, Buena Park are all places to be seen!

My wife designed and decorated the entire space, except for the beverage refrigerator- my idea.  There are still some loose ends but we are getting great feedback.  We hope you love it and get the chance to enjoy city living next to Wrigley Field.
Husband. Father. Entrepreneur. Real Estate development. Enjoy the times with family, friends, and experiencing life.

I am a Chicago Public School teacher, born and raised in the city.  I have been living in the this great city and neighborhood for ten years.  It has many bars, restaurants and accessible trains.  I will be traveling this summer and I will have my brother, sister and girlfriend looking after my place.

Jake is a Chicago special education teacher in a Montessori school.

While living in St.Augustine, I hosted several couch surfers in a cottage. When I moved to back to my hometown of Chicago, IL, I started hosting on AirBnB and have loved it every since. I love traveling during every break I have and meeting wonderful people from around the world.

I have begun living in both of my two favorite cities for culture, entertainment and leisure.  The extraordinary contrast of culture and lifestyles in these two cities reflects what my friends and family would say fit the wide array of interests I have, or at least some of them.  I have traveled extensively and love to share local treasures of my cities with business and leisure travelers.  Also, I am a Global Real Estate Advisor with Sotheby's International Realty, please let me know if you or someone you know may be interested in selling or purchasing real estate.   My network of top brokers is global and I would like to share these services with you or someone you know. 

Also, my guest's experience is of my focus for my two AirBnB homes.  I have people from all over the world staying for business and pleasure in Miami Beach and Chicago.  In order to tailor every guest's stays, I have helped out guests with simple requests to those that are a bit unusual.  Please take the time to read my reviews.   

Remember, you get what you pay for.   Dollar for Dollar, my homes are the best in show.  Please message me if you have any questions or concerns about booking a stay.   Also, sometimes my calendar may not be  open a month or more in the future due to my dynamic schedule.  If there are dates you are interested in and they are not available, please send me a message and we can discuss making them available for your.  

I only accept well reviewed guests, as both of these homes are my personal residences.
I am a entrepreneur, I love finding out new things, discovering new stuff. Experiencing new people. I love traveling, spending time with friends and family.

I am a college student who LOVES to travel, so far I have been to Colombia, San Andres (still Colombia), Puerto Rico, South Korea, Thailand, Spain, Italy and hopefully a lot more. I grew up in the city of Chicago and am also an airbnb host so I know proper etiquette when It comes to entering another persons home. I like to try new things and am very interested in the culture every place has to offer. I am super friendly, easy going, and low maintenance.

I love Chicago. I've been other places, lived there, visited, but I've never found a place like this. That is why I'm here. The people, the culture, the food, the diversity they all attract me to it. That's why I bought this house in this location and strive to improve it every day until it is the perfect place for me... and you.

Traveling is a key to gaining perspective on the differences between cultures. It is an important part of my life. Although most of my travel has been within the United States, I strive to travel internationally more. As such, I understand the needs of a traveler. I strive to assure you have a comfortable bed, helpful host, and clean place to call home base.

I particularly enjoy traveling to interesting cities and beach destinations. Recently, I have been to Japan, London, Rome, Paris, Cozumel, Mexico and every other Caribbean island in that area.  Did I say I love to Cruise!!!  Now I'd like to visit the far east, Singapore, China, Indonesia.  Also to Auckland, New Zealand and Fiji that is something to look forward to. When I travel, I usually like to see the way that people who live in those places actually live. That is why I try to stay at my destination for at least a week, particularly in a foreign country. Of course, sometimes I just want to get away and relax as well.
From Chicago. Professional couple in advertising.
I'm from Chicago, IL.

Hi I’m Charla a food enthusiast, blogger and, a former food editor.  I’ve  stirred a few pots in my career including a stint as a Concierge in the heart of the city’s magnificent mile shopping district.  I’ve lived in Philly and Birmingham, Alabama, but there is no place like my hometown of Chicago. I’m always delighted to share info on food, restaurants, and other attractions in the city.  I love great bookstores, good pizza, and keep my phone handy shooting food photos.

Work hard, play hard financial services professional that enjoys having a good time without drama.  I like to hangout and rent to individuals that are the same particularly when it comes to the drama part!! Family with 4 very active children. I like all sports and am an outdoorsman.  I also enjoy woodworking, building things and all things related to real estate.
I teach philosophy and literature at the University of Chicago. In my free time I go to the opera, practice making old fashioned cocktails, and cook Persian food.
I am a designer, dog owner, father and art lover.

Hi, I'm Kim- lover of life and great experiences! I am a full-time Airbnb Consultant and Superhost.  I help people list their spaces on Airbnb while delighting travelers with personalized experiences. I am an avid traveler and used to live in Paris.  I wish AirBnB had been around when I was traveling Europe as it would have offered me a much more affordable way to travel.  Having wished it for myself, I like the idea of offering people a beautiful place to stay and great tips for enjoying this incredible city.  I am a self-proclaimed foodie and pride myself on knowing the best places to try in Chicago.  
My friends nicknamed me Martha Stewart years ago for my hosting skills, decorating, and cooking abilities.  I love hosting people and have even considered the idea of opening a B&B some day.
New parent that travelled a lot in younger years. Hoping to get back on the road soon!

Hello! On August 6 2018, I celebrated my birthday and my graduation from Johns Hopkins University Graduate School of Nursing. After living in Baltimore and United Arab Emirates the past 20 months, I have returned to Chicago to work as an RN and pursue my doctoral studies to become a Nurse Practitioner. Before I became a Nurse (Wow! I'm still getting used to saying that:-), I was a university instructor, NPR producer and reporter and filmmaker. 

I'm a foodie who loves independent movies, and working out/running. I've traveled to about 30 countries and I enjoy meeting new people from different walks of life.

I hope you'll enjoy your time in Chicago and your stay in my condo.

My mother opened our family Bed & Breakfast 30 years ago, so you could say I was born into this business.  In 2006 we opened our vacation rental in the heart of Chicago's Wrigleyville.  I happily manage both businesses, and am your point of contact from booking through check-out.

Interior Designer, young professional with an easy going and fun personality. Will go the extra mile for all of my guests in order for them to have a great and wonderful stay, is my ultimate goal using this platform. Love playing and watching sports; as well as watching great movies and traveling from time to time. Italy and France are my next destinations, so far London & Spain, and Brazil are my top favorite places I've visited so far.
Outgoing, Down To Earth Guy

Dear Airbnb Traveler, 

My name is Ilona and Chicago has been my home for over 12 years! 

I am heavy Airbnb user myself. I love to travel and meet new people during trips. I am very excited for your upcoming visit to Chicago. You will enjoy visiting the many Chicago neighborhoods, exploring the amazing cultures that make up our city, biking along Lake Shore drive, and enjoying delicious food. 

I am so fortunate to live in such an amazing, diverse and fun city and would love to host you on your next trip!

Hi There,
I’m a fashion designer. I like to cook; I even have my own cooking show on Youtube. I also love to host and enjoy family and friends over. I own my ​own ​business, but still manage to travel a lot and explore the world’s wonders. I’ve had good experiences with AirBnB and I’ve even formed a great friendship with a​n​ AirBnB host. Therefore, I would love to open up my home and share my clean house with guests.
hey! I'm an avid traveler who just turned 30. I'm easy going and always up for trying new things, meeting new friends, and seeing new sights :)

I am originally from France but live in Chicago, Il since 2006 with my husband and our two kids. We travel regularly to France for long periods of time and want to take this opportunity to offer our place to visitors in our beautiful city and neighborhood!

I own a circus company and this apartment building is attached to the old church where we rehearse and teach and hopefully perform someday. By staying here you are literally funding the artistic development of contemporary circus!

Chicago is home, I enjoy biking/hiking, read as much as possible. I cook/eat out a ton, it's a mid-west thing. I try to travel as much as possible, destinations with mountains, and trails get my attention. Weather I'm your Host or your guest it will be an exceptional experience.

I am an educator working in Chicago's toughest schools. I am also the founder and CEO of a nonprofit called Embarc. Born out of the classroom Embarc is on a trajectory to transform education. 
I love to climb, hike, eat and seek new experiences. 

Find Embarc online to learn more. Stay with us to enjoy a beautiful home while supporting cause driven people.

Firefighter, Landlord, Small Business owner.

Chicago is my home-base, but I travel to NYC monthly and take several trips a year to Mexico, Central America, and Europe.  I am open to new travel suggestions.

When staying with me in Chicago, I may scarcely be around.  I am always available by phone to answer any questions, and have a local travel guide prepared for guests with useful travel info, suggested tourist attractions, and favorite restaurants both near and far.

Thank you for reading.

Be safe-
Mike

Hello,
 I am a very active person who loves to travel and do every sport imaginable. Skiing is my favorite sport, but I enjoy everything from deep sea fishing to golfing.  My goal is to visit all of the 7 continents and see as much of the world as possible.  I have been working in the guest services industry for 12 years, and I enjoy what I do.

Pretty simple guy in the gym business and fight zombies for a hobby - With my retired circus performing wonder dog "Reels". Family and friends are the two things I could not survive without and Twizlers ( really, can't forget the Twizlers)

I host a TV show about Chicago  - feel free to message me for details.

 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Been a pretty cool ride thus far... 

I might talk to you a little too much... Sorry in advance!

Hi, Aitor and I are married professionals living and working in Chicago.  He works in management for an international chain of boutique luxury hotels, and I do professional digital imaging (photography) and motion (video).  We're both big movie/film buffs and love classic and contemporary cinema and hanging out with our very sweet and gentle 7 pound Chihuahua mix.  Aitor is a fluent Spanish speaker if that's of any help.

Hello! My name is Dave. I'm 30 years old, I grew up in the Chicago suburbs, and I've lived in the city for 7 years. I work as the Director of Marketing for a startup downtown - fun fact, we were on Shark Tank :). I love live music, good beer and wine, and being a tourist in my own city. I've lived in this location for just over 2 years, and I've been hosting on Airbnb for 3 years. Hosting lets me meet new, interesting people from around the world and I love doing it. I'm more than happy to play tour guide and recommend cool, unique things to do around Chicago while you're here. Send me a message if you have any questions at all. I look forward to hosting you!

Lifetime Chicagoan and lifelong Rogers Parker.
I'm an activist, organizer, and into politics.
I'm into records and making music and saving the planet.

I'm a middle aged professional and 25 year resident of the Lincoln Park / Lakeview / DePaul / Gold Coast neighborhoods. Chicago is a wonderful place to visit year round with all that it has to offer and the Coach House is the comfy home away from home to base your stay. For most visitors, Spring, Summer and Fall in Chicago is the best time to enjoy the 18 mile Lakefront, parks, festivals and art fairs, farmers markets, outdoor drinks and dining, concerts, sightseeing and landmark locations and Cubs and Sox baseball. However, the late Fall through early Spring including Thanksgiving, Christmas, Hanukkah and long weekends are a great time to visit Chicago with family and friends for the holiday lights, sightseeing, cultural and festive activities and the Chicago Bears, Bulls and Blackhawks!

Hi, we are Liliana & Ike.

We are a married couple in our 30s. I, Liliana, am a lawyer and my husband works as an IT project quality manager.

We enjoy travelling and meeting new people. We strive to make your stay pleasant.

An advertising industry professional and mother of twins. I love to travel and welcome travelers to Chicago. Some of my favorite destinations have been Brazil and Iceland. I worked for Time Out (publisher of travel guides and magazines) for many years so my travel (and living) philosophy is to find the less obvious, out-of-the way experiences that only locals usually know about.

Update: we just had our first child, a adorable girl named Alice-Pearl,  she is currently 6 weeks old and is super chill.  She doesn't cry during the night and sleeps upstairs with us.  

We have both traveled extensively together and separately. From Asia to Denmark to Africa, Central America and many places in between. We have also traveled extensively in the United States. 

We love literature and movies, skiing and dancing, swimming in Lake Michigan and browsing thrift shops and markets. We cook in our home, enjoy eating at all kinds of restaurants and never pass up on the opportunity to enjoy a good picnic. 

We love staying with Airbnb hosts and enjoy sharing our space with others. Sometimes we like to hang out in the house and enjoy company but we're often out exploring. We understand that guests do both of these to varying degrees too, and we are respectful of how much space people need.

Food and Wine journalist from Chicago who loves introducing small groups of friends to the wonderful area of food, wine and Chicago. I like to cook with and for my friends and guests. I'm a native Chicagoan and know the street, directions, restaurants, museums and events in fine details. I enjoy helping people find their way around and feel comfortable in my area. Love love meeting new people and sharing stories over food and wine, especially some fresh produce from my garden, a nice artisan cheese and a delish glass of Rose or sparkling wine.
Scientist, Researcher, loves peace and quiet, read a lot, home-lover, widely traveled.

I am 30 years old, born and raised in Chicago. I love going to see live music, meeting friends at the beach, and cooking.  My career has  privileged me to travel all over Europe, and North America for work. While traveling (domestically or internationally) I love to live locally, try new foods, participate in traditions and local customs, meet new people and connect with them. I like to have the "authentic" experience, no matter where I go. I hope to share those similar Chicago based experiences with people I may host.

I've lived in this neighborhood for over 12 years and I'm excited to share it with you.  I've watched the neighborhood grow as I've grown with it.  From it's angular art and music origins where flag ships such as Gold Star and Empty Bottle sailed and continue to sail the neighborhood seas, to dodging strollers with my own stroller as I push my brand new kid to the kid shoe store that just opened up.  I met my wife a block away.   We've shared meals at Dodo's restaurant (ironically now extinct),  one of our new favorite spots, Doves, and everywhere in between.  I've been fortunate enough to travel the world but I live here.  Looking forward to sharing a bit of that life with you.

Amanda Jane Jones is a freelance Graphic Designer / Art Director and the co-creator of Kinfolk Magazine. She lives in Chicago with her husband (graduate student at the university of chicago) and their new baby girl, Jane.
Born and raised in Logan Square. I love to travel & host fellow travelers :)
Just a regular guy running a bar and an Airbnb!!  :)
I love being an Airbnb Super Host and I hope you enjoy our properties! Please let me know if you have any questions.

I am a 30 year old Chicago native. I spent a few years traveling after school and doing seasonal archaeology in Alaska. I moved back to Chicago in 2007 to do research, I get to travel the country, and planet when I'm lucky, interviewing strangers about their lives. In my free time I love to take advantage of all that Chicago has to offer, including a fantastic lake two blocks from the house. I also sit on the board of a new non-profit art organization - (Website hidden by Airbnb) - check us out
I have been in the house for four years this winter, which happens to mark the 100th birthday of the house. I have been really lucky in that time to be able to fill it with great people, bright colors and interesting things. I love Chicago, and I love sharing it with good people. I look forward to hearing from you.

Hello, 
I am a social justice educator born and raised in Chicago. I love travel, food, art, biking, music, and good company. To me, the oldest and deepest of human passions is the need to hear and tell stories. So a perfect night for me is  drinking wine and eating great food with friends while laughing over each others' stories.
Hi guests, I am Jenny. I am an extrovert girl, loving to make friends with different people. I'm easy going and will try my best to assist you :)

I love music, new experiences, adventures, and particularly travel.

“The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.” 
― G.K. Chesterton

High school teacher, parent, partner, musician.

AS HOSTS
We are seeking guests to stay in our space and take care of our cats when we are away. Because of the latter, we are offering rates below average for the site. 

AS GUESTS
Usually trips booked here will be with my partner or partner and child.
We like to be near museums, state parks, historical houses with docents to guide us through them, nice but not too expensive food and/or to be in an urban space where we can see music and theater.

There are always chill vibes in my place. You will feel right at home, I am a graphic designer by profession, I spend my night waiting tables. I do consider myself very social and comprehensive.

I also live here, so please make your reservations with the correct amount of people, because I cannot accommodate sometimes.
I love to: dance (contra, contact improv, fusion, waltz, blues, swing, tango); spend time with my adult twin daughters: turn salvaged objects into art; throw large parties; garden.

Mother of 2, freelance photographer, nonprofit professional. 

life motto: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make, the better. Ralph Waldo Emerson

I am an educator and a business owner.  I like to travel and have traveled a great deal in Asia.  I am a registered yoga instructor and enjoy opportunities to practice yoga when my hectic schedule allows it.  For those who choose to stay in my condo, you might be able to attend one of my yoga classes for free as a guest.  I like to share the benefits of yoga to others.  More importantly, I am a great enthusiast of the city that I was born and raised, Chicago.  To me, Chicago is one of the most beautiful cities around (and I have traveled to a number of cities). 

Five things that I can't live without would be my faith, family, my cell phone (no seriously), fresh air spaces and positive friends.  My favorite books are usually about education, African American studies and ethnic literature.  I have an eclectic taste for music and usually gravitate to indie artists; I am not too much into mainstream music.  My favorite food is Mexican food and Chicago-style pizza of course.  

As an Airbnb host, I would like to share my entire condo with you.  As a host, I can be a resource if needed, but I also realize that the best way to explore a city is to simply allow my guest(s) to explore the city on their own and discover all of the unique wonders that a great location has to offer.  My best traveling experiences were those in which I was able to explore on my own and live in a space that felt like a home away from home.  As an Airbnb host, I would like all of my guests who choose to live in my condo and explore my city to feel at home.

As a current business owner, my motto is, "Dare to do something different, there is a whole world waiting for what you have to offer."

Hello, I'm Lesley! I've happily resided in Chicago since 2008. Some years ago, I spent 3 years in Spain, teaching English and studying fashion design. My passions are designing clothes, cooking, practicing yoga, music, hanging out in the outdoors, and traveling. I love being able to take advantage of all of the cool things Chicago has to offer, such as fabulous restaurants, museums and concerts. Please let me know if I can help you find what you are looking for in Chicago. I adore this city!

Greetings, Evan and I are very excited to host you in our home! We take great pride in our property and are very excited to have been awarded the Airbnb Superhost badge!!

As for more on us, we enjoy spending time with family and friends. We are very much into enjoying the outdoors (whenever possible in Chicago) and love to travel. We have been to many countries in Europe and Asia and look forward to future adventures to new places.

We purchased and rehabbed our home to accommodate our fast growing family. We were looking for a safe and diverse neighborhood in the inner city where neighbors are neighborly and the things we do and enjoy most about Chicago are within walking distance. We couldn't be more satisfied with our choice. As a family, we have had the opportunity to travel to many countries, states, and cities but found nothing quite as down to earth and historically sound as Chicago. 

We are a family of people who love to get out and take advantage of the many parks, museums, restaurants, and festivities that make Chicago magnificent. We love being a few walking blocks from the beaches along Lake Shore Drive and we take full advantage of it during the summer seasons. We also enjoy walking or biking to the many historical museums, festivals, conventions, and some of the most wonderful restaurants choices the city has to offer.

Whether you are here for fun and pleasure or for business, please allow us to make your stay in Chicago one filled with joy, laughter, ooohs and ahhhs. Chicago has it all. Welcome to Chicago...Welcome HOME.
I live, work and play in Chicago, Illinois. Love to travel, experience other cultures and meet new people. Fun fact - I volunteered at the RIO 2016 Olympic Games.

I'm a frequent traveler for work and pleasure and try to fully take advantage of each destination. I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I've begun hosting in Chicago and absolutely love helping others make the most of their visits.

I enjoy everything from museums to hiking and bars to libraries. Recent favorite trips include Denver, CO; Sante Fe, NM; and Memphis, TN. Last international trip was to Costa Rica and hoping to make it to South America very soon.

I consider myself to be pretty detail-oriented, organized, and responsible. You can fully trust me to take your space as if it were my own.

Just came across this Tommy Bahama slogan and thinking I'll adopt it as my life motto: "Make life one long weekend."

David is a quirky but hardworking, well adjusted gay man. His many carefully cultivated affectations lead many people to mistake him for a Canadian. Though his work as a high end residential designer is stunning and has won him some pretty impressive accolades, he owns several pairs of Crocs.  Amy is a laid back gal with a gift for words, a solid fashion sense, and keen eye. She's found her calling in the publishing industry and loves playing bartender.

Like Batman and Catwoman, Amy and David share a great friendship, mutual admiration for one another, and more common interests than one might expect. Both are natural hosts, love Chicago and look forward to sharing their city with you.

Former world traveller turned US-based tech foodie, currently living in Chicago. I love the local experience and discovering new places, new cuisines and new cultures. I've studied six languages and started new companies in four countries on three continents. Never give up.

Hello from the Greer family! I'm a professor (Film) at Loyola University in Chicago, where I live with my wife Chandler and two great kids, ages 4 and 6.

This summer I'm excited to be traveling to both Kenya and Italy to teach -- and look forward to my Airbnb experiences there.

Chandler is busy supporting both the kids and the community. Most recently she got the city to designate an abandoned green space -- once lovingly tended by former neighbors -- as a new community garden, open to the public.

Our whole family together enjoys learning capoeira, an Afro-Brazilian dance-martial art form that involves playing instruments, singing, and performing graceful, controlled movement duets.
Worlds greatest host. Easy going with a phenomenal sense of humor.

I'm a tech guy who enjoys volunteering and being outdoors.

CURRENT MISSION 
- Find a job as a Cloud / DevOps / Security Engineering. Getting ready to take AWS certs.
- Meet outgoing, passionate people. 
- Explore as much as possible. 
- Snowboard as much as possible!

ECCENTRICITIES 
- Very clean about some things (bathrooms, dishes, etc.)
- Can't stand vinegar. Allergic to soy. 
- I eat mostly Mexican and love Indian food. 
- Guests / hosts who are LGBT friendly. 
- Non-smoker.
- I have a super extroverted loving kitty. You will have to shoe him away.

FEELINGS ON TRAVELERS
I prefer travelers who are here to make friends, have fun and explore! 

INTERESTS
Being outdoors!!!! Snowboarding, Swimming, Snorkeling, Triathlons, Biking, Climbing, Motorcycles, Golf, Disc Golf, Beach time, Making & Building, Poker, Coffee, Antiques, Beer, Brewing, Brewery tours, board games, Lego, Space travel,

Volunteering - I spent Sunday mornings volunteering at a no-kill animal shelter for over 5 years.

Cooking - Favorite thing to cook is curry! So many different different amazing dishes to make!

Functional Art - particularly enjoy metal, wood, clay and textiles. I'd really like to get a good welder. Also would be fun to make and have a metal forge.

Driving - I love to drive. I'd rather drive 1000 miles than fly 3 hours.

Geocaching - I love to GC when I travel. It has taken me to so many amazing spots and sights in the past year and a half.

FAVORITE MUSIC 
Really into high quality audio. Getting into vinyl. Love reggae, the blues, piano, bagpipe and organ music. 

FAVORITE MOVIES 
I pretty much enjoy any movie that makes me think. Most action and sci-fi really captivates me.

FAVORITE BOOKS 
Most I have or read articles or technical in nature.

COUNTRIES I'VE VISITED
Australia, Bahamas, Barbados, Canada, England, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, Netherlands, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Singapore, Sint Maarten (Dutch part), Turks and Caicos Islands, United States

You can pronounce my name the English way, the French way, or just call me Gv. I host this space with my husband John. We live in the apartment on the second floor of the building. We're both lifetime Chicago residents and have lived across the city, in Rogers Park, Pilsen, Roscoe Village, Logan Square, Wicker Park, and Humboldt Park. A few years ago we settled in Bridgeport. It’s a heck of a neighborhood, and we hope you’ll discover it during your stay.

As admirers of vintage furniture and curios, we went nuts decorating for our guests. You'll find recycled tour cases sharing the space with antique trunks, a Milo Baughman original, and a 50s chrome kitchen set. We took care to include details that matter to us when we travel, such as a coffee machine, a private outdoor space, and cotton bedding as opposed to polyester. 

When we’re not scouring thrift shops, we write fiction. We’ve published a few books on our own and a few together. Our favorite authors are Beckett, Céline, and Limonov.

Hi! I am a young professional who loves to travel. I am neat person, and you can trust that I will be respectful of your space. I'm mainly looking for a clean, furnished, accessible, and affordable place to lay my head during my travels, but I'm always open to meeting new people so if you like to show your guests around your city, I'd love that too! Look forward to working with you and thanks for considering my offer.

And a little more about me in case you're interested:

Some of my favorite movies are (old skool) Sound of Music, Imitation of Life, Best Man, (more contemporary) Forrest Gump, The Incredibles, Iron Man, Coach Carter, City of God. As far as music, love neo-soul, R&B, old skool hip-hop, some pop is cool, and salsa and other latin music. Think Anthony Hamilton, Janelle Monae, and Diego Torres. I love traveling, as a tourist, but even more when I get to meet local people and really get a feel for everyday life and culture. I like learning other languages; there's nothing like being able to communicate with people in their native tongue! If I had a life motto, it would be seize the day with joy, love, respect, and an eye towards learning. As my grandma used to say, if you don't learn something new everyday, you're not living.

"It's beauty that captures your attention, and personality which captures your heart"

… I’m very passionate about things I really like, down to earth, funny-sarcastic, enjoy being on my couch watching movies, outdoor activities, pretty much everything normally people do!

I'm a big dork, love Greco-Roman history as you can probably tell from the photos of my place. This is the area I've chosen to live in because there are great transportation options and it's near some of the best stuff to do in Chicago in one of its best neighborhoods.

I live in Chicago and have 2 wonderful kids. I grew up in the city and have enjoyed spending time at the 1 bedroom condo by the lake. We are Cub fans and enjoy the culture and arts Chicago has to offer.
I like to keep these short. I'm currently a student at the University of Illinois. I like to travel and explore, read novels, and meet new people.
As a 20 something millennial, I'm never out of touch.
I'm a Chicago city dweller but also a mountain lover. You can find me often daydreaming of Montana and Wyoming. Or Norway.

I have a tranquil space with two entrances, lots of natural light, plants, and a garden in the heart of a bustling neighborhood. I'm an active person outside of my full time job and have plenty of recommendations for food, drink and fun around the city.

Hello! My name is Sean O'Keefe, and I'm 29, from Chicago, IL (USA.) I run a small business that performs auditing and consulting for medical facilities and physicians.
  I'm from a large family (5 brothers and 1 sister) and have relatives around the world. I've traveled more than most Americans, but have not taken a vacation for several years and am very much looking forward to traveling abroad to visit friends and explore my ability to work remotely in the coming months.
   I've had great luck in the past meeting new friends and networking, and I trust that my good fortune will continue now that I have an established career/business and can afford to do more than backpack and stay in cheap, shady hostels. 
    Internationally, I'll generally be traveling with friends that I've known for many years and who I fully trust in any situation. I hold accountability and respect paramount, and have tremendous respect for anyone who is providing me the privilege of staying in their home. 
     I'm always looking for my next adventure, and excited to see how AirBnB can help me get there. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) )'(

I have a massive obsession with The Beatles.  I'm a professional musician, songwriter, an actor & film making hobbyist.  The best experiences I've had in life are ones which involve the music and culture of The Beatles, and the people who love them.  I have also traveled a lot in my music profession, and I know what a difference the 'right' environment can make to a weary traveler.  I combine the best parts of my traveling experiences into your stay at AirBnBeatles. I don't over do it, but if I'm asked, I'm happy to discuss the music, the films, the fashion and the magic of The Beatles. All You Need Is Love, sure. But my approach is to find compassion in everyday life. For in the end, the love you take, is equal to the love you make.  Peace.

Entrepreneur, love to travel, train jiu-jitsu, and ride motorcycles.  

Can't live without purpose and imagination.  

As a guest, I will be very respectful of your property and will leave it as I found it; as a host, I will expect the same, but welcome you to enjoy my home and would be happy to point you in the right direction of things to do and places to see in Chicago.
Professional actor from Chicago. Clean, quiet and respectful of others and their space!

I am an Artist, Curator and College Professor in the Department of Art -   Can't live without: good healthy plant based food - (I am a vegan/vegetarian), Love  to visit Museums, Art Galleries, Shopping and International Travel.  I like quiet, neat, clean spaces and engaging conversation with people from everywhere in the world. I was born and raised in Chicago's Hyde Park and consider it my home.  I travel to England, France and Italy regularly and still have some places I want to see.

College Student in school for Nursing in Southern California.
An avid traveler that's always looking for new places to explore and new views to see.

Exploring Downtown Areas

Foodie
I'm outgoing, humorous, love to eat and travel.
World traveling musician, wife, Cat mom, food and film lover.
I've lived in Chicago almost my entire life.  I know the city and love sharing some of the great places Chicago has to offer.

I am an American student who is looking to live in Toronto as close to Ryerson University as possible. I will be working and living in Canada from May until the end of August and am looking for a place to stay during that time!

Thanks for checking out our home! My husband drew and I are both Chicago natives. We love this city and have lived downtown for the past 10+ years. So many great restaurants, shops, museums, etc... Though we've grown up and and love it, the mountains are calling our name. We are packing our two year old up and heading out to Denver to check out life in the west. We will be back often though as our family is still here. We hope you enjoy our place as much as we have the last four years. Please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns! 


The Boland Fam
Super host in Chicago, dad extraordinaire.

We are a young married couple that loves to travel and loves hosting travelers. Chicago is our home city and we hope that you enjoy your time while here. We are vegetarians who love coffee and whiskey (who doesn't?). We're happy to show you a fun time in Chicago or leave you along to explore the town on your own. Unlimited tea and coffee on your stay with us!
Mike is a teacher and Kady works for an environmental non profit. We are trying to make the community we live in better. Our motto: 
"I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day."
E. B. White

I've been to many places and enjoy meeting people from everywhere. I am grateful to have explored many countries, from beautiful Mexico to China and many, many (15+) others, and always enjoy learning about the different parts of the world. I hope to make your stay a pleasant one. Bring your stories and visit the beautiful area of Hyde Park! I'll provide the tea, chocolate, and  a bed. 

I'm definitely an easy going gal. If you have any questions or requests during your stay, please ask and I will do my best to answer/ accommodate you.

Residential property manager and real estate agent. Event DJ; '90s music energizes me! Animal-lover; my dog is my world. Sushi-addict; it's practically a line-item on my monthly budget. Netflix-binger; between classic and current titles, the list seems to never end.
I live in Chicago, IL.  I enjoy live music, art, and a very 'Indie' scene. I am a vegetarian and I enjoy food and drink.
DC Native, currently reside in Lincoln Park

host_location: New York, New York, United States
about_host:
Hello!

My name is Eva and my brothers name is Mario. Apart from hosting, we love to eat (we're foodies), travel around the world (using Airbnb of course) and stay active. My favorite destination is Taipei and Mario's is Zagreb. My favorite food is pizza (biggest Lou Malnatis fan in Chicago) and Mario's is a good sandwich (Publican Quality Meats turkey sandwich). 

We're locals born and raised in Chicago so we know a thing or two about the city... Come explore the greatest city in the Midwest! 

Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions you may have, our goal is to provide you with the best Airbnb experience possible!

Thanks and look forward to hosting you :)

Hi, I'm Scout! I would say if I were a type, it's of the earty-witchy-hippie variety, but I can cross borders from Kanye to Dave van Ronk, hippie to goth, extrovert to introvert, in a matter of minutes or seasons or years. I'm agreeable, and kind, but I can also cut right to the heart of a matter when it's called for. I can nearly always tell you what phase the moon is in, and if something ails you, I probably have a salve or tincture or tea for that.

I am a pretty quiet person, I mostly just cook in the main space, listen to music, and play my guitar on the fire escape, and I like a good chat over coffee.

As recommended by AirBnb, here are a few things about me...

five things I can't live without:
local, seasonal food
coffee
my records, and Spotify
avocados
my dog and cat

I have enjoyed a few trips, most recently to Lima, Pucallpa, and Iquitos, Peru, as well as Savannah GA, Port-au-Prince Haiti, Lake Ontario (both sides of the border), and a yearly trip to Eau Claire Wisconsin (ask me about Eaux Claires festival, I can't say enough about how great it is). I cant wait to travel more, and I'd love one day to see Vietnam, Cambodia, India, and Sicily (where my family came from many decades ago). I love camping, and I'm dead into "roughing it". I like the idea of experiencing a place as it really is when I travel, and I hope I can provide that same kind of experience for my guests.

I grew up in rural Virginia, and I've definitely brought a lot of that upbringing with me to the city -- I keep a fire escape garden, and I have a beehive on the rooftop. I either play, or am learning to play, a variety of instruments -- I have two synthesizers, four guitars, a mandolin, a banjo, a variety of percussion inventions, a drum machine/sampler, and a didgeridoo.

I spend most of my time doing house chores, learning about and practicing herbalism, reading (fiction, poetry, and educational books), playing and listening to music, especially vinyl records, sometimes going to live shows, and the highlight of my week is the Sunday farmers market.

My partner and I are passionate about our city and neighborhood.  He and I volunteer at our local park and school.  Our neighbors are like family to us! We chose to live in our neighborhood because of its prime location, but have been rewarded by our talented, outgoing, caring neighbors. This is HOME to us.

Matt (on the left) and I have been together for a little over 9 years. Patrick is a graphic designer, wakes up early, enjoys tennis, gardening, travel, food and wine. Matt sells real estate, is a gourmet chef, and avid traveler. We'll be as hands-on or off as our guests prefer.

Fellow air B&B host i also love  to travel and enjoy life with no regrets and Working in the airline industry makes that easy.

32 year old from the Midwest that loves to travel.  Started booking places while exploring the world, and now I want to host.

My name is Haley (duh) and I am a seasoned traveler. I frequently stay in air bnb's through out the world and because of this know my guests needs through my own personal experiences.

Smilin' friendly, and happy go lucky personality! Love music! Dances like no one is watching!  Love interacting with people and children.

My husband Chris and I, welcome you to our home in Roscoe Village,  a hidden gem in the heart of the best neighborhoods of this city.

A’isha and Chris

My husband Rob and I have spent the last 19 years living in this 130 year old farm house in the incredible Andersonville neighborhood. I am a retired Special Education teacher and Rob spent the last 20 years in higher education administration as well as being an artist. We have an awesome dog, and a bunch of koi that live outside in the pond.  We are both serious gardeners, and are excited to be able to share our little piece of paradise with our guests. I live in Chicago, and I do my best to experience the city's rich culture everyday.  I love to read, visit the lakefront, ride my bike, visit roof top lounges in the summer, try as many restaurants as possible and attend outdoor concerts.

My wife and I, Jessie, are Teachers of Transcendental Meditation, TM. We have been teaching TM in urban schools around the country for 10 years. I enjoy travel, meeting new and interesting people and taking on new and challenging situations. I am a problem solver by instinct.

This is my first experience with Airbnb and I love the idea of it.

I am a Chicago native and have been living in the Lakeview neighborhood for 30 years.  I am a great resource to both Chicago and the neighborhood.  I also live steps away from the flat so as long as I am local I am available for helping to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

I am a very energetic, friendly, and social person. I am definitely a people person and I am very easy to get along with. I am an entrepreneur who has lived in Chicago for almost 20 years. I love friends and family and enjoying being the hostess with the mostess :0)! People have always said my house is a home. About: Jean Alan's career in design began 30 years ago as a professional set decorator for motion pictures in Chicago and Los Angeles. We are an artist couple who loves to travel. Amanda runs her own design and homegoods business and Stacey is a commercial interior designer. We love to tend our garden and dance to new wave music.

Hello! I am a native Chicagoan looking to travel and help others enjoy my wonderful hometown.  I live with and normally travel with my sisters and nephew. What it's like to have me as a host: It's unlikely we will meet in person, but I can very easily be in touch! I'm happy to talk on the phone, text, or message you through the app to make sure your stay will be seamless and enjoyable. Do not hesitate to reach out for anything!

I love interior design, trying new restaurants and traveling as often as possible.  A few of my favorite places to visit are Switzerland, Italy and the Caribbean.  I'm currently trying to learn French.  I believe in the Golden Rule and karma!

Henrik & I  are entrepreneurs who mostly work from home. We have businesses that allow us to travel almost anywhere! Our motto is, as long as a place has WIFI, we can work from there! So we usually go there :)

Henrik's from Oslo Norway, since he moved to Chicago, he's used Airbnb to keep his home there while he lives with me in Chicago! When we are in Norway or elsewhere in the world, we open up 1350 to beautiful people like yourself.
