I Love Travelers,  traveling and everything in between.  Born and raised in Chicago, I became an avid traveller and barter enthusiast. I've been travelling for 20 years and could easily write my own book on travelling on a budget.  I PRIDE myself on the deals I would obtain.  A week in Ireland, rental of two 3 bedroom entire homes for $45! FOUR Chicago Bull playoff games during the Michael Jordan Era included 4th row floor seats, box seats...$100 total!  Travelled europe thru 15 countries for $500 including accommodations and food...for a 3 month period!  And this was BEFORE Airbnb. I can go on.  I'm geeked when I find a deal and become just plain silly with happiness at an unbelievable deal.  Even upon confirmation, my website for my guests are filled with free and things to do for CRAZY CHEAP.  'Spend like a spencer, but live like a king!'  

I feel everyone should open their minds to new things, cultural experiences and diversity.  Only then can you understand people thru their eyes and not some narrow minded media coverage.  By letting their experience be your experience will help you better understand people in a true and raw sense.  That's why I simply love Airbnb.  It places you in parts of the world where you probably wouldn't have gone but always wanted to go to get that 'local' feel with a local and trusted host.   

Since I don't travel as much as I used to....Let your experience be my experience!

I look forward to meeting you.
Chicago transplant that loves to travel

He has over fifteen years of experience and success in selling Real Estate in Illinois and Iowa delivering outstanding service and value to his clients. Not only is Mark a great Real Estate agent, but he is certified in staging and designing homes for sale.   Marcelo is a Senior Data Migrations Analyst working for a firm that helps non-profit organizations from all over the country implement their fundraising systems.  We are both dog lovers! Our home is filled with love and joy from our four girls, Ashley, Miley, Chloe, and the baby, Bailey.  :)

I would describe myself as high energy.  I love to play music, work out and read.  I love my career in real estate, I am glad I get to do something I love.  I love active vacations.  Communications can either be from me or my partner Derek Light.

I am a international relation and global business mayor student who love meeting people. I am a student at the Univerity of Southern California. I enjoy traveling and learning from different cultures. My goal is to build a global business and a social business. I belive in creating a positive impact around the world.

We have used AirBnB  as travelers and wanted to become hosts too. We live in a popular neighborhood with many amenities and excellent transit options. Your visit to Chicago will be easy!  We are friendly,  laid back, and will always respect your privacy and traveling wishes. 

Peter is a professor at Columbia College of Chicago. I am a full time Realtor. We love the arts, traveling and good food.  We can make recommendations, in case you need help deciding from so many options here.
Legal professional. Enjoys learning while traveling.
I am a Portfolio Manager for Real Estate Investors in the Chicago area.

I travel a lot on my motorcycle domestically and love to explore international destinations several times a year. No trip is complete without finding the best cup of coffee and friendliest bar a town has to offer. I also do my best to find live music and set time aside for art museums whenever I am on the road.
Traveler, filmmaker, musician, teacher, and freelancer.

I've lived in Chicago my entire life.  I love to travel.
I really enjoy meeting new guests from all walks of life. Sometimes, I even play tour guide!
I've had the chance to meet some very interesting people as a guest and host.  It's like backpacking around the world without leaving your city!
I like to travel, photography, music and films. I am involved in the film/commercial industry.

I am a Chicago native who loves food, music and travel.  I am an educator who is a proud member of the Englewood community, inspired by the residents who are invested long-term in the development and growth of this community.  

5 quirky things to know about me:
-  I love dogs, especially German Shepherds
-  South Dakota is my favorite state to visit, so far
-  I am a foodie who hates cheese
-  I make a wonderful Vietnamese chicken soup with all the fixings
-  I often take long drives just to listen to my favorite music

My life's anthem is the song "We're a Winner" by the Impressions.
We can be reached at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) We enjoy being in the central city and to explore what is has to offer.
Young professional who loves the great outdoors.

Hi, I'm seasoned executive  with a serious adventurous,  entrepreneurial spirit. I have traveled the world, luv music (all kinds), dance, hiking, cooking, adventures and smart, witty people.  Try to catch live music when I can!  Life has been a adventure professionally and otherwise and love every aspect of the journey.  I have lived in London, Hong Kong, Reno (i know just as exotic!) for work.  My work now, as a co-founder in an early stage startup continues offer me new challenges.  I work a lot from home, so I am usually around to greet you and make sure you have a great stay. When traveling I stay at Airbnb when I can and happy to now be a host for others!

I am a nurse in the neuro intensive care unit at a major Chicago hospital. I am also currently working on my doctorate degree in family nurse practitioner. I love trying new food and meeting new people.  I enjoy entertaining guests and inviting people into my home so that they are able to enjoy the wonderful city of Chicago.

Die-Hard Chicago Cub's fan. I live with my girlfriend, Grace and our puppies Gus and Lilly. Passionate about everything baseball and Chicago History. 

NOTE: my girlfriend Grace manages our Airbnb account as I am often traveling for work.

I was born in Nebraska , moved to Denver when I was 2, Illinois at 15 and have been in Illinois mostly ever since. I've lived in Chicago (the city) for the past 4 years, and also lived in Oswego, Batavia, and Bolingbrook.

I guess my approach to life is to continuously grow as a person, to be authentic and honest with myself and others, to appreciate experiences and connection over material goods. I kind of love humor and sarcasm, I think in another life I might have been a stand up comic or an actor, but in this life I'm a management consultant :) I consider myself an "extroverted introvert", my Myers-Briggs is ENTJ. 

As a host: I really like hosting, and try to be as social and as helpful as allows, but also want to leave plenty of space for the guest (and for my busy life). Sometimes you won't see me hardly at all, sometimes I'll be around quite a bit, depends our schedules. But the space is designed as such that each of us has plenty of privacy when desired.

As a guest: When I stay at Airbnb I don't spend much time at the rental! I tend to be out and about, and primarily use it for sleeping and cleaning up.
Picture taker. Baby Maker. Veggie. Giggler. Geek.
chicago
我是一个外向的人,我喜欢交朋友,喜欢迎来送往每一个来自世界各地的人儿,享受我给你们带来的快乐和满意｡我在这里欢迎你们的到来!

I was born and raised in Iowa and now live in the City of Chicago.  I am a landscaper by trade, am married to a Chicago native, and we have a 1 yr old daughter.  I cannot live without my girls, music, beer, gardening, and travel.

As a guest I'm pretty easy, I like to explore on my own even before technology  made things so easy.  I am clean, quiet, and respectful of peoples spaces.

As a host I can always be contacted by txt

My husband and I work for a non profit in our community called River City Community Development Center, running a job training program for teens called Harambee. We love Humboldt Park and see so much beauty in our neighborhood and the people who call this place home. We have two young kids. We love opening our home to folks visiting Chicago.

Hello! We are James and Jessi.  James currently works in the restaurant industry after a culinary career and Jessi in Integrative Medicine.  Our deep roots, however, are in art-making and other creative endeavors.    
We have a poodle-ish mutt named Agnes and twin girls who are three years old.  We enjoy road trips, boat trips, and cooking our meals from scratch.  Jessi has a home apothecary and experiments with making her own concoctions for the home and body.  We danced to Bob Dylan for our wedding's first dance and Tom Waits for the second.  
Although our property is managed by AllSet, we live upstairs and would be glad to help you with any recommendations for local restaurants, bars, music venues or other things to do in Chicago.  If we are around, please do come say hello!

I have been a masseuse for over 20 years, am now certified in an Ayurvedic body therapy technique called MARMA. Also I teach yoga/breathing/meditation as part of a program called YES! Youth Empowerment Seminar in schools in Chicago and around the country. I speak a little Spanish and understand more. My daughter is 22 about to graduate college. My husband is the International Director of the YES! Program and also teaches meditation. We are all vegetarian, non smoking and non alcohol drinking, artistically inclined people. We travel for work and pleasure, have taught in India, Haiti, Costa Rica, Mexico, Belize, Brazil, Argentina, etc. We love camping and outdoor activities in the wilderness, and have lived also in the mountains of California. We both were born on Chicago's South Side, and love the city and urban lifestyle as well. Our current home in Chicago is more centrally located, and a place that many friends and family stay at. We feel that everyone is family and live our life that way.

I am a visual artist and an acupuncturist.  I am originally from Italy, but I have been living in the US for about a decade.  I split my time between working on art projects, doing acupuncture and organizing healing justice events. I am very passionate about social justice and accessibility to healthcare.

I grew up in the SF Bay Area and have lived in Chicago for almost 10 years! I love this city, the neighborhoods, and their history. I also love finding nature within the city, and am lucky to live right near the lake.  I am an artist/academic/social worker, and love talking about all things art, books, social justice, and cities. And dogs. Definitely dogs.

As an avid traveler, I've stayed at Airbnb accommodations and hotels throughout  North America, Africa, Central America, South America, Asia, and Europe. My travels have helped put together, what I feel, is a wonderful staying experience. Whether you are in Chicago for a day, or a few weeks, sit back, relax and enjoy your home away from home.

My most memorable bite; sitting on a tiny red plastic stool at a short table in Hanoi, Vietnam. The meal, Pho

I’m a eclectic Jane-of-all-trades with a wide range of interests from ballroom dance to all things sci-fi/fantasy. Majored in Japanese, minored in history, and a life-long volunteer for many organizations. My life’s guiding tenet is to strive to leave all things and people better than when I found them—from disaster relief to a kind word, even the small things can make a difference. 

I’m a problem solver by nature, and inspiration is my specialty. Tell me what you’re looking for, and I’ll help you find it. 

A vegetarian/flexitarian (dat sushi doe!) with a health-supportive culinary degree and an oversized library of cookbooks, food is a particular passion of mine, and finding a new favorite dish is one of the best things about traveling. 

On the downside, I sometimes break into song, and/or cuss like a sailor, but I do try to keep those incidents to a minimum.
I'm a native Chicagoan with a passion for food, art, culture, and travel. Clean, quiet, positive, and friendly; a bit of a hoot; and an exceptional cook.

Like you, I'm a traveler, a wanderer, a lover of exploration and adventure.
I love connecting with people when I'm traveling, and fully subscribe to a serendipity philosophy.
This has served me well in an eat pray love kind of way. I met my beloved husband and his Holiness the Dalai Lama in the Himalayas of northern India, in the same week, at the end of an 8 month adventure that began in Tibet in 2001.
Seriously. 
That happened.
I'm very conscious about helping my guests have a great experience in my city, whether it's through my recommendations or just providing a sweet spot to rest and recharge between adventures. I hope our guests feel like they've landed in their home away from home and their trip is more special as a result.

I am an avid traveler and architect, whether it's a weekend trip by the beach, backpacking through the islands of Venice, or a construction site visit during the week. With my experiences in traveling, I would love to be able to accommodate and assist you with your stay!
We will be travelling from the USA

I live in Chicago, an actor and part-time Airbnb host. In my spare time, I like to stay active doing yoga, lifting, writing, traveling, playing piano and guitar, and improving my woodworking skills. I'm a northern CA native, and I like to use reclaimed lumber for the things I build. I look forward to helping you get to know Chicago and check out all the great things this city has to offer.

Favorite TV shows: Survivor, The Good Place, Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Bob's Burgers
Favorite podcasts: Left Right & Center, This American Life, Keep It! 
Favorite vacations: Barbados, Ireland, New Orleans

I'm a regular traveler and Airbnb host when my schedule permits.  I'm happy to help my guests navigate Chicago, whether by car, train or bus, and whether they have specific plans are are here to explore.

My friend Albrecht (Albi) has helped with my guests, so you will see his name mentioned in the references, and his photo is the one with the mascot.

"The devil is in the details."

Chicago native. Buckeye nation.

I'm Claudia Rae, a Cocktail Waitress at a lounge in River North. Reside in budding hotspot area, Logan Square. Described as friendly, easy going, and open minded. Love: music, food, dancing, and books. Alma mater: The University of Iowa.
Chicago based.  Keep passport close.  Love to travel.

Hard-workin', Fun-lovin', Chicago Woman. I've owned The Bucktown Cottage for 8 years and hope to make your stay amazing!

I love traveling, eating, collecting random furniture at the Randolph Market, and making new friends!
Not much to me. Just lending out my space when I can manage. Ask me anything and I'll happily give a reply!
I am a Middle School Teacher living in Honduras.  I attended Loyola University Chicago and lived in Chicago for four years.
We love sharing our home!
Solo host who also uses AirBnB when travelling.  Into classical music and horror literature. Love being a transplanted Chicagoan.

Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)
I am a married special education teacher. We have a 6 year old son. We love to dine out, travel, and the great outdoors.
My favorite part about living in Chicago is the food-that's also one of my favorite parts about visiting new places. Meeting new people is my other favorite. Ready for the next adventure!
When I’m not traveling, I’m teaching theatre in Chicago! I am also an Airbnb host on the side.
I am owner of westtown building and my goal is to serve to the people who travel around of world, with good and comfortable place, and reasonable prices to stay for business or vacation.

I love to learn, getting to know people, and traveling. I have not been to one place I have not loved, and any stressful situation has later turned into a fantastic story!  Before the social media connections on the world wide web, I accidentally booked a hostel in the red-light district in England- it is now a great story! :) There is also the time I traveled all by myself in France, and accidentally fell asleep, missing my stop. That said, I have been to Austria, Canada, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Mexico, Peru, Puerto Rico, Spain and Switzerland, as well as all over the U.S! There are still so many places left to explore, and what works for me is having points of interest with no set agenda, as long as I can experience that place as a local.

Currently, I am a teacher and back in graduate school which is helping me truly learn the meaning of leading a balanced life! Before that, I was a die-hard runner trying to run long-distance races across as many states as I could. I do plan on running my 14th state after I am done with graduate school! If you are a runner looking for a great Chicago race, I can point you to many I have enjoyed dearly!

My life motto is: Love everyone, Courage in difficult times and Trust the unknown. Life gives you what you put out there, so I am trying to lead a life as a servant leader. As an Airbnb host, I hope I can provide you with a great experience by sharing my home and city. My neighborhood is what Andersonville and Lincoln Square were before they became "discovered."

In the case you do not yet have an Uber or Lyft profile, please download the app. This is the fastest way to catch a Taxi in my neighborhood. Here are some discount codes for you:

Lyft: MILLY352659

Uber: scgsj

I am excited to share the many hidden gems of my neighborhood. Stop on by to experience life as a Chicagoan!
We are family who enjoys watching sports, playing games, and music.

I'm one of those people that work to live instead of live to work. 

I've got a great corporate 9-5 where I basically get to play with mobile apps all day for a fortune 50 company, which affords me the luxury of focusing on the things that truly make me happy when I'm not in the office.  In my spare time, I'm Board President at a local Chicago based non-profit where we help kids in underserved communities build literacy skills through creative writing (Barrel of Monkeys) and I'm also a founding company member of a pretty cool little theater company that creates adaptations of big budget blockbusters and then brings them to the small stages of Chicago (InGen Productions).

I'm also an avid cook, vegan, craft beer and vino lover, cat owner, and can't get enough live music, comedy and outdoor time when its warm. My happy place is in the kitchen on lazy days, and in the dance studio mastering new moves on those days that are a little less lazy.

I'm hoping to do more travel, especially internationally, over the next few years. I've been using Airbnb for a while as a guest, but have recently decided to try my hand at hosting to rent out some of my domestic spots I've already stayed at a number of times. Although they are all GREAT spots, I want to expand my horizons and see some new places. I am hoping that this will help! 

Any other questions, please ask!  Thanks for reading about me, and I look forward to learning more about you soon! 

Good vibes and wishes,
Jen

Recently married, golf fanatic who loves traveling. My wife and I recently relocated to the Southport Corridor (our listing) and absolutely love it. Our place is extremely accessible via Public Transit and has a ton of great bars and restaurants within only few minutes from our door. We're also excited that the 2016 World Champion Chicago Cubs and beautiful Wrigley field are only a 10 minute walk from our pad.  

My wife and I are always looking forward to hosting great people. Drop me a note to learn more about our listing or if you have any questions we can assist with!

I'm new to AirBNB but have stayed in them on vacations with friends. I love to travel and probably do so once a month whether it is to see friends, family, or just check out a new and exciting location.  Some of my favorites I've visited include Ft. Lauderdale/Miami, New Orleans, Washington DC, and Austin here in the U.S., and abroad destinations include London, Barcelona, Berlin, and Munich.  

When travelling, I love to explore new neighborhoods and get lost even without relying on a guide book. I like to experience the people, try the local food or wine/beer, and just enjoy myself on the journey.  I'm pretty laid back but also clean and respectful of other people's spaces.

Beyond travel, I also love music, playing tennis, politics, reading, dining out, dancing, and spending time with friends.

Hi! I'm a semi-nomadic artist and writer. I work seasonally in Alaska during the summer and Chicago in the winter. In my free time between temp jobs, I'm currently working on a travel memoir about my trips through Europe, Latin American, the Middle East, and all 50 of these United States. The walls of my apartment are covered in my artwork and decor I've collected from around the world.

Hi, I'm Anne.   I'm an architect living in Chicago again after fifteen years away in NYC and San Francisco.  My wife and I have been renovating a two flat in Logan Square, and have designed a great apartment to serve as your home base.
We're big fans of art, music, design, and are happy to help you find all the best spots for your stay in Chicago.

I am originally from Michigan, and before moving to Chicago in 2012, I lived in Tampa, FL. I have a Master's degree in Counseling Psychology. I enjoy traveling and music festivals - and yes, I am one of those people who goes to Coachella.
I am a quiet guy who enjoys golf and hosting guests in the lower level of my home.

I am the daughter of immigrants, who came to the United States to make a better life for themselves and to help my widowed grandmother.  I was born in Chicago and grew up in Wrigleyville on the Northside of Chicago which is a vibrant and diversified neighborhood.  I have a wonderful husband and an incredible daughter and have lived in our home for almost three decades.
For 15 years, I was honored to teach students Interior Design and Architecture at a Design College in Chicago.  I love to travel to other countries and experience their culture, language and foods.  My favorite cities so far, Amsterdam, Paris, Mexico City and Antwerp.  I hope to continue travels to far-off distant lands.  I used Airbnb for my second trip to Paris, and really preferred it to staying in a hotel.  And the primary reason for hosting on Airbnb is to offer guests the ability to experience Chicago and its unique neighborhoods in a home setting.  I enjoy meeting people from different states, countries and from diverse cultures.
My favorite foods are enjoyed in the company of my family and dear friends: Roasted Chicken, Margherita style thin-crust Pizza, Grilled vegetables, a nicely poached or grilled Fish, Thai, Vietnamese and Italian food.
My favorite books: “To Kill a Mockingbird”, “Music for Chameleons” and the “Harry Potter” series.  My favorite music: Bach’s “Concerto for Two Violins in D minor”, Debussy’s “Claire de Lune”, Puccini’s “Nessun Dorma”, Kern & Field’s “The Way You Look Tonight”, Pink Floyd’s “Another Brick in the Wall”, “Hey You” and “Money”, Beatles’ “Hey Jude”, Marc Anthony’s “El Cantante”, Adele’s “21” album and Sam Smith’s “In the Lonely Hour”.  

My life motto: “Always treat people as you would like to be treated.”

Love meeting new people!  Life is all about Experiences!

Love to travel! I’ve taken a ton of trips the past 5 years, time to enjoy Chicago and my Condo hosting people from all over the US/World.

Play sports like basketball, golf, enjoy working out, spending time with family and friends.  

In the summer and spring you will find me on the Lake or doing anything outside.  

Volunteer basketball coach the past 10 years and I teach an 8th Grade Finance class!

‘You will never make 100% of the shots you don’t take’ is a quote that has stuck with me since a kid. Life is all about taking chances, living experiences, and having fun!

This 2nd floor apartment is my home, not a full-time rental unit. I’ll be staying on the first floor with my daughter and we'll be available to greet and answer questions. Primary guest should be 25 years old or older or have Airbnb reviews for reference. We will do whatever we can to make sure your stay is enjoyable!

I love history, geography,gardening, buildings and travel ! I have been to 20 countries some (Japan,Peru,Mexico)several times  and lived in Australia. 

I also love comedy and like to tell a few jokes on occasion .
Urbanist
I work in purchasing, and love bicycling and travel, having visited 10 countries so far and counting!
I love to travel and love to host. I used to do couchsurfing until I moved. Sorry surfers, I need to subsidize my rent.
I like old vintage houses with architectural character.
I am a fashion retail manager and vintage resale side hustler. I am a music listener and movie watcher. I am a dog owner and lover. I am a queer weirdo. And I am extremely introverted.
Life is random, so am I. Love traveling and meeting new people. Proud dog mum of 2 snuggle monsters!

I run my own real estate development company and buy and build property in the city. I love living in Chicago, particularly my neighborhood, and look forward to letting others experience it. 

I try to keep a pretty regular schedule that has me up every day at 7 am and in bed by 10:30 or so.  

I try to give guests their space, and I can be pretty introverted if I'm busy with work, so if I don't interact much it's me, not you! I'm happy to answer any questions about the city or anything that's not in the itinerary. 

If you want to know anything in particular just ask!
Traveling is one way to make lasting memories.

From Cleveland, OH 
Work in the restaurant industry
Yoga teacher, artist, and travel enthusiast living and loving in the big city while  exuding only smiles!

Fairly well traveled, but always happy to do more!
Love baseball and American football. :)
Live music = good music.
Can't pass up any combination of cheese, cured meats and olives!
Proud to be a midwesterner forever in my heart and soul.
I founded a not for profit organization Lemonaid Fund that takes me all over the world helping people to help themselves. I decided to be a host for Airbnb because of my great experiences world wide.

Hi there! I'm a high school literature teacher who has spent her life traveling the world. I speak English, Lithuanian, and Spanish and am working hard to learn French, so I look forward to some lovely conversations with my guests! I spend my time going to plays and comedy shows, supporting the local music scene, and grading a LOT of essays. If you stay with me, I'll cater to whatever environment you want. I can be visible or invisible; it's up to you. 
I live by the motto, "If you die, it's a tragedy; if you live, it's a story," which means I love collecting the stories of my guests. I welcome you to my home and hope Chicago fills your life with new stories to tell!
Housefrau. Soccermom. Author. Doing all of the things and none of them well since 2006!

Hi! We are Elma and Edo, married 30 years! We are now empty nesters who have two grown children who are living outside the USA, traveling the world. We are pretty active and busy. We both work full time, Im a Social worker and director of a Refugee resetlement program in Chicago and Edo manages a building on iconic Lake Shore Drive. We love to go on walks, bike rides, visit the Botanical Gardens, and parks. I love to cook all types of cuisine and my husband is the number one fan of my cooking. We are very open and honest and love to meet people.
Mom of 2 boys, enjoying all that Chicago has to offer!
Fun loving, world traveling gal.

I'm a young business professional working in the investment services industry where I travel often for work. I love to entertain, read, fish and travel for leisure whenever I can. I've been to over 20 countries but my favorite places I have traveled to outside the U.S. are Sydney, New Zealand and Munich. Inside the U.S. my favorite cities are Charleston South Carolina, San Francisco and Chicago. I love to learn about other people's story and what interests them..

I'm a very out going, funny, sarcastic, single, gay, Chicago native.  

I am 34 years old, enjoy movies, music, shows, spending time with my big Irish Family, and Miller Lite!

I have two listings: one is for my whole place when I'm out of town and the other is for my spare room when I will be here as the host with the most.  Hence the reason for the price difference.

I am a big traveler, always exploring new cities- I love to immerse myself in the culture! I believe the best way to stay in a city, is to stay as the locals do- Which is why I am such a huge fan of Airbnb!

My husband and I are also world travelers and would be interested in staying at an airbnb at some point. We are both retired. Myself, a graphic designer and my husband a sociologist, anthropologist and author. We always treat our guests as we would like to be treated.

Just a happy family man with an amazing Husband and Twin Girls. We love living in Chicago (in Lakeview/Southport Corridor just 15 min walk from Wrigley Field, 10 min walk from Boystown and a block from the brownline Southport stop. Basically we're close to everything fun on the north side of downtown!
I do my best to make sure you have a comfortable private stay at my beautiful Chicago residence.

Originally from Cincinnati, I moved to Chicago to obtain my Master's degree in Counseling and Organizational Psychology. Now I have a full time job in digital talent assessment and am attempting to pay off my student loans (hello Airbnb!)
I have since fallen in love with this city, and I hope you will too!

I've lived in Chicago for 10 years and I absolutely love this city. 

Happy to share my recommendations for dining, nightlife, and weird and different local favorites for your stay. 

I have travelled to many, many airbnb's meeting many new friends along the way and I'm looking forward to meeting and making new friends as they stay here.

I've lived in the area for almost 30 years so if you'd like any tips on restaurants, music, theatre, etc., I'd be happy to help. I'm a textile designer and have lived and traveled around the world.  I use Air Bnb wherever I go so I'm eager to offer you a nice place and to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Chicago is a great city and I hope you have a wonderful time here.
Hi I'm Kathy, I live in Chicago and love to travel, eat, drink, and be merry!
My name is Victor and currently live in Chicago.  I enjoy the outdoors and have a passion for traveling!
Wife and I work in the travel industry, We love to travel, hit the beach or new places, its in our DNA, I'm Australian and she is Dutch. .

Victoria and I are worldly, outgoing, and gracious hosts! As creative individuals we appreciate the aesthetics and beauty of the city we live in and yearn to share it with our guests. We are well-traveled and understand the importance of a connection between the place you stay and the atmosphere it creates. Victoria and I are thirty-something, fun seeking, professionals who exude optimism and hospitality to all we meet. Victoria, an interior designer, hails from St. Louis (thankfully not a Cards or Blues fan, ha!) and has been a decade-long Chicagoan with short stints in Las Vegas and Los Angeles. As "Mistress of the Manor", Victoria is currently in the process of transforming our place into THE place, however, it is a work in progress... 
Born in West Germany (a country that no longer exists), I moved to Chicagoland as a baby and have lived here ever since. Having traveled extensively with the US Army seeing over 33 countries, those experiences and encounters (don't ask they’re  classified!) have shaped the renaissance man I am today - writer, rugger, reader, weight lifter, and much more. As a couple, we are big foodies - always searching for new culinary adventures, we're into rugby (former player), hockey, and baseball, and have a huge affinity for all games board and card. A typical night out for us may include karaoke at Bobby Love's, playing Trivial Pursuit, or working up a sweat at Holiday Club. We cordially invite you into our home so that you and your guest may have a small taste of quintessential Chicago!

I love making my guests feel welcomed.  I aim to provide a cozy, comfortable experience, just like I would for any friend or family member that I might host in my home.

Personality: friendly, great sense humor, creative, authentic. Preferences/activities: reading, socializing, exercising, enjoying nature, self-development goals makes me giddy, love new experiences & adventure.

Hi

My name is Sergio and I love hosting and traveling through Airbnb. The perfect life for me would consist mostly of traveling, running, reading and just experiencing new things on a daily basis.

When it comes to traveling and hosting, I try to respond almost instantly to any questions but at the same time I try to give my guests space to better experience Chicago.

Feel free to ask me any questions about my apartment or my hometown of Chicago.

I am a high school social worker in Chicago and my husband is a fifth grade teacher for Chicago Public Schools.  We love our city and we enjoy sharing the fun places we frequent.  
 (Website hidden by Airbnb)

Hi! My name is Lindsay Taylor and I live in Chicago, IL. I work full time (in technology) and have lived all over the world, in Spain, Mexico, the UK, and more. I have traveled to every continent except Antarctica. I speak Spanish fluently and am working on my Portuguese!

Traveling and oil painting are my two favorite things to do aside from exploring restaurants, going to theaters. My favorite travel destination are: Kathmandu,  Paris, Barcelona, and small towns in japan.

Hello! I'm Kristen and really enjoy the unique Air BnB community. So many options for where to stay, and looking forward to meeting new people through the space I host in Chicago.

I've lived in Chicago for 10+ years, originally from outside of Detroit.  Bought the place where I host an apartment two years ago, in the Logan Square neighborhood, and have been enjoying living in the building/experiencing home ownership 101.

I enjoy photography, a hobby I recently picked up--so much to learn! Plenty of good places within a short walk of my place to explore and take photos... I found a mom and 5 baby raccoons in Humboldt Park recently! 

I enjoy traveling with my boyfriend, Dave.  So far we've stayed pretty close to Chicago--Wisconsin/Michigan or traveling for the holidays.--Colorado, Florida.  Looking forward to checking out Iceland at some point with him, photography opportunities are apparently amazing.

When I travel/am thinking about my hosted apartment, I like to find places with character that are comfortable.  I can't resist a cozy space that makes me feel like I'm escaping my day to day.

I'm a travel-loving mom whose son is away at college. I have time to travel now, and offer my adorable, convenient, quaint space! 
       My 4th fl. apt is tiny & cozy. The building is 100 yrs old and has most of its original design (including the accordion-gate elevators, which are rather comedic, but I appreciate their authenticity). The bathtub is original, and longer and deeper than those of today. 
     The view is to the south, so the nighttime shows off the Hancock Bldg and the Sears Tower (I can't bring myself to call it by its new name: the Willis Tower) and early mornings with my coffee, staring at the glowing skyline are my favorite.
There is a little office area with a desk off of the kitchen.
       There is room for two - one twin bed, and a couch that doubles as a daybed. PLEASE NOTE: There are only two one-person beds. Each bed fits only ONE person each. Prior guests have reviewed that the bed is “a bit small for two.”....and that's because it's not MEANT for two! :):):)
       My style is earthy, bohemian, and nature-inspired. Many of my belongings and furniture were acquired from my travels and from flea markets. There is a faux fireplace where I place candles, giving the space an extra-coziness, especially at night. 
       The apartment is just a few blocks from the red line (subway), three stops from Wrigley Field, one block from the bus stop. I no longer own a car, and I don't miss it with how convenient public transportation is in Chicago! Should you drive here, much of the parking around the bldg is free, some requires a permit. Make sure to read the signs along each street before choosing a spot. It's easier to find a spot during the day than the night, but I always found a spot, regardless. 
       There is free wi-fi and cable, including HBO.
       The neighborhood has three historic music venues: The Riviera, The Aragon Ballroom, and the Green Mill Lounge - famous for being Al Capone's go-to back in the day (cash bar only). There's a Starbucks and other coffee shops within walking distance, and many different types of restaurants including Ethiopian, Mexican, Vietnamese and other Asian choices. 
I especially love the short 3/4 mile walk to Lake Michigan. There is so much to love here.
***IMPORTANT: Note my strict cancellation policy.
Also, check-out time in 12pm. Cleaning is done at 1pm.  IF you need to stay past noon, will be a $20 fee, payable via app / web transfer or cash, about which you and I will communicate should you need the extra time. Thank you for understanding!

In 2015, I hit the reset button on my life; or maybe it was life's hand on the button.   I was in the 26th year of a high paying but dissatisfying job that I was afraid to leave.  I was in the 25th year of a mutually unhappy relationship to which I felt some moral obligation to stay.  I had few friends. little energy and few interests outside of work.  In retrospect, I was depressed.  First, she found someone new.  Then, I was let go due to budget cuts.  Although that year was filled with uncertainty, all of the sudden I felt so much lighter.  My previously miserable existence was not brimming with opportunities (the opportunities had been there, I had just grown to not recognize them).  My mantra became a sort of "why not".  I gave up my car, most of my possessions. and moved to the home of a friend in Chicago.  I had a hobby rock and mineral shop located in The Chicago Mosaic School.  I started spending long hours there every day.  I started becoming helpful... cleaning up, organizing, locating materials, running errands.  Soon the school hired me on as their Operations Officer.  I started becoming sociable too...accepting and extending invitations to dinner, concerts, movies, evenings spent just hanging out.  Soon I had more friends than I'd known in the last 25 years.  Good friends.  The kind who will speak to your face the same way they speak of you when you are not present.  Now, thanks to one of those friends, I am in this fantastic apartment, close to The Chicago Mosaic School.  I'm back to doing the things I enjoy... listening to alternative music, rock and fossil collecting, camping, bird watching, gardening, and spending quality time with those friends.  Many of my guests are friends and artists who come to Chicago throughout the year in order to take classes at The Chicago Mosaic School.  I enjoy hosting them and spending entertaining evenings together. In a world made up of so much conflict and competition, I personally find it very encouraging to see people of different ages, genders, education, vocation and experience come together cooperatively under one roof and connect with one another for an evening or a few days.  I hope everyone who elects to stay here departs with a smile.

I was born and raised in downtown's Lakeview neighborhood. I've always loved exploring Chicago's many neighborhoods and enjoying our city's great restaurants.

Hi my name is naf I will be your host I will do my best to accommodate all your saying needs.

For me personally what it means to host is, knowing that someone is enjoying a space where I personally had my hands in creating.   This gives me a sense of accomplishment, I remember from my Restaurant my best memory was of the people that met each other, while working for me, now married and have beautiful childlren.
Laid back good times driven and enjoys meeting  people from all over

I love dogs, mac & cheese, traveling, and rereading the Harry Potter series. I love Airbnb as a traveler and have used it from Maine to Thailand. I'm excited to host guests and show them how wonderful Chicago is.

I'm a mid-20's software engineer focusing on building things to optimize my day to day and hopefully to make an impact on the world.

I enjoy nothing more than a warm day and a long bike ride, but if I can't do that you'll often find me with a pair of headphones and good music.

I'm slowly working on learning Spanish.  Someday I hope to spend a year or so living in South America.

I'm easy going and fast to reply.
Born and Raised CHICAGO. I work in Event Marketing, dabble in metalsmithing/jewelry making and I LOVE to travel!
I am a french super friendly man.

I'm a creative/corporate blend: digital marketer by day (for a global energy/electric company) and film critic/photographer by night (for an entertainment publication I've owned since 2007). As a host, I'm easy to live with and provide a safe, cozy and high-tech living space.

We love traveling to different places - whether it's hopping on the plane, roadtrips or through books and movies. As of far, I've been to 35 states. Internationally - Malaysia, Vietnam, Japan, China, and Canada.

We haven't hosted before but would like to let you to explore on your own. If you have any questions, just let us know!

Hi, my family and I live in Chicago, IL in the East Lakeview neighborhood. We are a family who loves to travel... the kids have already been to 5 countries and they are only 4 and 6. my family, my close relationships with friends, coffee in the morning, flowers, fresh food

Italy, the mountains, Paris

good guests, quiet, respectful, interested in the places we visit, new to airbnb

Life mottos: “Chaos precedes Evolution”
Easy going, career focused gent who likes to stay busy! Truly enjoy exploring new cities and countries.
Architect, artist and author. Looking for life’s next adventure.
Founder of two startups in the Chicago area. I have dual-degrees, one in Computer science and the other in Bioinformatics. Other than that, when I'm not being awesome, I'm being phenomenal.

Greetings and Salutations! 

Michael here, seasoned traveler and pioneering member of couchsurfing and a strong believer in the AirBnb charter. I spent 3 years going around the globe and several years bouncing around my home country, the US, and have made many friends along the way. 

I believe in leaving a space cleaner than I found it, and am a gracious, respectful and thankful visitor. and a warm and welcoming host!

Chicago, IL I love to travel! I have 2 rescued pit bulls. I am married to a Chicago police officer who occasionally helps me with hosting our Airbnbs.
My philosophy on life: I believe that EVERYONE has the right to pursue their dreams and passions and NOone has a right to tell you what to do as long as you aren't hurting anyone. I believe in diversity and learning about other's cultures and viewpoints. That's why I love to travel!

We have lived in Chicago for 10 years and love exploring the city's diverse neighborhoods and restaurants.

I have a little bit of a sweet tooth, so we are always on the lookout for a new bakery or chocolate shop. There are certainly plenty in Chicago.

The lake is nearby and we try to get outdoors as much as possible for walks even in the winter.

My husband Andy and are originally from the Northeast, but we're in Chicago to stay after relocating 10 years ago. We love Chicago's incredible museums and neighborhood gallery scenes, not to mention the amazing restaurants. We love to walk the city all year.

Not to miss: exhibitions at the MCA, the AIC, and smaller off-the-beaten-track institutions like the Graham Foundation, the Poetry Foundation (including a one-of-a-kind poetry library!), shows at Links Hall.

I'm an English as a second language teacher who loves traveling the world and meeting new people. I grew up just outside New York City but now live in Chicago with my dog, Taz. I love rock climbing, volunteering at a dog shelter, and going to museums. As a host I am available to give my guests advice so they can discover this amazing city!

Outgoing person who is a Host and renter. Love the city of Chicago and want my guest to feel the same. Very flexible and encourage you to ask me questions on what to do or where to go. No matter what your group you will enjoy your time here at my place and in this city. Make memories that last a lifetime.

Hello, we are Charles & Sarah. We are a French couple living in Chicago since september 2013. We are please to welcome you in our place!! We speak French, Spanish and English so do not hesitate to contact us..
A cozy place to stay in the heart of Logan square.

Growing up my mother ran a business placing students in homes around our neighborhood and I loved meeting new people that would stay with us all the time. I met people from around the world and had such a great experience I decided to go ahead and do something similar. I love meeting new people and hope to make some friends along the way!
I am a Chicago native and love this city. I love the diversity of the neighborhoods, the history and that there is always something to do.
I'm an avid reader and always have two book going, one fiction, one non-fiction-depending on my mood.
I am currently involved in a torrid affair with my Netflix account but pull myself away to go for a nice walk around the neighborhood or to a local restaurant. My goal this year is to try every Chinese restaurant within a 3 mile radius-there are a lot!
I'm an accountant but currently taking a break for family. I actually kinda miss doing taxes believe it or not. I'm the kind of person that needs to have a project or to be striving towards a goal in order to be at my best so I always have something going on, even small projects bring me peace.
I love trying new restaurants and I also love to cook. Making up my own recipes with whatever random items I have in my fridge is always fun. It usually turns out pretty good too!
This is just a scratch of the surface and I hope that it gives you an idea as to who I am. I can't wait to meet you and here about your journey.

Hi, thanks for checking out our home!  My husband and I bought our condo, May, 2016.  We love it so much, and would love to let others enjoy it too while we are out of town.  If you are interested in staying here, please feel free to contact me anytime.

We are a Chicago family that loves outdoor deck grilling and backyard playing.  We love music and our favorite family trip was to Turks and Caicos.  We believe that part of our lives as humans is our quest in making other people feel good.  Making the world a better place is what we teach our 4 yr old and 7 yr old one person at a time.  We welcome all people, all religions, and love to learn new things.

My motto in life "You're never going to get the butt you want by sitting on the butt you have"
In my fifties, widely traveled, well educated, early retired and still interested in all kinds of things life offers.
Pleasant-natured, like people, like to cook, read, work in the yard and have always an optimistic outlook on life.

Let's see...I love the outdoors, dogs, good food, running, dancing and traveling!
 I like to think I'm pleasant company and enjoy meeting new friends! I'm extremely considerate of others space and am generally very tidy in my own living space.  
When traveling I like spontaneity and generally exploring organically. Unarranged experiences always produce the most memories. I believe the key to happiness is having no expectations.
We love exploring Chicago and being a tourist in our own city. We like to seek out great restaurants, new breweries, wineries and coffee shops.

I love history, classical music (my daughter is a violinist), old movies, good wine & cheese and long walks. 
My wife Kathy and I like to see historical sites and explore places.

Dormigo is a property manager helping guests to have enjoyable and relaxing experiences when traveling! Booking a trip can be stressful; our hope is that some of that stress will melt away knowing that you will be staying in a beautiful apartment with help always around the corner when you need it!
World traveling couple who loves to host others! Hundreds of guests and counting, we’d love to welcome you to the beautiful city of Chicago!

After growing up in small town Wisconsin, the Air Force led me to Colorado, Texas, Florida and destinations east. I came back to Chicago for grad school and did not want to leave! 

Since my "day job" is flying for an airline, I have a flexible schedule and deep sympathy for travelers!

I love traveling, reading, flying and making the most of life.  I'm more of the pack-light, play it by ear traveler than a detailed itinerary, bring everything you might need.

Hello! I'm Miranda and that handsome man in the picture is my husband Igor. I’m a French enthusiast and I love baking and making beautiful meals for friends, family, and guests like you! Igor is a Mr. Fix It who loves road trips and can beat anyone at a round of US History trivia. Together we speak five languages (English, French, Russian, Spanish, and German) and have traveled quite a bit! 
We love hosting people from around the country or the world and hearing their stories of what brings them to our little neighborhood.

We both work a lot and spend a lot of time outside the house, but when I'm home, I love to cook dinner, snacks, or cookies for guests. 

If you’re more into exploring the neighborhood, Igor has lived in the area for almost 7 years so he gives the best recommendations on where to get the perfect cold craft beer, or richest cup of coffee, or the tastiest late morning brunch.

If you have any questions on us or the listing, feel free to message us. We can't wait to meet you! ^_^

I recently moved to Chicago after many years in Los Angeles where I also hosted Airbnb guests.  Cooking delicious meals at home and entertaining family and friends is a favorite pastime.  Extensive travel and a number of home exchanges, both in the United States and overseas, have presented many opportunities to meet new people and experience different cultures. With grown children who just return for holidays,  it's great to welcome visitors to share a spacious home!

We love living in Chicago and take advantage of everything it has to offer.  We live in East Lakeview and love dining out, going to the local bars, and walking to Wrigley Field.  During the summertime, you can find us with our two young children on our boat on Lake Michigan or Diversey Harbor.  

Eric is a die hard Michigan fan and grew up going to football games.  Beth is a Purdue graduate and they both love Big Ten sports.

We love traveling.  We enjoy visiting interesting places abroad and in the US, but our favorite way to travel is visiting or journeying with family and friends.
I love to travel , enjoy food & drink and spend time with my family.

host_location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

Born and raised in Des Moines, Iowa. Live in Chicago Illinois and loving the big city life!  I love to cook, and enjoy gardening and my cat Hans

Hi ! I've recently moved into this wonderful home after several years in the Chicago suburbs. I spent 24 years in Paris so my place has many touches of France, including some great French books! I love being active in the cultural fabric of the city and would be happy to help guests figure out the best things to do in the city. I love hosting people, and am so happy to have the perfect extra bedroom to accommodate travelers.
I'm an adventurous family man that lives in Chicago.  I great up in the US living in six different states.  I love to travel, host new people at my home and to make fun videos.

Chicago is an amazing city and I want to help make your stay here great.

Cheers!

I love dance, art, upcycling, biking, traveling and meeting new people.  I have a wonderful husband with whom we have 3 wonderful girls.  Were just out to explore the world and spread a little joy in the process. :)  We also loving sharing our city, Chicago, with those visiting.
Just a regular hard working, fun loving, easy going, low maintenance guy who prefers to support people than hotels when I have the privilege to travel.

about_host: I love hosting people from around the world and learning about their country, cities, back home experience what places to see, restaurants etc. Since I like to get away anytime I can.  I love discovering new places.

I’m a Kansan native in the Windy City. I enjoy a strong, flavorful cup of coffee and my beer the same. I attempt to iron chef in the kitchen and enjoy sharing my creations with guests. Hope you’ll stay in Hyde Park!

Hello, we are Adriana and Enrique.  We're a friendly, creative young couple living in Chicago's exciting Ukrainian Village neighborhood.

We love to host people and events with our friends, and are more than happy to share the space we have.. please make yourself at home.

Hi! I'm 32 years old, and I'm from Chicago! I love this city and all it has to offer. I work in the fitness industry as an HR Manager and love to stay active, listen to live music, and discover new restaurants.

Heyyy I'm Sammi! I am a hair color specialist and a salon manager. The beauty/hair industry is my passion. Lover of food, people and great energy. Momtrepreneur, proud wife and mommy of two , innovation manager, marketeer, globe trotter....over 40 countries and counting.

Hi there! 

We met at university in Washington, DC and lived there for 7 wonderful years before moving to the beautiful city of Chicago.

Hello there! Welcome to my home! I am a poet and theatre artist, so I am often touring the country for my job. My home is everything to me and I hope it is perfect for you too. I carefully  hand picked every little thing in this space to make it a magical and welcoming place to live (not to mention a pretty solid place for (Hidden by Airbnb) photos).

Please enjoy your stay.

My husband Andrew and I are legal aid attorneys in Chicago. We love this city and think it truly is the most beautiful city in the world. 

We love traveling, being in nature, and trying new coffee shops and breweries. We are always up for a challenge. Right now, we are training to run across the state of Washington to help bring food to refugees in southeast Asia.

I came to Chicago from the suburbs of NY as a teenager.  In a few years I realized how great this city is.  Since then, I have lived in this city: I have enjoyed our museums; I have cheered and jeered our sports teams; I have witnessed great live theatre, comedy and concerts.  
I am a life member of both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Sierra Club ---  and a member of the National Trust of Scotland and also Historic Scotland and many other civic and cultural groups.
Having had season MLB ticket in Chicago, yes, I've attended hundreds of MLB games in Chicago (including the first regulation Cub night game in 1988 and the 2007 Buehrle no hitter).  At age 20 I celebrated New Year's eve feasting on a sheep's head in Istanbul; I've also been to Beijing nine times to marvel at the Spring Festival fireworks;  I rode a white mule to the base of Grand Canyon, walked along the Continental Divide in Glacier Park, and shopped the casbah in Marrakesh. 
In the last 20 years Kathy and I have stayed in over 200 B & B's in England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland -- some great and some not -- enough places to know makes a trip special.
Yes, it all matters!  We care about the little things and the big things!

Our family lives right upstairs from our cozy airbnb 2 bedroom 1 bath whole apartment unit. We love guests from all over and we also love to travel. We are happy to help or keep quiet as much as you like. Our neighborhood is our pride. We lived in a condo across the alley for five years until we bought our new home to share with you. Ask us for suggestions! We are more than happy to share. I love gardening and am excited to redesign the front and back yard to share with you. We take full advantage of living in what we consider living in the best city in the world. We are a happy bunch and hope you can take part in our happiness! Welcome!

I've owned this building for almost 30 yrs. and in my spare time have personally renovated all of the units. So I guess that's my hobby. 
I've moved around the country for work over the past 20 years but held on to this place because I love it. It's rewarding to see how the neighborhood has blossomed in the past few years.

Chris and Todd have worked in the hospitality industry our whole lives.  Both serving as Captain's or Head waiters at Spiaggia have a passion and understanding of the finest Italian food and wine in the country.  New to Airbnb we feel we have created a clean, calm retreat which can serve as a romantic get away for 2 or 4 or accommodate 2 families with children traveling together.
CO-HOSTS
Super Hosts Jeff and Jennifer are no stranger to Airbnb.  Having run several since 2013 with a 5 star rating know exactly is what is expected of them and provide excellent response and welcoming charm and personality to each experience.
We have no reviews at this point because our first guests are staying for a month!  They are enjoying the space and neighborhood very much.

I'm a very active, creative person whose family enjoys travel, wildlife, boating, camping, cooking, dining out, live music, street festivals and more. I'm a local Realtor and a Airbnb user myself. I love to travel and meet new people during trips. You will enjoy visiting the many Chicago neighborhoods and exploring the amazing cultures that make up our city such as Sporting Events, Concerts, Museums, Zoos, Beaches, Festivals and my love of biking along Lake Shore Drive. I really enjoy trying new restaurants with friends and Chicago has some of the most delicious food in the world! I know all parts of the city and am happy to help you plan an itinerary and/or make suggestions of restaurants, attractions, etc. I have traveled around the world, but I really love coming home to my family and friends!
I am so fortunate to live in such an amazing, diverse and fun city and am excited to host your upcoming visit to Chicago.

Hi my name is Brendan. I am a US Army Veteran who is currently in school and work as a licensed building engineer in a commercial building downtown. I own the building and live in the second unit so if you ever need anything I'm close by. I put a lot of work into my place and take pride in the my unit and I want you to have the most comfortable stay as possible. My place is conveniently located between O'Hare airport and downtown. I am close to the Jefferson Park Blue line stop which connects directly to O'Hare airport and downtown.

I'm originally from Southern California but I've been living in Chicago for the past 5 years. I have a cat with one eye and I'm a communications specialist for work. My hobbies include photography, concerts, camping, traveling, and event planning.
I am in set design, write for a travel magazine, and teach rock climbing.
Professional guy, love traveling and new experiences.

host_location: My wife Cathy and I live in the building in the first floor apartment.

about_host:
I love to travel to new places! My favorite things to do in a new city are check out the dining and nightlife scenes along with learning the local history. 

As a guest, I'm a clean, neat professional and will treat your home as if it were my own! I am also an AirBnB host, so I will have the utmost respect for your property. 

More things I love: dancing, karaoke, craft beer, craft cocktails, outdoor dining, and TV. Yay!

Born and raised by a gaggle of bossy Italian ladies in Chicago, I now live on the north side of the city with my partner, Kevin, and our golden retriever, Sam. 

I love to travel and navigate more by food and cocktail than anything else. If there's good food and drink... there's bound to be good culture and interesting people.

We've stayed in some amazing places with our friends via Airbnb from beautiful farms in Michigan to a house on the top of a mountain in Costa Rica. Figured it was time to start booking these reservations myself. :)

Mars is a Physical Therapist by profession! She is also a student of Life, Traveler, Entrepreneur, and an Artist as well. Some of the artworks are also displayed in her listings. Mars' loves life and the journey that comes with it. She believes that we all have choices and we have the ability to make it or break it! Love wins!

IT professional who travels a good bit for work and pleasure, leaving a great apartment available and unused.  Let me know what I can do for you, respect my home, and enjoy all that the Second City has to offer... I love it here, yes... even in the winter.  I know you will too.

I'm originally from South Carolina but after 13 years Chicago is home and the winter is almost tolerable. I love the diversity and community in Chicago neighborhoods, the varied and accessible art scene, and all the wonderful things there are to eat—from the humble (or fancy) taco to the nation's top-rated restaurants. Even without salt water, summer here can't be beat: outdoor concerts, street festivals, farmer's markets, alfresco dining and rooftop drinking, and swimming and biking outside without freezing. When I'm not enjoying the city or traveling with my family, I work as a project manager at a custom training software company.

Hello! My name is Matt. I was born and raised in the Chicagoland area and I am a very friendly person. There are so many great places I can recommend for you to see as your host. From food, to night clubs, to live music venues, wine bars, sushi spots, jazz/blues clubs, piano bars, any many more, there are an overwhelming amount of things to see here in Chicago! I enjoy baseball, traveling, trying new food, and interacting with people of different cultures.
Actor, living and working within (and outside) Chicago :)

I love to travel and explore different places and countries. I have been to most of the European countries. Ireland is my favorite and have a thatched cottage in County Kerry that has been a labor of love. Animals are a big passion of mine and I have 3. I support Young at Heart which is a No Kill senior animal rescue. My family is a big part of my life. I am a single parent and my son was adopted from Russia when he was 4 years and 10 months. Blessed to come from a very loving family. I have 3 sisters and 1 brother. My beautiful mother Mary who is 86 works 5 days a week for our 58 year old family business. So does my brother Paul whos is the youngest. 
I was a member of the Guardsmen Drum and Bugle Corps from Schaumburg Il. I marched for 10 years and directed and taught this group for 17 years when the group had to dispand due to financial hardships. My younger brother and sister also marched in the group. My parents and sisters were involved in some way or another. In 2012 the Harty Family was inducted in to the Heartland Drum Corps Association Hall of Fame. The Guardsmen made the DCI World Championship Finals 4 times. The indoor winter colorguard made the WGI World finals 10 times and won a Bronze medal in 1981. I was one of the founders of the WGI organization. Needless to say I am blessed to have friends all over the country.

I'm a Video Producer who works with non-profits and artists currently living in Chicago. I grew up outside Kansas City, spent my college years in St. Louis, my first handful of adult years in NYC, and landed in Chicago - which so far feels like a pretty solid balance of all of the above. 

I love to travel, and I've been to upwards of 40 states (and counting) and a dozen countries (particularly drawn to eastern Europe - where my surname comes from). 

I also love meeting new people, and my style of travel is very people-driven and everyday-driven. I'll likely skip the museums and spend an entire afternoon in a neighborhood cafe or wandering the streets. 

Or chatting with my hosts or guests!
Chicago resident in love with adventure, startups, and good food.

I'm fairly laid back. I enjoy traveling, and exposing my daughter to new places.  Favorite places I have been - Istanbul, Venice, Helsinki, Guam.

If I had a life motto, it might be something like: Try to consider others as much as I consider myself.
World Traveler!

Hello, I am from Chicago. Will mostly be using Air B&B to book rooms for upcoming music tours. Have a few groups I tour with, mainly (Website hidden by Airbnb) and (Website hidden by Airbnb)

Hello! I'm a young professional working in downtown of Chicago who is also easy to get along with and accommodating.

I'm quite attention-to-detail and meticulous so whenever I travel or host, I make things as clean as they could be. Arriving to my place, you will find it fresh, clean, and fully accommodating. In case you have any question, I'm a text away. It's my pleasure with you being there, so welcome!

I'm a Bostonian at heart that loves Chicago.  I've been witness to the incredible growth in all areas since moving here in 1994.  Chicago is and always will be an international city with a comfortable Midwest down-home vibe.
The skyline views from my condo really put the architecture in to perspective... The old in the foreground and the new in the background.  Take it all in while doing yoga on the rooftop or in the yoga studio.  The kitchen is open and spacious to allow for many to join in the prep and execution of all the creative deliciousness. 
There's a wonderful, independent coffee shop just east over on Grand Ave., SIP Coffee.  Otherwise there is a Starbuck's 500 feet away on the corner of Grand and Elizabeth.  Terrific breakfast can be had at the original Breakfast Club just a few blocks away on Hubbard St.
And, if it's libations that you desire... The Matchbox is only 4 blocks north on Ogden at Milwaukee.  Be careful of the amazing, powdered sugar rimmed Margaritas.  They are killer.

Cheerful, respectful and ready to entertain any guests of mine who will come visit Chicago! LGBT friendly and we will have a good fun times during your stay as I will do within my power to best accommodate you!

Devoted to the arts & entertainment, I travel throughout the US helping clients implement Salesforce to connect with their customers. Running | Fitness | Health Nut | Friendly | Neat Freak | Independent | Sports Fan | Goodie Two Shoes | Young at Heart

I am a HUGE foodie, that loves to travel! I have been living in Chicago for over a year and love it. I am an avid conversationalist that loves hosting as well as being hosted!
I try my best to find, create, and decorate 5 star accommodation's that are 5 star experiences from the ground up, while maintaining the comfort of feeling the at "home" Vibe! I began my journey of travel at the tender age of 15, when my mother allowed me to travel to Quito Ecuador for a little over a month!
I have traveled, South America, Europe,  the Middle East and all over the USA and Canada! 
My journey with airbnb began a little over 2 years ago, and I have had the pleasure of hosting 3000+ global guests in this short period of time. I love staying at nice, clean places as I'm sure you will too! I have had a 90% positive guest response rate with most being 5 star guests, so I love to create an ultimate experience for all of my past, present, and future guests!
When you stay in any of my places I make myself readily available 24/7 no answering services or dashboards, I am the real deal.... Just me! Airbnb is an amazing opportunity to network and connect with the entire world and due to this wonderful platform I no longer book hotels (I prefer a CLEAN kitchen to cook in).
My passion for music trumps all other arts, from Bach, Mary, and Outkast... I love all types of artistry! I am always on the go but here when you need me day and night!
Chicago is my favorite city for food, it even beats NYC (and I am usually partial) lol being born and raised in NYC for the majority of my life! The carribean is by far my favorite travel destination, as I adore the sands and salt water!
My motto is "If at 1st you don't succeed, Dust yourself off and try again"!
I will do my very best to ensure your stay is 
1-Safe, 2-Clean, 3-Comfortable... 
Cheers

Artist, teacher, designer, cook, puppy owner, netflix watchin' lady who loves to make stuff. enjoying living a low stress, exciting life, in a vibrant, hip area of chicago.

come & go as you like, when you like, with whom you like, interact with me as much or as little as you'd like! My friendships are very diverse. I'm openminded &  enjoy most people. 420 friendly.

A stay here is CLEAN & COMFORTABLE, with access to whatever you need,  in & out of my apt., private, safe, warm & convenient. 

WiFi,  Netflix, firestick, apple tv, streaming, old school technology, laundry, incredible view, your OWN private entrance, decks, big yard, EZ close public transportation. 

Check in/out whatever time you like. I'll coordinate sufficient changeover time. Feel free to leave your suitcase. I don't care if you show up at 2am, 5am, 3pm, 8pm...

friends stop by, but mostly it's pretty low key for me. I welcome you as you are & will acclimate the space for your needs. You want to just chill. Do it. You are here to live it up and dance all night. Do it. You are moving here and need a place to crash in transition. Do it. Can't live without creating things, knowing good people, music, teaching and my pups! Do what u LOVE what u do is my Motto. 

Art, shopping, culture, food, drink, music... it's all right HERE (like, in the backyard). I feel like I'm on permanent vacation. Looking forward to your stay! DO IT. :-)
Living in Chicago, loving life and travel!

I am a native of MA and my husband is a transplant from Chicago! We love skiing in the winter up in Vermont and spending time at the beach in the summer in Maine. Our 10 year old son loves to play baseball and any other sport!

I am a lifelong resident of the Chicago area and have been in my current location for 10 years.  Although I adore my city, I love to travel, it makes me endlessly happy, I'm pretty good at planning fantastic getaways and don't mind doing all the work to make sure everyone has a wonderful time.  I've travelled to New Orleans and Mexico the most in my adult life, but excited to head to Cuba and Costa Rica for the first time next year.  I feel I've learned so much about hospitality from my grandma, who ran a bed and breakfast with my grandfather, in Ireland for 33 years, I only hope that I can be a 1/4 of the hostess and chef she was.  She's still kickin at 96!  I make playlists as often as I can based on anything that grabs me, thats a lot of different genres.  I am an avid reader (I prefer horror and fantasy and it's mostly through the Audible App), a prolific cook (I can cook/prepare 8+ meals a day with a strong variety and it's usually just at night), and I love to craft, my current favorite being cross stitch, where I stitch bitchy sayings and Morrissey lyrics, still learning how to stitch things other than words and borders.  My latest hobby is making terrariums, it's very calming.  I'm very familiar with the area, as well as other parts of the city including events, concerts and food.  I am currently creating my things to do and see list, stay tuned!  To sum up my life motto, I will quote the late Viv Savage "Have a good time all the time."

Hello and welcome!  My name is Madelaina. I grew up on the North Side of Chicago before moving to New York. Now I am back in my hometown, and I am excited and proud to have the opportunity to be your host in this amazing city and share my home with you.

Married and into language, music (blues! rock!), culture, food, architecture, design, & adventure. Born and raised in metro Detroit; lived in Georgia for 4 years and been a Chicagoan for 15+ years!

Can't live without: My wife & kid! My sonos system and obsessive music tastes (Pearl Jam, Soundgarden, Radiohead, Phish) and basic podcasts (Radiolab, How I Built This, Ted Radio Hour, Bigger Pockets & Marketplace). My mostly hidden poster/print/setlist collection. Experiences - I love doing big things!

Visitors to Chicago should not miss: The amazing park system (our motto is Urbs in Horto - City in a Garden) including the lakefront (City By The Lake anyone?) and its lakefront trail. Our museums are world class, especially the Art Institute of Chicago (AIC), Museum of Contemporary Photography (MoCP) and Museum of Contemporary Art (MCA) The music scene - specifically the amazing blues talent we have (look for my buddy and Delmark recording artist Toronzo Cannon when he's playing locally). Food! Coffee! Did we mention food? And have you tried the coffee? And, of course, the amazing architecture (I'm a big fan of Jeanne Gang's work). Last but not least, everyone loves the Second City but I gotta be honest: the Improv Olympic (the iO) is my favorite. There you can catch a “herald” and see some brilliant and clever long form improv (thanks to Del Close... read about him in our AirBnB!)
I live in Chicago where I was born and raised.  I like movies, traveling and reading and playing computer games.

My husband and I love living and raising our kids in Chicago!  We are big foodies and explore our city through our taste buds.

We are among the first hosts of Airbnb in Chicago since 2011. 

If you like to experience a safe and real Chicago neighborhood,  give us a try. Our rentals are in an older N Side building and therefore are priced lower. Please keep that in mind.  We provide a generous supply of towels, paper products, soaps, shampoos, fast Wifi, cold AC and warm heat, iron and board, kitchen access..etc. .  If you need anything extra, just ask and we should have it so you don't need to buy it.  i.e. travel light!

Over the years, we hosted many great people and developed awesome friendships.  However, a few guests thought they were renting a Hilton or Ritz Carlton in Chicago by paying a Motel 6 rate.    Please understand you are renting a regular home from a Chicago family.l  If you need Hilton , please book a Hilton, and expect to pay Hilton rates.  

We are in the health care industry and integrity is part of our daily routine. We use good common sense standard to take good care of our property and give you a great value for your travel budget. 

Thanks for considering us.

Laura

Hi I'm Evelyn, a Chicago native who’s also lived in New York City where I ran my massage therapy practice and studio and worked with people in music, film, fashion and art. 

I've done a fair amount of travel and have recently landed in my friend's one hundred year old building in the Rogers Park neighborhood on the Northside of Chicago. Between being steps away from the beach, the friendly culturally diverse neighborhood, and the up and coming restaurants and cafes, I'm enjoying my lovely spacious nest. 

I've always liked addressing spaces in ways that speak to the function of each room making the environment fun to be in. I continue to style people mainly from my collection.

I spent four years running Open Secret Studios with the purpose of supporting art, culture and humanitarian causes. I rented out the space for photography, video and private events to support the things I care about. I became adept at providing a beautiful backdrop and keeping clients happy before, during, and after event experiences. I hope to do the same for you here. 

I am offering my home to travelers and am happy to give you space and share information about events going on around town. I have lived all over the city from Downtown to the Westside to Fulton Market and have found Rogers Park appealing on many levels without the pretension. I love living so close to the lake and look forward to discovering historic architecture on my walks through the neighborhood.

I practice yoga and meditation as well as swim, hike, bike, and make art in my  studio in the house. I make collage and mosaic from old ceramic pieces and plates found on beaches all over the world. I also work in textiles. 

In the future, I would love to find myself part of a group creating an upscale communal environment with a garden, private and public spaces, studios, and  indoor and outdoor spaces to host speakers, film makers, musicians and chefs to engage the community.

Cultural and social exchange.

The travel bug was in me the day I was born.  I'm serious.  Six months after my birth, I moved from the east coast to the west coast and then at the age of two I flew overseas and bounced around for a few years before coming back to the states. All of this was done before the age of five and that was only the beginning.  
You know that question you're always asked when trying to find your purpose in life.  When your counselor asks, "If you had all the money in the world, what would you do?"  The answer.  I would travel.
Grant it, one unfortunately does need money for the most part to travel. So I've picked up a few other meaningful projects in my life, called jobs.  :) 
Overall, I'm a pretty easygoing host and traveler.  I've stayed in my share of hostels, B&Bs, and hotels.  So I look forward to future hosting and travel opportunities with Airbnb.  

I also have this pretty fabulous guy in my life now that likes to travel too and so we are both looking forward to hosting our place and welcome you to check it out!

Our favorite movies are children movies because of the kids lol and we love Scarface and Godfather trilogies, rap and Spanish music, and Italian food (check my guide for authentic spots, the rest are Olive Gardens in disguise).

As a host, we want to be able to fix any short comings you have, please be upfront with us and share and we can explain or help the situation. We are disappointed that the City of Chicago has forbidden us from leaving you food and beverage niceties, because we would love nothing more than to help your stay be the best!

As a guest, we are super respectful of rules and homes we stay in. We spotlessly (well my husband) clean and make sure the kids are well behaved and watched. We do not complain. We are not needy. We will not leave bad reviews because we understand that you are opening up your home to our family and we want to treat you and your home and your livelihood on Airbnb with the utmost respect. 

Our family believes in hard work, acting and dressing like ladies and gentlemen, being open to new ideas and strategies, big picture, setting high goals, hiring to achieve those goals, perseverance, Church, family time, fashion, dressing well (not comfortably), never giving up, being kind, helping others, being unabashedly dedicated to the cause of educating and helping young families with expenses associated with child rearing and bearing.
