Chicago is one of my favorite cities in the world - I hope you enjoy your stay.  

A few of my local picks:

1)  Schubas is a great nearby live music venue with an intimate atmosphere.  It's a diverse line-up - check the day to see if it is your thing.
2) Sheffield's is a good casual spot to grab a bite on the way to / from a Cubs game, if you're looking to escape the biggest crowds.... 
3) In the cooler months, the nearby 404 Wine Bar is a cozy place to linger around a fireplace...
4)  If you're looking to save some $$, there are several good BYOB restaurants with no corkage fee in the neighborhood (Home Bistro, Tango Sur...)
5) If you've never been to Chicago before, head over to the lakefront path for a walk or a run, and try not to miss the architectural tour on the river.  It may sound touristy, but don't let that put you off - it is definitely worth doing.

Please enjoy!

We found there is indeed truth to the phrase 'labor of love', and we couldn't be more proud of the work we've accomplished.  

Our professional careers revolve around sustainability & we try to lead our lives as close to our environmentally friendly values as we can while still leading modern, robust lives. In other news, I also love reading, dogs, being warm, a good Netflix binge, hot yoga, cars, business and dancing! I strongly dislike expensive hotels, dirty or messy places, rude people, social injustices, following society's norms or "rules," lima beans, and hot dogs.

J'aime lire, écrire, me promener, dormir avec mon chat, et dormir dans le soleil. J'ai écrit trois romans; j'ai étudié le grec et le latin à l’université Paul Valéry en 2006-2007. about_host:
I grew up in a small town in rural Iowa; and although I'm still an Iowan at heart, Chicago is--and will always be--home. I love the Cubs (and sports in general), live music, good beer, documentaries, beach vacations, farm sanctuaries, and watching my daughter play soccer. 

Visitors to Chicago shouldn't miss: Wrigley Field, Montrose dog beach, the Riverwalk, the Art Museum, Lincoln Park Zoo, dinner at Sunda, brunch at Summer House, drinks at J. Parker or London House, and shopping on Armitage, Michigan, or Damen Aves.

We are adventure-seekers, avid travelers and food lovers! Some of our favorite destinations include Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Belize, Nashville TN, Ashville NC, Austin TX, Moab UT,  Boston MA, Bar Harbor ME and the entire state of Michigan!  

David is originally from The Gambia in West Africa and has lived in Chicago for 20 years. Traci grew up in Central Illinois but has called Chicago home for over 10 years. We are both accountants and are passionate about our work at non-profit organizations in Chicago. 

We enjoy meeting new people and hearing about their travels. We are always looking for recommendations for our next trip!
I'm a world traveled entrepreneur and Global Business Manager for Wipro Technologies.

I was born and raised in La Paz, Bolivia but I now live and work in Chicago as a graphic designer. I'm passionate about travel and I love airbnb--I've hosted people in my own place. I think it's a great (and affordable) way to get an immersive local experience of a place.

I so look forward to my future travels as well as meeting my hosts!

I have heard my friends refer to me as being: awake, engaged, warm, intense, and vibrant.

I think the world is full and complicated and that beauty is having much more to do with developing the ability to negotiate these dynamics with complexity and care than finding a way to describe things simply.

I'm an artist, I like to see shows...I love to talk about ideas, and to eat and drink while talking about ideas.

I like to chill hard and try to live the good life. :)

Greetings from Team Vacasa! Yes, we're a professional property management company—but we're also real people, trusted by the owners of vacation homes to take care of all the heavy lifting like housekeeping, reservations, maintenance, and guest care. (Because, to be honest, renting out a vacation home really can be a full-time job!)

We have local teams on the ground to take care of our homes and our guests. We like to think of it as the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, only without compromising on service and convenience. You can trust that your home will be cleaned by professional housekeepers, and your calls will be answered (right away, around the clock!) by our dedicated Guest Services team. 

Check out our listings, and if you have any questions, get in touch! We'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

On the one hand I am a lawyer by background and a real estate owner/manager and on the other hand I love to travel. I have a lot of interests, particularly in the sciences, and have spent time in both corporate America and as a community activist.  I don't drink, smoke or take drugs but I don't judge those who do.  I'm always interested in hearing about and experiencing things outside my own life in Chicago.

"For what it's worth: it's never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There's no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. Come football season you can find us at Fat Pour right down the street devouring Cheese Curds (new obsession) and cheering for the 49ers from a far. We also love that our neighborhood is a few blocks from the Blue Line Train which is only a few stops from Millennium park and all that Downtown has to offer.

We're constantly hosting friends from our former college home town of San Jose as well as family from Utah and San Francisco. We put our our apartment together to not only host gatherings but also to have a place for guests to stay comfortably. We hope you will enjoy your stay too!

My husband was born and raised in Pilsen and together we have happily raised our family in the neighborhood. We bought our first home in 2008 and have enjoyed watching the progression. Pilsen is a unique place that you have to experience yourself to truly appreciate. 

We enjoy traveling and have traveled   through Europe and to our native countries of Colombia and Mexico many times. We travel with our children as we love them to experience different cultures and cities.

I've lived, worked, or traveled to many major cities in many countries but rank Chicago at or near the best it gets. Never ending list of places to see and activities to do but really it's about the people, who are at heart genuine and true. 

I love to explore the wonders of the world and/or chase a few more of those bucket list items, but also happy to kickback and binge watch my way through full seasons on Netflix on a cold snowy winter day.  Conversely, give me an exceptional IPA or Sour on a warm sunny day and I will most likely don a massive smile. 

I wish you all safe but exciting travels and hope we cross paths soon...

Hello, my is Cameron im a i.t technician & small time investor. I love building things in the tech world and technological advances in general. We love meeting people and we're more than happy to show you the best Chicago has to offer! Our love of travel, food, art and counter-culture is what brought us together. As a couple we love traveling and spontaneity is what we live for. Our first trip together was a last minute getaway to Morocco and we've been together ever since. Raquel is from Chicago but lived in Glasgow, Scotland for 8 years it's a huge part of her life with yearly trips to Scotland always firmly in the calendar. When it comes to hosting we find we get along best with seasoned travelers who are down to earth and spontaneous. We tend not to be able to accept bookings far in advance because we don't know when we might want to head out of town ourselves. We also find it works out better if guests have some idea of where they'd like to go, it'll help us point them in the right direction. With that said, local thrift stores, hidden breakfast spots, local boutiques and dive bars are our specialty; so we will have lots of recommendations. We don't spend a lot of time downtown, so if that's where you'll be hanging out we're NOT the hosts for you. If you'd like to see what downtown has to offer we suggest staying, well, downtown.  When we're not exploring our own city we're on a plane headed to a land far, far way.
Jason from Chicago.  Love to travel, explore architecture, take in a show, and play poker.

I am a 62 year old widower and I work for a risk management consulting firm in Chicago. I travel often, both domestically and internationally for days and sometimes weeks at a time. I am an engineer by degree but my field of work is in fire protection and safety. I like all kinds of music and am a big fan of old movies. TCM is my favorite television station, although I don't watch much TV other than local sports. I enjoy working with wood and am collecting a fair amount of tools, but since I work a lot, I don't have much free time. I hope to do more when I retire in 5 or 10 years. I live in an upstairs of an old house that was extensively remodeled a few years back. The owners of the unit are my daughter, son-in-law who used to live downstairs so I also spent free time with them until they moved to a larger house. They introduced me to Airbnb as they have been doing it for a few months and really seem to like it. If I have a life motto, it would be something I heard a while back, "that someday you realize you regret the things you didn't do more than those you do"!

Hi everyone!! My goal is to create environments that make guests feel like they have a second home while they are in town. I'm happy to help you out with any special requests that you may have during your visit. I look forward to hosting and making others have a great experience. See you soon :)

Large and accomodating 2 bedroom garden apartment that is shared with my wife and I. You will have your own private room. My wife is also an avid cook and does most of the maintainance/cleaning in the house so you can reach out to her as well. We love it here and would love to answer any questions or concerns you may have about Chicago! We are new to Chicago and love Hyde park. It’s a gorgeous neighborhood close to the water. The express 6 bus takes you directly downtown and so do the green/red lines. A car is a ten minute ride easily though I don’t recommend driving for cost and difficulty of parking. 

Airbnb gives us the chance to stay in a place with personality and we hope that's why you've chosen to stay with us too.

Hello, Travelers!  Welcome to your temporary home in Chicago!  We love our location near Hyde Park, the University of Chicago, the Lake and the Parks and just over 10 minutes to downtown Chicago via the Lake.  

Our family of four takes full advantage of the walking and bike trails in the area. We also frequent nearby Hyde Park, for its distinctive and unique offerings and to hopefully, run into a friend or two.

We still love to road trip but our favorite trips are with our extended family.  Last year 20+ family members descended upon San Pedro, Belize.  This year less exotic Washington, DC is on the list.

Because I have Lupus and Rheumatoid Arthritis I am an licensed Illinois Medical Cannabis patient.  I live a healthy lifestyle which includes being gluten free.  You probably won't find any gluten in my place.  I encourage and teach others how to incorporate health into their lives.

We all love to read and take books with us on vacation.  Sometimes we wing it, just start driving and book from the road with a last minute hotel app.  Sometimes we plan a year in advance.

I've only had two guests but I love hosting!  I am so into creating a great experience for people, I am looking forward to each and every guest.  I'm very friendly and talkative, however, I intend to disappear so guests can create their own memories.

One of my many mottos:  Eat dessert first.

Hey! I've been living in Chicago for thirteen years with a few working assignments in Denver, Nashville and Milwaukee.  I'm currently living with my two cute bassetty pups Olive and Otis. I love to cook, travel, read, entertain and explore new neighborhoods around the city!  

I love meeting new people and I`ll be happy hosting you in my home.

I look forward to meeting you! After all, life is short so live awesome!

From Chicago and headed around the world. I love traveling to great cities for at a comfortable, affordable pace. I work in the movie industry as a lighting technician and want to spend every bit of time not working traveling.

If you are a foodie, you are in luck.  Sports or music?  We got it.  If you like culture and museums, this is the city for you.  

We do some traveling and hosting with Airbnb.  Since we have kids it has been a bit more of the former as of late.  Looking forward to showing them the world once they are old enough.

Hello World,
I'm Carolyn, and I would like to meet you.
I have a big, cool quirky house where I live on the first floor, which is way too quiet when guests are not here. Come and stay in the full apartment upstairs-it's like Alice in Wonderland but with lots of chandeliers. I think having a sense of humor is so important-laughing is good for the soul. I enjoy being surrounded
by beauty like sparkling crystal lights and bright happy colors, and take great care in providing a safe, love-filled place to stay. There will always be peace here inside and out - no street noise or traffic. Positive and encouraging your experience will be.
I am the always-available host who will give you the tour of your apartment when you arrive, showing you how to work the Keurig coffee maker and how to find Netflix on the flat screen TV, and just generally help you enjoy wonderful Chicagoland.  I have been remodeling for 6 months, everything is new and fresh and waiting.
I have been in the service industry for 30 years (restaurants), and my style is to do unto others as I would like done for me.  I am a thoughtful and good person and I open my home to meet others who want a new friend (or just a place to sleep).
Call me-I'll help you figure it out : )

In 2014 I had an ankle replacement that has given me my life back. 

Greg is a graphic designer, web developer, and a musician. He is originally from central Illinois but has been in Chicago with me since 2002.

I've lived in Chicago for over 20 years and love the neighborhood life. I am a 64 year old gay male living on the NW side of Chicago, Illinois. I teach English for Academic purposes at a community college and manage ESL and High School Equivalency classes. I am very serious, yet I laugh shamelessly. Usually the joke is on me. I love my species, movies, gardening, cooking, reading and writing. My favorite activity is listening to someone tell me everything about themselves from their life story to what gets them excited about being alive. I studied counseling in my early years and changed my major to education. I have never regretted it. It's been a great life. 

I walked in my first Gay Pride Parade in Chicago, Illinois in June 1971. There were only a few hundred present at the time. Today, the total amount of attendees nears one million. We are living in good times. I consider myself a cheerleader for our species.

If you need any help getting around or need a few suggestions on closeby hidden gems, please feel free to reach out to me.

Our family LOVES to travel!  We feel refreshed after our vacations and can't wait to plan the next!  It is important for us to spend time with each other creating happy moments that we will cherish forever.

I've been living in Chicago close to 7 years now and I still find new things to love about it every year. I'm originally a Miami girl and I moved out here to attend Shimer college. Weird little Great Books school. So, if you ever feel the itch to discuss Kant while on vacation, I'm your dude. Besides that stuffy sounding bit of info about myself, I like going out to different bars in the city (I know a lot of good ones, ask!). I love a bar with character, a neighborhood hole in the wall with shots and beers and history. There's also a lot of really great fancy pants cocktail joints in the city I can point you to. Chicago has a pretty crazy food and drink scene right now so you should definitely experience that in some capacity while you're in the city. The music scene is also "tippy top." I love going out dancing in this city, it's a real music nerd's paradise. Smart Bar and Danny's are always bumpin'. And there's always free shows at Empty Bottle on Monday nights that are worth checking out. In short, I enjoy food, drinking, dancing, and intensive introspection above all things - I'm a real hoot.

Born and raised in Chicago. I love the el and I embrace all four seasons. I moved here after college 10 years ago and have never looked back.

Things I can't live without: coffee, boba tea, cookies, brunch, and pasta. Basically caffeine and carbs. 

I also love to visit new places; I've traveled to to 35 countries across 5 continents, and 28 states, and I'm always planning my next adventure. But, no matter where I go, my heart belongs to Wicker Park. This little vibrant neighborhood is just a few stops away from the heart of Chicago, and boasts some of the best spots for drinks, bites, and shopping, all within walking distance. 

While you're visiting Chicago, don't miss: the architectural boat tour, the Art Institute (the Modern Wing is my favorite), a cocktail at the Violet Hour (worth the wait), tacos at Big Star or Antique Taco, and dinner and a drinks on a rooftop with a skyline view.

We're a loving couple with a passion for travel, food, and architecture- which is why we live in this magnificent city! Nico is originally from Arizona and I'm from the suburbs of Chicago. We met as Nico was finishing up his MBA at Notre Dame (he'll  keep you posted on any sports events taking place during your visit).  I'm currently receiving my Master in Architecture degree at The School of the Art Institute of Chicago (which is why I'm the perfect guide for all you art/museum lovers).   We couldn't think of a better place to live than Chicago!

FUN FACTS ABOUT CHICAGO:
-Chicago is home to over 40 museums, more than 150 theaters, and over 6,000 restaurants
-The world's largest public library, Harold Washington Library Center, with a collection of more than 2 million books, is in Chicago.
-Roller skates, steel frame skyscraper, elevated railway, cracker jacks, zipper, window envelope, hostess Twinkie, pinball game and spray paint were invented in Chicago.
-More than 200 annual parades take place in the city of Chicago every year.
-Oceanarium, in Chicago, is the largest indoor marine mammal pavilion in the world.
-Chicago is home to one of the last free zoos in the world, the Lincoln Park Zoo.
-Chicago River is the only river in the world that flows backwards. However, the flow was reversed by the engineers in 1900.
-The Chicago Cultural Center is the first free municipal cultural center in the US. It is also home to the largest Tiffany Dome in the world.
-The Art Institute of Chicago is home to the largest collection of Impressionist paintings in the world, apart from the Louvre (Paris).
-Alone in the metropolitan Chicago area there are more than 30 Fortune 500 companies.
-The first planetarium in the entire Western Hemisphere known as the Adler Planetarium was opened in Chicago in 1930.
-The World’s biggest outdoor food-fest is held in Chicago, known as the ‘The Taste of Chicago’.


We're very excited to share our home with other travelers and will send you recommendations of whatever it may be that you want to explore while here: Museums, Parks, Concerts, Tours, Restaurants, Bars,  Festivals, Sports Games, Architecture, etc!!!   You let us know what you want to see and we'll make sure it's on your itinerary! (:

I grew up in suburbs of Chicago but spent 10 years in Hawaii. Get asked all the time why I'd move back from paradise but Chicago is hands down my favorite place to live. I'm excited to share the city with you!

I was raised in Chicago, very close to neighborhood that I live in now. I am still the Chicagoan who will always say Sear's Tower and can tell you the real reason why we are called the "Windy City." Welcome to our Airbnb page, we're Hostie, the future of vacation rental management. We partner with local Superhosts and owners around the world to deliver you the perfect vacation rental property every time. 

Hostie is different! 
We offer stress-free bookings because that's how vacations should be. We understand that plans change and although many booking websites collect the money directly from the guest we want to do our best to help you when the unforeseen happens. This is why we offer "Hostie Credits". If your future travel plans change you can use these credits with us towards future accommodations and guess what, it never expires!  Now if only all airlines would offer credits without penalties :) 

What else do you get? I am happy you asked! Our professional hospitality team, work with the local Superhosts 24/7 to answer inquiries or assist you if you have a problem. 

We love helping guests!  If you have any questions about our properties or need help finding one, please do reach out.

I have traveled the world with Airbnb over the years and it's been a great way to see a new city.  Now that my wife and I have a place of our own, we are trying out the hosting side of Airbnb.  

I've lived in Chicago since 2014 and I love the city.  The public transportation is one of the best in the country.  There are tons of museums and festivals to explore.  We have miles of lakefront parks and a great bike path that connects them all.  When it's warm, the beaches in Chicago are just as nice as either ocean coast, and it's all fresh water.

We are spoiled here with the food scene as well.  There's everything from Michelin star restaurants to those little hole in the wall places that actually have really good food.  Chicago has neighborhood pubs as well as fancy rooftop clubs downtown.  It just really depends what you are into.  

It's frigid cold for more months out of the year than I would prefer, but the summer/fall is wonderful.  I always joke that if the city of Chicago happened to be a little farther south like Atlanta, no one would want to live anywhere else.  And despite what the media says, Chicago is actually a very safe place.  I've never felt uneasy or threatened walking around at night.  The dangerous pockets that always make headline news tend to be centralized in very specific south/west neighborhoods.  And when visiting the city, there is no reason to go anywhere near those neighborhoods.  

When we are in the city, I like doing the usual things on the weekend.  Going out to brunch on Saturday or Sunday.  Bike riding.  Hanging out at the beach, or on my friend's rooftop patio.  I'm a bit of a board game nerd too so when the weather is rough, my wife and I like hosting friends and family over for dinner and games.  I have an appreciation for weird crafty beers, so there's usually something interesting in my fridge.  We like to grill in the back patio.  

Feel free to reach out if you have any other questions.

Steve

I love to travel abroad, eat wow cuisine, hang with friends, and get good rest.  My new desired destination is Italy (Amalfi Coast and south region).  I like listening to people much more than talking.  I love a bowl of popcorn and a good book.  I like taking and looking at good photography.  I am excited about hosting individuals/families that may be visiting Chicago.  I also like when I can get away and stay in an airbnb myself.  My mentality is I am trying to live my best life in harmony with others.  I am very open and accepting of people from diverse backgrounds.  My home is quiet and peaceful space and I want to share that experience with others.

Hello! My name is David and

I am are retired Chicago Public School Principal who believes in the importance of learning about other cultures, people and languages. 'La Casita' is located a block from the elementary school I worked at and allows me to keep in contact with the development of school programs, friends and community. We love soaking in summer in Chicago riding bikes on the lakefront or catching a movie in the park. When we're at home, you can find us watching cooking or nature shows on Netflix with our two cats.

I like to see the world through the lens of a local. I don't want to visit a new city and only see all the tourist spots; I want to see the hidden gems and waste no time finding the heart and soul of a city. I usually like to cap the trip with a nice dinner or some kind of show.

I am a movie buff, a music lover and a sports fanatic. I attended the summer Olympics in London and met some amazing people using Airbnb while out there. I enjoy finding book and record stores to add to my ever growing collection. 

Most importantly, please do not hesitate to ask any questions you may have.

Hi there! I'm an avid traveler who loves to meet different people and see new things. Although I'm not often at my apartment, when I am, I'm a conversationalist who appreciates a natural good time. Enjoy our city.  Welcome!

Megan and I are eager to  host guests from around the world, as they visit Chicago for business and/or pleasure.

As a nonprofit professional in Chicago, I have a thorough understanding of the city's neighborhoods, cultures and experiences. To be sure, Chicago is much more than a city with big buildings--it offers diverse neighborhoods that encourage exploration. 

As an Airbnb Host, my guest can expect clean, comfortable and private accomodations, as well as a quick response time.
